  2472 0000127B 00                      		db 0
  2473                                  
  2474                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2475                                  ; Possibly disposable data, goes at end of data group
  2476                                  ;***************************************************************************
  2477                                  
  2478                                  ; Possibly disposable data, goes at end of data group
  2479                                  
  2480                                  ;***	ibm_disk_io - main routine, fixes at rom bug
  2481                                  ;
  2482                                  ;	entry:	(ah) = function, 02 or 0a for read.
  2483                                  ;		(dl) = drive number (80h or 81h).
  2484                                  ;		(dh) = head number.
  2485                                  ;		(ch) = cylinder number.
  2486                                  ;		(cl) = sector number (high 2 bits has cylinder number).
  2487                                  ;		(al) = number of sectors.
  2488                                  ;		(es:bx) = address of read buffer.
  2489                                  ;		for more on register contents see rom bios listing.
  2490                                  ;		stack set up for return by an iret.
  2491                                  ;
  2492                                  ;	exit:	(ah) = status of current operation.
  2493                                  ;		(cy) = 1 if failed, 0 if successful.
  2494                                  ;		for other register contents see rom bios listing.
  2495                                  ;
  2496                                  ;	uses:	
  2497                                  ;
  2498                                  ;
  2499                                  ;	warning: uses old13 vector for non-read calls.
  2500                                  ;		does direct calls to the at rom.
  2501                                  ;		does segment arithmatic.
  2502                                  ;
  2503                                  ;	effects: performs disk i/o operation.
  2504                                  
  2505                                  ; 16/10/2022
  2506                                  ; 28/05/2019
  2507                                  cmd_block equ 42h ; ROMBIOS DATA segment (40h) offset 42h ; 13/12/2022
  2508                                  
  2509                                  ;* offsets into cmd_block for registers
  2510                                  
  2511                                  pre_comp equ 0	;write pre-compensation
  2512                                  sec_cnt	 equ 1	;sector count
  2513                                  sec_num	 equ 2	;sector number
  2514                                  cyl_low	 equ 3	;cylinder number, low part
  2515                                  cyl_high equ 4	;cylinder number, high part
  2516                                  drv_head equ 5	;drive/head (bit 7 = ecc mode, bit 5 = 512 byte sectors, 
  2517                                  		;            bit 4 = drive number, bits 3-0 have head number)
  2518                                  cmd_reg  equ 6	;command register
  2519                                  
  2520                                  ; 01/10/2022
  2521                                  disk_status1	equ 74h
  2522                                  hf_num		equ 75h
  2523                                  control_byte	equ 76h
  2524                                  
  2525                                  ibm_disk_io:				
  2526 0000127C 80FA80                  		cmp	dl, 80h		; main routine,	fixes at rom bug
  2527 0000127F 720A                    		jb	short atd1	; pass through floppy disk calls. 
  2528 00001281 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2
  2529 00001284 740A                    		jz	short atd2	; intercept call 02 (read sectors).
  2530 00001286 80FC0A                  		cmp	ah, 0Ah
  2531 00001289 7405                    		jz	short atd2	; and call 0Ah (read long).
  2532                                  atd1:
  2533 0000128B 2EFF2E[0601]            		jmp	far [cs:Old13]					
  2534                                  		;jmp	cs:Old13	; use rom int 13h handler
  2535                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2536                                  
  2537                                  atd2:					
  2538 00001290 53                      		push	bx
  2539 00001291 51                      		push	cx
  2540 00001292 52                      		push	dx
  2541 00001293 57                      		push	di
  2542 00001294 1E                      		push	ds
  2543 00001295 06                      		push	es
  2544 00001296 50                      		push	ax
  2545 00001297 B84000                  		mov	ax, 40h		; bioseg (rombios data segment)
  2546                                  					; establish bios segment addressing
  2547 0000129A 8ED8                    		mov	ds, ax
  2548                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2549 0000129C C606740000              		mov	byte [disk_status1], 0
  2550                                  		;mov	byte ptr ds:74h, 0 ; [disk_status1]
  2551                                  					; initially no error code.
  2552 000012A1 80E27F                  		and	dl, 7Fh		; mask to hard disk number
  2553 000012A4 3A167500                		cmp	dl, [hf_num]
  2554                                  		;cmp	dl, ds:75h	; [hf_num] ; 40h:75h
  2555 000012A8 7207                    		jb	short atd3	; disk number in range
  2556                                  		;mov	byte ptr ds:74h, 1 ; bad_disk
  2557 000012AA C606740001              		mov	byte [disk_status1], 1
  2558 000012AF EB20                    		jmp	short atd4	; disk number out of range error,
  2559                                  					; return
  2560                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2561                                  
  2562                                  atd3:					
  2563 000012B1 53                      		push	bx
  2564 000012B2 8CC0                    		mov	ax, es
  2565 000012B4 C1EB04                  		shr	bx, 4		; make es:bx to seg:000x form.
  2566 000012B7 01D8                    		add	ax, bx
  2567 000012B9 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  2568 000012BB 5B                      		pop	bx
  2569 000012BC 83E30F                  		and	bx, 0Fh
  2570 000012BF 0E                      		push	cs
  2571 000012C0 E8DF00                  		call	check_dma
  2572 000012C3 720C                    		jb	short atd4	; abort if dma across segment boundary
  2573 000012C5 58                      		pop	ax
  2574 000012C6 50                      		push	ax
  2575 000012C7 E81A00                  		call	setcmd		; set up command block for disk op
  2576 000012CA BAF603                  		mov	dx, 3F6h	; hf_reg_port 
  2577 000012CD EE                      		out	dx, al		; write out command modifier
  2578 000012CE E86B00                  		call	docmd		; carry out command
  2579                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2580                                  
  2581                                  atd4:	
  2582                                  
  2583                                  ;  new code - let logical or clear carry and then set carry if ah!=0
  2584                                  ;	      and save a couple bytes while were at it.
  2585                                  				
  2586 000012D1 58                      		pop	ax
  2587                                  		;mov	ah, ds:74h	; [disk_status1]
  2588 000012D2 8A267400                		mov	ah, [disk_status1]
  2589 000012D6 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
  2590 000012D8 7401                    		jz	short atd5
  2591 000012DA F9                      		stc
  2592                                  atd5:					
  2593 000012DB 07                      		pop	es
  2594 000012DC 1F                      		pop	ds
  2595 000012DD 5F                      		pop	di
  2596 000012DE 5A                      		pop	dx
  2597 000012DF 59                      		pop	cx
  2598 000012E0 5B                      		pop	bx
  2599 000012E1 CA0200                  		retf	2		; far return, dropping flags
  2600                                  
  2601                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2602                                  
  2603                                  ;***	setcmd - set up cmd_block for the disk operation
  2604                                  ;
  2605                                  ;	entry:	(ds) = bios data segment.
  2606                                  ;		(es:bx) in seg:000x form.
  2607                                  ;		other registers as in int 13h call
  2608                                  ;	
  2609                                  ;	exit:	cmd_block set up for disk read call.
  2610                                  ;		control_byte set up for disk operation.
  2611                                  ;		(al) = control byte modifier
  2612                                  ;
  2613                                  ;	sets the fields of cmd_block using the register contents
  2614                                  ;	and the contents of the disk parameter block for the given drive.
  2615                                  ;
  2616                                  ;	warning: (ax) destroyed.
  2617                                  ;		does direct calls to the at rom.
  2618                                  
  2619                                  setcmd:		; proc near		
  2620                                  		;mov	ds:43h,	al	; [cmd_block+sec_cnt]
  2621                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2622 000012E4 A24300                  		mov	[cmd_block+sec_cnt], al
  2623                                  		;mov	byte ptr ds:48h, 20h ; [cmd_block+cmd_reg]
  2624 000012E7 C606480020              		mov	byte [cmd_block+cmd_reg], 20h ; assume function 02h (read)
  2625 000012EC 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2
  2626 000012EF 7405                    		jz	short setc1	; cmd_reg = 20h	if function 02h	(read)
  2627 000012F1 C606480022              		mov	byte [cmd_block+cmd_reg], 22h
  2628                                  		;mov	byte ptr ds:48h, 22h ; [cmd_block+cmd_reg]
  2629                                  					; cmd_reg = 22h	if function 0Ah	(read long)
  2630                                  setc1:					
  2631 000012F6 88C8                    		mov	al, cl
  2632 000012F8 243F                    		and	al, 3Fh		; mask sector number
  2633                                  		;mov	ds:44h,	al	; [cmd_block+sec_num]
  2634                                  		;mov	ds:45h,	ch	; [cmd_block+cyl_low]
  2635 000012FA A24400                  		mov	[cmd_block+sec_num], al ; mov [44h],al
  2636 000012FD 882E4500                		mov	[cmd_block+cyl_low], ch ; mov [45h],ch
  2637 00001301 88C8                    		mov	al, cl
  2638 00001303 C0E806                  		shr	al, 6		; get two high bits of cylinder	number
  2639                                  		;mov	ds:46h,	al	; [cmd_block+cyl_high]
  2640 00001306 A24600                  		mov	[cmd_block+cyl_high], al ; mov [46h],al
  2641 00001309 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  2642 0000130B C0E004                  		shl	al, 4		; drive	number
  2643 0000130E 80E40F                  		and	ah, 0Fh
  2644 00001311 08E0                    		or	al, ah		; head number
  2645 00001313 0CA0                    		or	al, 0A0h	; set ecc and 512 bytes	per sector
  2646                                  		;mov	ds:47h,	al	; [cmd_block+drv_head]
  2647 00001315 A24700                  		mov	[cmd_block+drv_head], al  ; mov [47h],al 
  2648 00001318 06                      		push	es
  2649 00001319 53                      		push	bx
  2650 0000131A 0E                      		push	cs
  2651 0000131B E85C00                  		call	get_vec
  2652 0000131E 268B4705                		mov	ax, [es:bx+5]	; [es:bx+fdp_precomp]
  2653                                  			 		; write pre-comp from disk parameters
  2654 00001322 C1E802                  		shr	ax, 2
  2655                                  		;mov	ds:42h,	al	; [cmd_block+pre_comp]
  2656 00001325 A24200                  		mov	[cmd_block+pre_comp], al ; mov [42h],al
  2657                                  					; only use low part
  2658 00001328 268A4708                		mov	al, [es:bx+8]	; [es:bx+fdp_control]
  2659                                  					; control byte modifier
  2660 0000132C 5B                      		pop	bx
  2661 0000132D 07                      		pop	es
  2662                                  		;mov	ah, ds:76h	; [control_byte]
  2663 0000132E 8A267600                		mov	ah, [control_byte] ; mov ah,[76h]
  2664 00001332 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; keep disable retry bits	
  2665 00001335 08C4                    		or	ah, al
  2666                                  		;mov	ds:76h,	ah
  2667 00001337 88267600                		mov	[control_byte], ah ; mov [76h],al
  2668 0000133B C3                      		retn
  2669                                  
  2670                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2671                                  
  2672                                  ;***	docmd - carry out read operation to at hard disk
  2673                                  ;
  2674                                  ;	entry:	(es:bx) = address for read in data.
  2675                                  ;		cmd_block set up for disk read.
  2676                                  ;
  2677                                  ;	exit:	buffer at (es:bx) contains data read.
  2678                                  ;		disk_status1 set to error code (0 if success).
  2679                                  ;
  2680                                  ;	
  2681                                  ;
  2682                                  ;	warning: (ax), (bl), (cx), (dx), (di) destroyed.
  2683                                  ;		no check is made for dma boundary overrun.
  2684                                  ;
  2685                                  ;	effects: programs disk controller.
  2686                                  ;		performs disk input.
  2687                                  
  2688                                  docmd:		; proc near		
  2689 0000133C 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
  2690 0000133E 0E                      		push	cs
  2691 0000133F E84000                  		call	command
  2692 00001342 7535                    		jnz	short doc3
  2693                                  doc1:					
  2694 00001344 0E                      		push	cs
  2695 00001345 E84200                  		call	waitt		; wait for controller to complete read
  2696 00001348 752F                    		jnz	short doc3
  2697 0000134A B90001                  		mov	cx, 256		; 256 words per sector
  2698 0000134D BAF001                  		mov	dx, 1F0h	; hf_port
  2699 00001350 FC                      		cld			; string op goes up
  2700 00001351 FA                      		cli			; disable interrupts
  2701                                  					; (bug was forgetting this)
  2702                                  
  2703                                  ;	M062 -- some of these old machines have intermittent failures
  2704                                  ;		when the read is done at full speed. Instead of using
  2705                                  ;		a string rep instruction, we'll use a loop. There is
  2706                                  ;		a slight performance hit, but it only affects these
  2707                                  ;		very old machines with an exact date code match, and
  2708                                  ;		it makes said machines more reliable
  2709                                  ;
  2710                                  ;M062	repz	insw		;read in sector
  2711                                  
  2712                                  rsct_loop:				
  2713 00001352 6D                      		insw
  2714 00001353 E2FD                    		loop	rsct_loop
  2715 00001355 FB                      		sti
  2716                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2717 00001356 F606480002              		test	byte [cmd_block+cmd_reg], 02h
  2718                                  		;test	byte ptr ds:48h, 2 ; [cmd_block+cmd_reg]
  2719                                  					; (ds =	40h)
  2720 0000135B 7410                    		jz	short doc2	; no ecc bytes to read.
  2721 0000135D 0E                      		push	cs
  2722 0000135E E83100                  		call	wait_drq	; wait for controller to complete read
  2723 00001361 7216                    		jb	short doc3
  2724 00001363 B90400                  		mov	cx, 4		; 4 bytes of ecc
  2725 00001366 BAF001                  		mov	dx, 1F0h	; hf_port
  2726 00001369 FA                      		cli
  2727 0000136A F36C                    		rep insb		; read in ecc
  2728 0000136C FB                      		sti
  2729                                  doc2:					
  2730 0000136D 0E                      		push	cs
  2731 0000136E E82900                  		call	check_status
  2732 00001371 7506                    		jnz	short doc3	; operation failed
  2733                                  		;dec	byte ptr ds:43h	; [cmd_block+sec_cnt]
  2734 00001373 FE0E4300                		dec	byte [cmd_block+sec_cnt]
  2735 00001377 75CB                    		jnz	short doc1	; loop while more sectors to read
  2736                                  doc3:					
  2737 00001379 C3                      		retn
  2738                                  
  2739                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2740                                  
  2741                                  ;***	define where the rom routines are actually located
  2742                                  ;	   in the buggy old AT BIOS that we might need to
  2743                                  ;	   install a special level of int13 handler for
  2744                                  
  2745                                  ; 16/10/2022
  2746                                  
  2747                                  romsegment 	equ 0F000h  ; segment
  2748                                  romcommand 	equ 2E1Eh   ; offset in romsegment
  2749                                  romwait		equ 2E7Fh   ; offset in romsegment
  2750                                  romwait_drq 	equ 2EE2h   ; offset in romsegment
  2751                                  romcheck_status equ 2EF8h   ; offset in romsegment
  2752                                  romcheck_dma 	equ 2F69h   ; offset in romsegment	
  2753                                  romget_vec	equ 2F8Eh   ; offset in romsegment
  2754                                  romfret		equ 0FF65h  ; far return in rom	
  2755                                  
  2756                                  ;***	get_vec - get pointer to hard disk parameters.
  2757                                  ;
  2758                                  ;	entry:	(dl) = low bit has hard disk number (0 or 1).
  2759                                  ;
  2760                                  ;	exit:	(es:bx) = address of disk parameters table.
  2761                                  ;
  2762                                  ;	uses:	ax for segment computation.
  2763                                  ;
  2764                                  ;	loads es:bx from interrupt table in low memory, vector 46h (disk 0)
  2765                                  ;	or 70h (disk 1).
  2766                                  ;	
  2767                                  ;	warning: (ax) destroyed.
  2768                                  ;		this does a direct call to the at rom.
  2769                                  
  2770                                  get_vec:	; proc near		
  2771                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  2772                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2F8Eh
  2773                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2774 0000137A 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  2775 0000137D EA8E2F00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romget_vec
  2776                                  
  2777                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2778                                  
  2779                                  ;***	command - send contents of cmd_block to disk controller.
  2780                                  ;
  2781                                  ;	entry:	control_byte 
  2782                                  ;		cmd_block - set up with values for hard disk controller.
  2783                                  ;
  2784                                  ;	exit:	disk_status1 = error code.
  2785                                  ;		nz if error, zr for no error.
  2786                                  ;
  2787                                  ;
  2788                                  ;	warning: (ax), (cx), (dx) destroyed.
  2789                                  ;		does a direct call to the at rom.
  2790                                  ;
  2791                                  ;	effects: programs disk controller.
  2792                                  
  2793                                  command:	; proc near		
  2794                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  2795                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2E1Eh
  2796                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2797 00001382 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  2798 00001385 EA1E2E00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romcommand
  2799                                  
  2800                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2801                                  
  2802                                  ;***	waitt - wait for disk interrupt
  2803                                  ;
  2804                                  ;	entry:	nothing.
  2805                                  ;
  2806                                  ;	exit:	disk_status1 = error code.
  2807                                  ;		nz if error, zr if no error.
  2808                                  ;
  2809                                  ;
  2810                                  ;	warning: (ax), (bl), (cx) destroyed.
  2811                                  ;		does a direct call to the at rom.
  2812                                  ;		
  2813                                  ;	effects: calls int 15h, function 9000h.
  2814                                  
  2815                                  waitt:		; proc near		
  2816                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  2817                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2E7Fh
  2818                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2819 0000138A 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  2820 0000138D EA7F2E00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romwait
  2821                                  
  2822                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2823                                  
  2824                                  ;***	wait_drq - wait for data request.
  2825                                  ;
  2826                                  ;	entry:	nothing.
  2827                                  ;
  2828                                  ;	exit:	disk_status1 = error code.
  2829                                  ;		cy if error, nc if no error.
  2830                                  ;
  2831                                  ;	warning: (al), (cx), (dx) destroyed.
  2832                                  ;		does a direct call to the at rom.
  2833                                  
  2834                                  wait_drq:	; proc near		
  2835                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  2836                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2EE2h
  2837                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2838 00001392 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  2839 00001395 EAE22E00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romwait_drq
  2840                                  
  2841                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2842                                  
  2843                                  ;***	check_status - check hard disk status.
  2844                                  ;
  2845                                  ;	entry:	nothing.
  2846                                  ;
  2847                                  ;	exit:	disk_status1 = error code.
  2848                                  ;		nz if error, zr if no error.
  2849                                  ;
  2850                                  ;	warning: (ax), (cx), (dx) destroyed.
  2851                                  ;		does a direct call to the at rom.
  2852                                  
  2853                                  check_status:	; proc near		
  2854                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  2855                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2EF8h
  2856                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2857 0000139A 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  2858 0000139D EAF82E00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romcheck_status
  2859                                  
  2860                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2861                                  
  2862                                  ;***	check_dma - check for dma overrun 64k segment.
  2863                                  ;
  2864                                  ;	entry:	(es:bx) = addr. of memory buffer in seg:000x form.
  2865                                  ;		cmd_block set up for operation.
  2866                                  ;
  2867                                  ;	exit:	disk_status1 - error code.
  2868                                  ;		cy if error, nc if no error.
  2869                                  ;
  2870                                  ;	warning: does a direct call to the at rom.
  2871                                  
  2872                                  check_dma:	; proc near		
  2873                                  		;push	0FF65h		; romfret ; far	return in rom
  2874                                  		;jmp	far ptr	0F000h:2F69h
  2875                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2876 000013A2 6865FF                  		push	romfret		; far return in rom
  2877 000013A5 EA692F00F0              		jmp	romsegment:romcheck_dma
  2878                                  
  2879                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2880                                  
  2881                                  endatrom:
  2882                                  
  2883                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2884                                  
  2885                                  ;; M015 -- begin changes
  2886                                  ;;
  2887                                  ;; Certain old COMPAQ '286 machines have a bug in their ROM BIOS.
  2888                                  ;; When Int13 is done with AH > 15h and DL >= 80h, they trash
  2889                                  ;; the byte at DS:74h, assuming that DS points to ROM_DATA.
  2890                                  ;; If our init code detects this error, it will install this
  2891                                  ;; special Int13 hook through the same mechanism that was set
  2892                                  ;; up for the IBM patch above. This code is also dynamically
  2893                                  ;; relocated by MSINIT.
  2894                                  
  2895                                  compaq_disk_io:
  2896 000013AA 80FC15                  		cmp	ah, 15h		; compaq_disk_io proc far
  2897                                  					;
  2898                                  					; the following	label defines the end of the at	rom patch.
  2899                                  					; this is used at configuration	time.
  2900                                  					;
  2901                                  					; warning!!!
  2902                                  					; this code will be dynamically	relocated by msinit
  2903 000013AD 7705                    		ja	short mebbe_hookit ; only deal with functions > 15h
  2904                                  no_hookit:				
  2905                                  		;jmp	cs:Old13
  2906                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2907 000013AF 2EFF2E[0601]            		jmp	far [cs:Old13]
  2908                                  
  2909                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2910                                  
  2911                                  mebbe_hookit:
  2912 000013B4 80FA80                  		cmp	dl, 80h
  2913 000013B7 72F6                    		jb	short no_hookit
  2914 000013B9 1E                      		push	ds
  2915                                  		
  2916                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  2917                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:1830h
  2918                                  		;push	ax
  2919                                  		;mov	ax, 40h
  2920                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  2921                                  		;pop	ax
  2922 000013BA 6A40                    		push	40h
  2923 000013BC 1F                      		pop	ds
  2924                                  
  2925 000013BD 9C                      		pushf
  2926                                  		;call	cs:Old13
  2927                                  		; 16/10/2022
  2928 000013BE 2EFF1E[0601]            		call	far [cs:Old13]
  2929 000013C3 1F                      		pop	ds
  2930 000013C4 CA0200                  		retf	2
  2931                                  
  2932                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2933                                  
  2934 000013C7 00                      end_compaq_i13hook: db 0			
  2935                                  
  2936                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  2937                                  
  2938                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  2939                                  %if 0  
  2940                                  
  2941                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.		
  2942                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
  2943                                  
  2944                                  daycnt_to_day:	; proc far
  2945                                  
  2946                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
  2947                                  ;
  2948                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
  2949                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
  2950                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
  2951                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
  2952                                  
  2953                                  		; 16/10/2022		
  2954                                  		push	word [cs:daycnt] ; save daycnt
  2955                                  		cmp	word [cs:daycnt], 7305	; (365*20+(20/4))
  2956                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
  2957                                  		jnb	short century20
  2958                                  		mov	byte [cs:base_century], 19
  2959                                  		mov	byte [cs:base_year], 80
  2960                                  		jmp	short years
  2961                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2962                                  		
  2963                                  century20:				
  2964                                  		mov	byte [cs:base_century], 20
  2965                                  		mov	byte [cs:base_year], 0
  2966                                  		sub	word [cs:daycnt], 7305	; (365*20+(20/4))
  2967                                  					; adjust daycnt
  2968                                  years:					
  2969                                  		xor	dx, dx
  2970                                  		mov	ax, [cs:daycnt]
  2971                                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
  2972                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
  2973                                  		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
  2974                                  		mov	[cs:daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
  2975                                  		mov	bl, 4
  2976                                  		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
  2977                                  		add	[cs:base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
  2978                                  		inc	word [cs:daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
  2979                                  		cmp	word [cs:daycnt], 366	; daycnt=remainder of leap year	bk
  2980                                  		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
  2981                                  		inc	byte [cs:base_year]	; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
  2982                                  		sub	word [cs:daycnt], 366	; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
  2983                                  		mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
  2984                                  regularyear:				
  2985                                  		cmp	word [cs:daycnt], 365	; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365;	i++)
  2986                                  		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
  2987                                  		inc	byte [cs:base_year]	;   { daycnt -=	365
  2988                                  		sub	word [cs:daycnt], 365	;   }
  2989                                  		loop	regularyear	; }
  2990                                  					;
  2991                                  					; should never fall through loop
  2992                                  leapyear:				
  2993                                  		mov	byte [cs:month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
  2994                                  					; change month table.
  2995                                  yeardone:				
  2996                                  		xor	bx, bx
  2997                                  		xor	dx, dx
  2998                                  		mov	ax, [cs:daycnt]
  2999                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
  3000                                  		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
  3001                                  		mov	cx, 12
  3002                                  months:					
  3003                                  		inc	bl
  3004                                  
  3005                                  		; !!! -- 16/10/2022 -- (if DS=CS, what for CS: prefixes are used !?)
  3006                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:si]
  3007                                  		; !!! -- 16/10/2022 -- (may be to keep code addrs as unchanged/fix!?)
  3008                                  		; ds = cs !? ((ofcourse ds must be same with cs here))
  3009                                  		;mov	dl, [si] ; 20/03/2019 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSDATA:14C0h)
  3010                                  		;mov	dl, [si] ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, BIOSDATA:14C0h)
  3011                                  		
  3012                                  		mov	dl, [si] ; ?	; mov dl, [cs:si]
  3013                                  		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
  3014                                  					; dh=0
  3015                                  		jbe	short month_done
  3016                                  		inc	si		; next month
  3017                                  		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt
  3018                                  		loop	months		;
  3019                                  					; should never fall through loop
  3020                                  month_done:				
  3021                                  		mov	byte [cs:month_tab+1], 28
  3022                                  					; restore month table value
  3023                                  		mov	dl, bl
  3024                                  		mov	dh, [cs:base_year]
  3025                                  		mov	cl, [cs:base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
  3026                                  		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  3027                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
  3028                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
  3029                                  		xchg	dl, al
  3030                                  		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  3031                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
  3032                                  		xchg	dh, al
  3033                                  		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  3034                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
  3035                                  		xchg	cl, al
  3036                                  		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  3037                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
  3038                                  		mov	ch, al
  3039                                  		pop	word [cs:daycnt] ; restore original value
  3040                                  		retf
  3041                                  
  3042                                  enddaycnttoday:	
  3043                                  
  3044                                  %endif
  3045                                  
  3046                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  3047                                  
  3048                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  3049                                  %if 0  
  3050                                  
  3051                                  bin_to_bcd:	; proc far		; real time clock support
  3052                                  
  3053                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
  3054                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
  3055                                  		
  3056                                  		push	cx		
  3057                                  		aam			; al=high digit	bcd, ah=low digit bcd
  3058                                  		mov	cl, 4
  3059                                  		shl	ah, cl		; mov the high digit to	high nibble
  3060                                  		or	al, ah
  3061                                  		pop	cx
  3062                                  		retf
  3063                                  %endif
  3064                                  
  3065                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3066                                  
  3067                                  ; the k09 requires the routines for reading the clock because of the suspend/
  3068                                  ; resume facility. the system clock needs to be reset after resume.
  3069                                  
  3070                                  ; the following routine is executed at resume time when the system
  3071                                  ; powered on after suspension. it reads the real time clock and
  3072                                  ; resets the system time and date, and then irets.
  3073                                  
  3074                                  ; warning!!! this code will be dynamically relocated by msinit.
  3075                                  
  3076                                  	; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  3077                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:183Eh
  3078                                  int_6Ch:
  3079 000013C8 0E                      		push	cs
  3080 000013C9 1F                      		pop	ds
  3081                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:inHMA], 0  
  3082 000013CA 803E[0D00]00            		cmp	byte [inHMA], 0
  3083 000013CF 7405                    		jz      short int6c
  3084 000013D1 BB[9007]                		mov     bx, EnsureA20On
  3085 000013D4 FFD3                    		call    bx
  3086                                  int6c:					
  3087                                  		;push	cs
  3088                                  		;pop	ds
  3089 000013D6 8F06[B306]              		pop	word [int6c_ret_addr]	; pop off return address
  3090 000013DA 8F06[B506]              		pop	word [int6c_ret_addr+2]
  3091 000013DE 9D                      		popf
  3092 000013DF E81300                  		call	read_real_date	; get the date from the clock
  3093 000013E2 FA                      		cli
  3094 000013E3 8936[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], si	; update dos copy of date
  3095 000013E7 FB                      		sti

  3109                                  ;   read_real_date reads real-time clock for date and returns the number
  3110                                  ;   of days elapsed since 1-1-80 in si

  3112                                  read_real_date:	; proc near		
  3113 000013F5 50                      		push	ax
  3114 000013F6 51                      		push	cx
  3115 000013F7 52                      		push	dx
  3116 000013F8 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; throw	away clock roll	over
  3117 000013FA CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  3118                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  3119                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  3120                                  					; midnight
  3121                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  3122 000013FC 5A                      		pop	dx
  3123 000013FD 59                      		pop	cx
  3124 000013FE 58                      		pop	ax

  3126 00001400 53                      		push	bx
  3127 00001401 51                      		push	cx
  3128 00001402 52                      		push	dx
  3129                                  		;mov	word [cs:daycnt2], 1

  3141 0000140F E98300                  		jmp	r_d_ret

  3170                                  century_19:

  3172 0000144D B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; leap year every 4

  3177                                  					; # of days in leap year blocks

  3252                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================

  3254                                  ; read_real_time reads the time from the rtc. on exit, it has the number of
  3255                                  ; ticks (at 18.2 ticks per sec.) in cx:dx.
  3256                                  
  3257                                  read_real_time:	; proc near

  3260                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  3261                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD

  3289                                  ;   in_bin converts bin_date_time values from bcd to bin
  3290                                  
  3291                                  in_bin:		; proc near

  3298 000014EF A0[B906]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time+2] ; months or seconds

  3304 00001501 C3                      		retn
  3305                                  
  3306                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  3307                                  
  3308                                  ;   bcd_to_bin converts two bcd nibbles in al (value <= 99.) to
  3309                                  ;   a binary representation in al
  3310                                  ;   ah is destroyed
  3311                                  
  3312                                  bcd_to_bin:	; proc near
  3313 00001502 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  3314 00001504 240F                    		and	al, 0Fh
  3315 00001506 B104                    		mov	cl, 4
  3316 00001508 D2EC                    		shr	ah, cl
  3317 0000150A D50A                    		aad
  3318 0000150C C3                      		retn
  3319                                  
  3320                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  3321                                  
  3322                                  ;   date_verify loosely checks bcd date values to be in range
  3323                                  ;   in bin_date_time
  3324                                  
  3325                                  date_verify:	; proc near
  3326 0000150D 803E[B706]20            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time], 20h ; century check
  3327 00001512 7732                    		ja	short date_error
  3328 00001514 740E                    		jz	short century_20 ; jmp in 21th century
  3329 00001516 803E[B706]19            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time], 19h ; century check

  3331                                  		; 12/12/2022

  3334                                  		;jb	short date_error

  3341 00001530 7714                    		ja	short date_error
  3342 00001532 803E[B906]00            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+2], 0
  3343                                  		;jbe	short date_error

  3346 0000153E 7706                    		ja	short date_error

  3348                                  		;;jbe	short date_error
  3349                                  		;jna	short date_error
  3350                                  		; 12/12/2022

  3352                                  		;clc
  3353                                  		; 12/12/2022

  3380                                  time_error:

  3391                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  3392                                  
  3393                                  ;   bcd_verify checks values in bin_date_time to be valid
  3394                                  ;   bcd numerals.  carry set if any nibble out of range
  3395                                  
  3396                                  bcd_verify:	; proc near
  3397 0000155D B90400                  		mov	cx, 4		; 4 bytes to check
  3398 00001560 BB[B706]                		mov	bx, bin_date_time
  3399                                  bv_loop:
  3400 00001563 8A07                    		mov	al, [bx]	; get a	bcd number (0..99)
  3401 00001565 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  3402 00001567 250FF0                  		and	ax, 0F00Fh	; 10's place in high ah, 1's in al
  3403                                  					; is 1's place in range?
  3404 0000156A 3C0A                    		cmp	al, 10
  3405 0000156C 77ED                    		ja	short bv_error	; jmp out of range
  3406 0000156E D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  3407 00001570 D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  3408 00001572 D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  3409 00001574 D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  3410 00001576 80E40F                  		and	ah, 0Fh		; get rid of any erroneous bits
  3411 00001579 80FC0A                  		cmp	ah, 10		; is 10's place in range
  3412 0000157C 77DD                    		ja	short bv_error	; jmp out of range
  3413 0000157E 43                      		inc	bx		; next byte
  3414 0000157F 49                      		dec	cx
  3415 00001580 75E1                    		jnz	short bv_loop
  3416 00001582 F8                      		clc			; set success flag
  3417 00001583 C3                      		retn
  3418                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3419                                  
  3420                                  		; 12/12/2022

  3422                                  		;stc			; set error flag
  3423                                  		;retn

  3431                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3432                                  ;									:
  3433                                  ;	System initialization						:
  3434                                  ;									:
  3435                                  ;	The entry conditions are established by the bootstrap		:
  3436                                  ;	loader and are considered unknown. The following jobs		:
  3437                                  ;	will be performed by this module:				:
  3438                                  ;									:
  3439                                  ;	1.	All device initialization is performed			:
  3440                                  ;	2.	A local stack is set up and DS:SI are set		:
  3441                                  ;		to point to an initialization table. Then		:
  3442                                  ;		an inter-segment call is made to the first		:
  3443                                  ;		byte of the dos 					:
  3444                                  ;	3.	Once the dos returns from this call the ds		:
  3445                                  ;		register has been set up to point to the start		:
  3446                                  ;		of free memory. The initialization will then		:
  3447                                  ;		load the command program into this area 		:
  3448                                  ;		beginning at 100 hex and transfer control to		:
  3449                                  ;		this program.						:
  3450                                  ;									:
  3451                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3452                                  
  3453                                  ; 01/10/2022
  3454                                  ; 08/01/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  3455                                  
  3456                                  ; drvfat must be the first location of freeable space!
  3457                                  
  3458                                  align 2
  3459                                  		;db 90h
  3460                                  
  3461                                  ; 20/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 combined/single kernel file)
  3462                                  ; ((no need to read/load 'MSDOS.SYS', it is already loaded))
  3463                                  ; (((bios_l,bios_h,doscnt,fatloc,md_sectorsize,temp_cluster,last_fat_sec_num
  3464                                  ;   would be used to read 'MSDOS.SYS' from disk, now they are not needed)))
  3465                                  	
  3466 00001584 0000                    drvfat:		dw 0			; drive	and fat	id of dos
  3467                                  ;bios_l:	dw 0			; first	sector of data (low word)
  3468                                  ;bios_h:	dw 0			; first	sector of data (high word)
  3469                                  ;doscnt:	dw 0			; how many sectors to read
  3470 00001586 00                      fbigfat:	db 0			; flags	for drive
  3471                                  ;fatloc:	dw 0			; seg addr of fat sector
  3472 00001587 0000                    init_bootseg:	dw 0			; seg addr of buffer for reading boot record
  3473 00001589 80                      rom_drv_num:	db 80h			; rom drive number
  3474                                  ;md_sectorsize:	dw 200h			; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  3475                                  ;temp_cluster:	dw 0			; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  3476                                  ;last_fat_sec_num: dw 0FFFFh		; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  3477                                  
  3478                                  ; the following two bytes are used to save the info returned by int 13, ah = 8
  3479                                  ; call to determine drive parameters.
  3480                                  
  3481 0000158A 02                      num_heads:	db 2			; number of heads returned by rom
  3482                                  		;db 0	; 08/08/2023
  3483 0000158B 09                      sec_trk:	db 9			; sec/trk returned by rom
  3484 0000158C 28                      num_cyln:	db 40			; number of cylinders returned by rom
  3485                                  		;db 0	; 08/08/2023
  3486 0000158D 00                      fakefloppydrv:	db 0			; if 1,	then no	diskette drives	in the system.
  3487                                  
  3488                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3489                                  
  3490 0000158E 0002000140000000        disktable:	dw 512,	0100h, 64, 0	; warning !!! old values
  3491 00001596 0008010270000000        		dw 2048, 0201h, 112, 0
  3492 0000159E 0020020400010000        		dw 8192, 0402h, 256, 0
  3493 000015A6 A87F030800020000        		dw 32680, 0803h, 512, 0	; warning !!! old values
  3494 000015AE FFFF041000040000        		dw 65535, 1004h, 1024, 0
  3495                                  					; default disktable under
  3496                                  					; the assumption of total fat size <= 128 kb,
  3497                                  					; and the maximum size of fat entry = 16 bit.
  3498                                  		; 08/08/2023

  3575                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos

  3577                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  3578                                  		dw	720 ; 2*9*40	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  3579                                  		db	0FDh		; media descriptor
  3580                                  		dw	2		; number of fat sectors
  3581                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  3582                                  		dw	2		; heads
  3583                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  3584                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  3585                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  3586                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)

  3713                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  3714                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  3715                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  3716                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  3717                                  ;
  3718                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  3719                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  3720                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  3721                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  3722                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  3723                                  ;	  and a retf
  3724                                  
  3725                                  ; 16/10/2022
  3726                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  3727                                  ; 09/12/2022
  3728                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  3729                                  
  3730                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  3731                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  3732 0000160F [CA00]                  		dw BC_RETF
  3733                                  
  3734                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3735                                  
  3736                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  3737 00001611 2EFF36[0F16]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  3738                                  					; set up near return to far return
  3739 00001616 2EFF36[BF06]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  3740 0000161B 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  3741 0000161C CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  3742                                  
  3743                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3744                                  		
  3745                                  		; 20/12/2022

  3750                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0, classic/old MICROSOFT DOS method)
  3751                                  ; 20/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (combined kernel files, original/new method) (*)
  3752                                  ;      (*) (for using Retro DOS kernel 'MSDOS.SYS' with Retro DOS boot sector)
  3753

  3758                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  3759                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  3760                                  		;=============================================================
  3761                                  		;
  3762                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  3763                                  		;
  3764                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  3765                                  		;   ch = media byte
  3766                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  3767                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  3768                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  3769                                  
  3770                                  		; 07/04/2018
  3771                                  		;=============================================================
  3772                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  3773                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  3774                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  3775                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  3776                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  3777                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  3778                                  
  3779                                  		; 29/09/2023
  3780                                  		; SP = 0FFFEh (for Retro DOS v2&v3 boot sector) 
  3781                                  		;    = 07C00h (for MSDOS 5.0 boot sector)
  3782                                  		
  3783                                  ; 20/12/2022
  3784                                  ; Changing original MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS init code with Retro DOS v4.0 init code.		
  3785                                  %if 0	
  3786                                  		cli
  3787                                  
  3788                                  		push	ax
  3789                                  		xor	ax, ax
  3790                                  		mov	ds, ax
  3791                                  		pop	ax
  3792                                  %endif
  3793                                  
  3794                                  ; 20/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (combined kernel)
  3795                                  
  3796                                  KERNEL_SEGMENT equ 70h	; (DOS BIOSDATA SEGMENT)
  3797                                  BSSECPERTRACK equ 18h	; boot sector offset 18h (for Retro DOS & MSDOS)	
  3798

  3800                                  ; initialization - stage 1

  3834                                  		;mov	bl, KERNEL_SEGMENT

  3884                                  		; 20/12/2022

  3886                                  		; for full MSDOS compatibility.

  3888 00001643 8EC1                    		mov	es, cx ; 0

  3894 0000164A B378                    		mov	bl, 1Eh*4
  3895                                  				; INT 1Eh points to diskette parms table
  3896                                  
  3897                                  		; check if the table is already at 0:SEC9 (0:0522h)
  3898                                   		; (do not move the DPT if is not original ROMBIOS table)
  3899                                  
  3900                                  		;;or	[bx+2],cx [(1Eh*4)+2] ; [007Ah] ; segment
  3901                                  		;;jnz	short mov_dpt
  3902

  3904                                  		;je	short dont_mov_dpt
  3905

  3907                                  ;mov_dpt:
  3908                                  		;mov	ds, [bx+2] ; [(1Eh*4)+2] ; [007Ah] ; segment
  3909 0000164C C537                    		lds	si, [bx]
  3910 0000164E 89C7                    		mov	di, ax  ; SEC9
  3911 00001650 B10B                    		mov	cl, 11
  3912                                  		;cld
  3913 00001652 F3A4                    		rep	movsb
  3914                                  
  3915                                  		; Set INT 1Eh vector/pointer to the new DPT address
  3916 00001654 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx ; 0
  3917 00001656 8907                    		mov	[bx], ax ; SEC9	; [007Eh] ; 1Eh*4  ; offset
  3918 00001658 894F02                  		mov	[bx+2], cx ; 0  ; [007Ah] ; 1Eh*4+2 ; segment
  3919                                  ;dont_mov_dpt:

  3958                                  ;	System initialization						:
  3959                                  ;									:
  3960                                  ;	The entry conditions are established by the bootstrap		:
  3961                                  ;	loader and are considered unknown. The following jobs		:
  3962                                  ;	will be performed by this module:				:
  3963                                  ;									:
  3964                                  ;	1.	All device initialization is performed			:
  3965                                  ;	2.	A local stack is set up and DS:SI are set		:
  3966                                  ;		to point to an initialization table. Then		:
  3967                                  ;		an inter-segment call is made to the first		:
  3968                                  ;		byte of the dos 					:
  3969                                  ;	3.	Once the dos returns from this call the ds		:
  3970                                  ;		register has been set up to point to the start		:
  3971                                  ;		of free memory. The initialization will then		:
  3972                                  ;		load the command program into this area 		:
  3973                                  ;		beginning at 100 hex and transfer control to		:
  3974                                  ;		this program.						:
  3975                                  ;									:
  3976                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3977                                  		
  3978                                  		; 20/12/2022
  3979                                  		; ----------------------
  3980                                  		; Registers
  3981                                  		; ----------------------
  3982                                  		; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  3983                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  3984                                  		; DS = 0, ES = 0, SS = 0
  3985                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  3986                                  		; SP = 700h
  3987                                  		; ----------------------
  3988                                  		; CX = 0				
  3989                                  
  3990                                  ; 02/10/2022 - 20/12/2022
  3991                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3992                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  3993                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  3994                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  3995                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  3996                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 70h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  3997                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector and then MSLOAD sets this).
  3998                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3999                                  
  4000                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4001                                  ;
  4002                                  ;;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4003                                  ;;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4004                                  ;;	data sector of the bios.
  4005                                  ;
  4006                                  ;		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4007                                  ;		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4008                                  
  4009                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4010                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4011                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4012                                  
  4013                                  		; 14/12/2023
  4014                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4015                                  		;cli
  4016                                  
  4017 0000165B 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4018 0000165C 07                      		pop	es

  4029 00001662 FA                      		cli
  4030                                  next_int_:		
  4031 00001663 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022

  4033                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb

  4035 00001666 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1

  4037 0000166A 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4038 0000166C 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4039                                  					; saving address in di

  4042                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4043                                  		;stosw			; save the vector

  4046 0000166F A5                      		movsw

  4049 00001672 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4050                                  		
  4051                                  		;pop	di
  4052                                  		;pop	cx
  4053                                  
  4054                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4055                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4056                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4057                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.

  4063                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax

  4070                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4071                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4072 0000167A 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4073                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4074 0000167E C7065400[FE07]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15

  4076                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action

  4089 00001694 A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4090 00001697 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4091 0000169A A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4092 0000169D A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4093                                  					; ;
  4094 000016A0 FB                      		sti
  4095 000016A1 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4096                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4097                                  
  4098                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4099                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4100                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4101                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4102                                  ;
  4103                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4104                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4105                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4106                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4107                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4108                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4109                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4110                                  
  4111                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4112                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4113                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4114                                  ;
  4115                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4116                                  ; to do anything special.
  4117                                  ;
  4118                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4119                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4120                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4121                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4122                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4123                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4124                                  
  4125                                  		; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4126 000016A3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  4127                                  
  4128                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4129 000016A5 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4130                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4131 000016A7 751E                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4132                                  
  4133                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4134                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4135                                  ;
  4136                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4137                                  ;
  4138                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4139                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4140                                  
  4141                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4142                                  		;push	ax
  4143                                  		;push	bx
  4144                                  		;push	cx
  4145 000016A9 52                      		push	dx
  4146                                  		;push	di
  4147 000016AA 06                      		push	es
  4148 000016AB B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4149 000016AD B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4150 000016AF CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4151                                  					; DL = drive number
  4152                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4153                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4154                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4155 000016B1 7202                    		jc	short _gdskp_error
  4156                                  		;;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4157                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4158                                  		; ds = cs
  4159                                  		;mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4160 000016B3 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  4161                                  _gdskp_error:	
  4162                                  		; 20/12/2022			
  4163 000016B5 07                      		pop	es
  4164                                  		;pop	di
  4165 000016B6 5A                      		pop	dx
  4166                                  		;pop	cx
  4167                                  		;pop	bx
  4168                                  		;pop	ax
  4169                                  		
  4170 000016B7 720E                    		jc	short normalfloppydrv
  4171                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4172                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4173                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4174                                  		; ds = cs
  4175                                  		;cmp	byte [flp_drvs], 0
  4176                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4177                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4178                                  		;;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4179                                  		;mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4180                                  		;;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4181                                  		;; 18/12/2022
  4182                                  		;dec	ax
  4183                                  		;jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4184                                  		
  4185                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4186 000016B9 08C9                    		or	cl, cl ; [flp_drvs]
  4187 000016BB 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv		
  4188 000016BD 49                      		dec	cx	
  4189 000016BE EB0B                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4190                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4191                                  
  4192                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4193                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4194                                  		; ds = cs
  4195                                  		;inc	cl	; cl = 1
  4196                                  		; 14/12/2023
  4197 000016C0 41                      		inc	cx	; cl = 1
  4198 000016C1 880E[8D15]              		mov	[fakefloppydrv], cl ; 1
  4199                                  		;mov	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1
  4200                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4201                                  					; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4202                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4203                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4204 000016C5 EB0A                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4205                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4206                                  
  4207                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4208                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4209                                  		;rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4210                                  		;rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4211 000016C7 D0C1                    		rol	cl, 1
  4212 000016C9 D0C1                    		rol	cl, 1

  4220                                  		; 20/12/2022

  4223                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives

  4232                                  		;			; booted off hard file
