  7385                                  
  7386                                  cmos_clock_read:	
  7387 000020C2 50                      		push	ax
  7388 000020C3 51                      		push	cx
  7389 000020C4 52                      		push	dx
  7390 000020C5 55                      		push	bp
  7391 000020C6 31ED                    		xor	bp, bp
  7392                                  loop_clock:				
  7393 000020C8 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  7394 000020CA 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7395 000020CC B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  7396 000020CE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7397                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  7398                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  7399                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  7400 000020D0 83F900                  		cmp	cx, 0
  7401 000020D3 7512                    		jnz	short clock_present
  7402 000020D5 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  7403 000020D8 750D                    		jnz	short clock_present
  7404 000020DA 83FD01                  		cmp	bp, 1		; read again after a slight delay, in case clock
  7405 000020DD 741C                    		jz	short no_readdate ; was at zero setting.
  7406 000020DF 45                      		inc	bp		; only perform delay once.
  7407 000020E0 B90040                  		mov	cx, 4000h	; 16384
  7408                                  delay:					
  7409 000020E3 E2FE                    		loop	delay
  7410 000020E5 EBE1                    		jmp	short loop_clock
  7411                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7412                                  
  7413                                  clock_present:				
  7414 000020E7 2EC606[F304]01          		mov	byte [cs:havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  7415 000020ED E81000                  		call	cmosck		; reset	cmos clock rate	that may be
  7416                                  					; possibly destroyed by	cp dos and
  7417                                  					; post routine did not restore that.
  7418 000020F0 56                      		push	si
  7419 000020F1 E801F3                  		call	read_real_date	; read real-time clock for date
  7420 000020F4 FA                      		cli
  7421                                  		;mov	ds:daycnt, si	; set system date
  7422 000020F5 8936[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], si
  7423 000020F9 FB                      		sti
  7424 000020FA 5E                      		pop	si
  7425                                  
  7426                                  no_readdate:				
  7427 000020FB 5D                      		pop	bp
  7428 000020FC 5A                      		pop	dx
  7429 000020FD 59                      		pop	cx
  7430 000020FE 58                      		pop	ax
  7431 000020FF C3                      		retn
  7432                                  
  7433                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7434                                  
  7435                                  ; the following code is written by jack gulley in engineering group.
  7436                                  ; cp dos (CP/DOS, OS/2) is changing cmos clock rate for its own purposes
  7437                                  ; and if the use cold boot the system to use pc dos while running cp dos,
  7438                                  ; the cmos clock rate are still slow which slow down disk operations
  7439                                  ; of pc dos which uses cmos clock. pc dos is put this code in msinit
  7440                                  ; to fix this problem at the request of cp dos.
  7441                                  ;
  7442                                  ; the program is modified to be run on msinit. equates are defined
  7443                                  ; in cmosequ.inc. this program will be called by cmos_clock_read procedure.
  7444                                  ;
  7445                                  ;  the following code cmosck is used to insure that the cmos has not
  7446                                  ;	had its rate controls left in an invalid state on older at's.
  7447                                  ;
  7448                                  ;	it checks for an at model byte "fc" with a submodel type of
  7449                                  ;	00, 01, 02, 03 or 06 and resets the periodic interrupt rate
  7450                                  ;	bits in case post has not done it. this initilization routine
  7451                                  ;	is only needed once when dos loads. it should be run as soon
  7452                                  ;	as possible to prevent slow diskette access.
  7453                                  ;
  7454                                  ;	this code exposes one to dos clearing cmos setup done by a
  7455                                  ;	resident program that hides and re-boots the system.
  7456                                  
  7457                                  cmosck:					; check and reset rtc rate bits
  7458                                  
  7459                                  ;model byte and submodel byte were already determined in msinit.
  7460                                  
  7461                                  	; 16/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7462                                  	; 19/03/2018 (Model: 0FCh, Sub Model: 01h, REF: AMIBIOS Prog. Guide)
  7463                                  			
  7464 00002100 50                      		push	ax
  7465 00002101 2E803E[3606]FC          		cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0FCh
  7466 00002107 7525                    		jnz	short cmosck9	; Exit if not an AT model
  7467 00002109 2E803E[3706]06          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  7468                                  					; Is it 06 for the industral AT ?
  7469 0000210F 7408                    		jz	short cmosck4	; Go reset CMOS periodic rate if 06
  7470 00002111 2E803E[3706]04          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 4
  7471                                  					; Is it 00, 01, 02, or 03 ?
  7472 00002117 7315                    		jnb	short cmosck9	; EXIT if problem fixed by POST
  7473                                  					; Also,Secondary_model_byte = 0
  7474                                  					;   when AH=0C0h, int 15h failed.
  7475                                  					;	RESET THE CMOS PERIODIC RATE
  7476                                  					;  Model=FC submodel=00,01,02,03 or 06
  7477                                  cmosck4:				
  7478 00002119 B08A                    		mov	al, 8Ah		; cmos_reg_a|nmi
  7479                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7480 0000211B B426                    		mov	ah, 26h		; 00100110b
  7481                                  					; Set divider & rate selection
  7482 0000211D E83000                  		call	cmos_write
  7483 00002120 B08B                    		mov	al, 8Bh		; cmos_reg_b|nmi
  7484                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7485 00002122 E80B00                  		call	cmos_read
  7486 00002125 2407                    		and	al, 7		; 00000111b
  7487                                  					; clear SET,PIE,AIE,UIE,SQWE
  7488 00002127 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  7489 00002129 B00B                    		mov	al, 0Bh		; cmos_reg_b
  7490                                  					; NMI enabled on return
  7491 0000212B E82200                  		call	cmos_write
  7492                                  cmosck9:				
  7493 0000212E 58                      		pop	ax
  7494 0000212F C3                      		retn
  7495                                  
  7496                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7497                                  
  7498                                  ;--- CMOS_READ -----------------------------------------------------------------
  7499                                  ;		read byte from cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7500                                  ;									       :
  7501                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be read				       :
  7502                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7503                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to read		       :
  7504                                  ;									       :
  7505                                  ; output: (al)	value at location (al) moved into (al). if bit 7 of (al) was   :
  7506                                  ;		on then nmi left disabled.  during the cmos read both nmi and  :
  7507                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7508                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7509                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7510                                  ;		only the (al) register and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7511                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7512                                  
  7513                                  cmos_read:				; read location (al) into (al)	
  7514 00002130 9C                      		pushf
  7515 00002131 FA                      		cli
  7516 00002132 53                      		push	bx
  7517 00002133 50                      		push	ax		; AL = cmos table address to be read
  7518 00002134 0C80                    		or	al, 80h
  7519 00002136 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7520                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7521 00002138 90                      		nop			; (undocumented delay needed)
  7522 00002139 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7523 0000213B 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax
  7524 0000213D 58                      		pop	ax
  7525 0000213E 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7526 00002140 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7527 00002142 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7528                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7529 00002144 90                      		nop
  7530 00002145 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7531 00002147 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  7532 00002149 5B                      		pop	bx
  7533 0000214A 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7534 0000214B E80100                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7535 0000214E C3                      		retn			; return with flags restored
  7536                                  
  7537                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7538                                  
  7539                                  cmos_popf:				
  7540 0000214F CF                      		iret			; popf for level b- parts
  7541                                  					; return far and restore flags
  7542                                  
  7543                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7544                                  
  7545                                  ;--- cmos_write ----------------------------------------------------------------
  7546                                  ;		write byte to cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7547                                  ;									       :
  7548                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be written to			       :
  7549                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7550                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to write		       :
  7551                                  ;	 (ah)=	new value to be placed in the addressed table location	       :
  7552                                  ;									       :
  7553                                  ; output:	value in (ah) placed in location (al) with nmi left disabled   :
  7554                                  ;		if bit 7 of (al) is on. during the cmos update both nmi and    :
  7555                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7556                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7557                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7558                                  ;		only the cmos location and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7559                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7560                                  
  7561                                  cmos_write:				; write (ah) to location (al)
  7562 00002150 9C                      		pushf			;
  7563 00002151 50                      		push	ax		; save work register values
  7564 00002152 FA                      		cli
  7565 00002153 50                      		push	ax		; save user nmi	state
  7566 00002154 0C80                    		or	al, 80h		; disable nmi for us
  7567 00002156 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7568                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7569 00002158 90                      		nop
  7570 00002159 88E0                    		mov	al, ah
  7571 0000215B E671                    		out	71h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7572 0000215D 58                      		pop	ax		; get user nmi
  7573 0000215E 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7574 00002160 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7575 00002162 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7576                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7577 00002164 90                      		nop
  7578 00002165 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7579 00002167 58                      		pop	ax		; restore work registers
  7580 00002168 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7581 00002169 E8E3FF                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7582 0000216C C3                      		retn
  7583                                  
  7584                                  ; 21/12/2022
  7585                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7586                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7587                                  %if 0
  7588                                  
  7589                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7590                                  ; MSINIT.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7591                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7592                                  ; The following routines provide support for reading in the file MSDOS.SYS.
  7593                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7594                                  
  7595                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7596                                  ;
  7597                                  ; (For Retro DOS, 'IO.SYS' and 'MSDOS.SYS' are already loaded together
  7598                                  ;  at once -as single kernel file- by the Retro DOS boot sector code.
  7599                                  ;  So, following disk reads -MSDOS.SYS loading- is not needed!
  7600                                  ;  Only needing is to move MSDOS Kernel to it's final memory location.) 
  7601                                  
  7602                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7603                                  
  7604                                  ; GetClus, read in a cluster at a specified address
  7605                                  ;
  7606                                  ;  bx = cluster to read
  7607                                  ;  cx = sectors per cluster
  7608                                  ;  es:di = load location
  7609                                  
  7610                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7611                                  ;DISKRD equ diskrd - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	; (8E5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7612                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7613                                  DISKRD equ diskrd
  7614                                  
  7615                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7616                                  getclus:
  7617                                  		; 14/12/2023
  7618                                  		; 13/12/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS)
  7619                                  		; ds = cs
  7620                                  
  7621                                  		push	cx
  7622                                  		push	di
  7623                                  		;mov	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7624                                  		mov	[doscnt], cx ; 13/12/2023
  7625                                  		mov	ax, bx
  7626                                  		dec	ax
  7627                                  		dec	ax
  7628                                  		mul	cx		; convert to logical sector
  7629                                  					; dx:ax	= matching logical sector number
  7630                                  					;	  starting from the data sector
  7631                                  		;add	ax, [cs:bios_l]
  7632                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  7633                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7634                                  		add	ax, [bios_l]
  7635                                  		adc	dx, [bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  7636                                  unpack:
  7637                                  		push	ds ; ds = cs ; 13/12/2023
  7638                                  		push	dx ; * ; 13/12/2023
  7639                                  		push	ax
  7640                                  		push	bx
  7641                                  		;mov	si, [cs:fatloc]
  7642                                  		mov	si, [fatloc] ; 13/12/2023
  7643                                  		mov	ds, si
  7644                                  		mov	si, bx		; next cluster
  7645                                  		test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h	; fbig
  7646                                  					; 16 bit fat?
  7647                                  		jnz	short unpack16	; yes
  7648                                  		shr	si, 1		; 12 bit fat. si=si/2
  7649                                  					; si = clus + clus/2
  7650                                  		add	si, bx		;
  7651                                  					; (si =	byte offset of the cluster in the FAT)
  7652                                  		;push	dx ; 13/12/2023
  7653                                  		xor	dx, dx
  7654                                  		; 12/12/2023
  7655                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
  7656                                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7657                                  		;pop	dx ; 12/12/2023
  7658                                  
  7659                                  		mov	ax, [bx]	; save it into ax
  7660                                  		jnz	short even_odd	; if not a splitted fat, check even-odd.
  7661                                  		; 25/06/2023
  7662                                  		;mov	al, [bx]	; splitted fat
  7663                                  
  7664                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7665                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_cluster], al
  7666                                  		push	ax ; **	; al = low 8 bits of 12 bits cluster number
  7667                                  
  7668                                  		inc	si		; (next	byte)
  7669                                  
  7670                                  		;push	dx ; 13/12/2023
  7671                                  		xor	dx, dx
  7672                                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7673                                  		;pop	dx ; 13/12/2023
  7674                                  
  7675                                  		;mov	al, ds:0
  7676                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7677                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
  7678                                  		;mov	al, [0] ; 19/10/2022
  7679                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_cluster+1], al
  7680                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_cluster]
  7681                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7682                                  		;mov	al, [cs:temp_cluster]
  7683                                  		pop	ax  ; ** ; al = low 8 bits of 12 bits cluster number
  7684                                  		mov	ah, [0] ; high 4 bits (bits 7 to 11) of 12 bits cluster num
  7685                                  even_odd:
  7686                                  		pop	bx		; restore old fat entry	value
  7687                                  		push	bx		; save it right	away.
  7688                                  		shr	bx, 1		; was it even or odd?
  7689                                  		jnb	short havclus	; it was even.
  7690                                  		shr	ax, 1		; odd. massage fat value and keep
  7691                                  					; the highest 12 bits.
  7692                                  		shr	ax, 1
  7693                                  		shr	ax, 1
  7694                                  		shr	ax, 1
  7695                                  havclus:
  7696                                  		mov	bx, ax		; now bx = new fat entry.
  7697                                  		and	bx, 0FFFh	; keep low 12 bits.
  7698                                  		jmp	short unpackx
  7699                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7700                                  
  7701                                  unpack16:
  7702                                  		;push	dx	; 13/12/2023	
  7703                                  		xor	dx, dx ; 0
  7704                                  		shl	si, 1		; extend to 32 bit offset
  7705                                  		;adc	dx, 0
  7706                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7707                                  		rcl	dx, 1
  7708                                  
  7709                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7710                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
  7711                                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7712                                  		;pop	dx	; 13/12/2023
  7713                                  		mov	bx, [bx]	;
  7714                                  					; bx = new fat entry.
  7715                                  unpackx:
  7716                                  		pop	si		; restore old bx value into si
  7717                                  		pop	ax		; restore logical sector (low)
  7718                                  		pop	dx ; * ; 13/12/2023
  7719                                  		pop	ds
  7720                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7721                                  		; (this is a fast kernel loading method by the MSDOS programmer)
  7722                                  		; ((consequtive clusters --> consequtive sectors))
  7723                                  		; ds = cs
  7724                                  		sub	si, bx
  7725                                  		cmp	si, -1		; one apart? (consequtive?)
  7726                                  					; (current = previous+1)
  7727                                  		jnz	short getcl2	; no, read [doscnt] sectors 
  7728                                  		;add	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7729                                  		add	[doscnt], cx ; 13/12/2023 ; add to read count
  7730                                  		jmp	short unpack
  7731                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7732                                  
  7733                                  getcl2:
  7734                                  		push	bx
  7735                                  		push	dx		; sector to read (high)
  7736                                  		push	ax		; sector to read (low)
  7737                                  
  7738                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7739                                  		; ds = cs
  7740                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  7741                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
  7742                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  7743                                  		mov	cx, [doscnt]
  7744                                  
  7745                                  		pop	dx		; sector to read for diskrd (low)
  7746                                  		;pop	word [cs:start_sec_h]
  7747                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7748                                  		pop	word [start_sec_h]
  7749                                  					; sector to read for diskrd (high)
  7750                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7751                                  		; ds = cs
  7752                                  		;push	ds
  7753                                  		;push	cs
  7754                                  		;pop	ds
  7755                                  
  7756                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7757                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7758                                  		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7759                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7760                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7761                                  		call	call_bios_code	; read the clusters
  7762                                  		
  7763                                  		;pop	ds
  7764                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7765                                  		; ds = cs
  7766                                  		pop	bx
  7767                                  		pop	di
  7768                                  
  7769                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:doscnt]	; get number of	sectors	read
  7770                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7771                                  		mov	ax, [doscnt]
  7772                                  		xchg	ah, al		; multiply by 256
  7773                                  		shl	ax, 1		; times	2 equal	512
  7774                                  		add	di, ax		; update load location
  7775                                  		pop	cx		; restore sectors/cluster
  7776                                  		retn
  7777                                  
  7778                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7779                                  
  7780                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ds:0
  7781                                  ;
  7782                                  ;in). dx:si - offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find. M054
  7783                                  ;     ds - fatloc segment
  7784                                  ;     cs:drvfat - logical drive number, fat id
  7785                                  ;     cs:md_sectorsize
  7786                                  ;     cs:last_fat_secnum - last fat sector number read in.
  7787                                  ;
  7788                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  7789                                  ;      bx = offset value from fatlog segment.
  7790                                  ;      other registera saved.
  7791                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e., when 12 bit fat entry
  7792                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  7793                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  7794                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat.)
  7795                                  
  7796                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7797                                  get_fat_sector:	
  7798                                  		; 14/12/2023
  7799                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7800                                  		; ds = fat buffer segment
  7801                                  
  7802                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7803                                  		;push	ax ; (not necessary)
  7804                                  		push	cx ; read count (sectors per cluster)
  7805                                  		push	di ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load offset
  7806                                  		push	si ; FAT offset value (from fat entry 0)
  7807                                  		push	es ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load segment
  7808                                  		push	ds ; FAT buffer segment
  7809                                  
  7810                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7811                                  		push	cs
  7812                                  		pop	ds
  7813                                  
  7814                                  		mov	ax, si
  7815                                  		;;mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7816                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7817                                  		;mov	cx, [md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7818                                  		;div	cx		; ax = sector number, dx = offset
  7819                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7820                                  		;nop
  7821                                  
  7822                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7823                                  		div	word [md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7824                                  
  7825                                  		; ax = FAT sector (sequence/index) number
  7826                                  		; dx = cluster number offset
  7827                                  
  7828                                  		; Get rid of the assumption that
  7829                                  		; there	is only	one reserved sector
  7830                                  
  7831                                  		; 13/12/2023 ; *
  7832                                  		;push	es ; *
  7833                                  		;push	ds ; *
  7834                                  		;push	di ; *
  7835                                  		push	ax
  7836                                  		;push	cs ; *
  7837                                  		;pop	ds ; *
  7838                                  
  7839                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id
  7840                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7841                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id 
  7842                                  		mov	bp, SETDRIVE
  7843                                  		;;mov	bp, 4D7h	; setdrive
  7844                                  					; at 2C7h:4D7h = 70h:2A47h
  7845                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7846                                  		call	call_bios_code	; get bds for drive
  7847                                  		pop	ax		; (sector number -without reserved and hidden sectors-)
  7848                                  		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
  7849                                  					; add #reserved_sectors
  7850                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7851                                  		;pop	di ; *
  7852                                  		;pop	ds ; *
  7853                                  		;pop	es ; *
  7854                                  
  7855                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7856                                  		; ds = cs
  7857                                  		cmp	ax, [last_fat_sec_num]
  7858                                  		;cmp	ax, [cs:last_fat_sec_num]
  7859                                  		jz	short gfs_split_chk ; don't need to read it again.
  7860                                  		mov	[last_fat_sec_num], ax
  7861                                  		;mov	[cs:last_fat_sec_num], ax
  7862                                  					; sector number
  7863                                  					; (in the partition, without hidden sectors)
  7864                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7865                                  		pop	es ; FAT buffer segment (DS on top of the stack)
  7866                                  		push	es ; (put it on top of the stack again)
  7867                                  
  7868                                  		push	dx ; cluster number offset
  7869                                  
  7870                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7871                                  		xor	cx, cx
  7872                                  		mov	[start_sec_h], cx ;0 
  7873                                  		;mov	word [cs:start_sec_h], 0 
  7874                                  					; prepare to read the fat sector
  7875                                  					; start_sec_h is always	0 for fat sector.
  7876                                  		mov	dx, ax
  7877                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7878                                  		inc	cx ; cx = 1
  7879                                  		;mov	cx, 1		; 1 sector read
  7880                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]
  7881                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]
  7882                                  		;push	ds
  7883                                  		;pop	es
  7884                                  
  7885                                  		xor	di, di	; 0	; es:di	-> fatloc segment:0
  7886                                  		
  7887                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7888                                  		;push	ds
  7889                                  		;push	cs
  7890                                  		;pop	ds
  7891                                  		
  7892                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7893                                  		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7894                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7895                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7896                                  		call	call_bios_code
  7897                                  
  7898                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7899                                  		;pop	ds
  7900                                  		; ds = cs = biosdata segment
  7901                                  
  7902                                  		pop	dx ; cluster number offset 
  7903                                  
  7904                                  gfs_split_chk:
  7905                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7906                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7907                                  		mov	cx, [md_sectorsize]
  7908                                  ;gfs_split_chk:
  7909                                  		dec	cx		; 511
  7910                                  		cmp	dx, cx		; if offset points to the
  7911                                  					; last byte of this sector,
  7912                                  					; then splitted	entry.
  7913                                  		mov	bx, dx		; set bx to dx
  7914                                  		
  7915                                  		; 13/12/2023
  7916                                  		; bx = dx = cluster number offset in the FAT buffer
  7917                                  		pop	ds ; FAT buffer segment
  7918                                  		pop	es ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load segment
  7919                                  		pop	si ; FAT offset value (from fat entry 0)
  7920                                  		pop	di ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load offset
  7921                                  		pop	cx ; read count (sectors per cluster)
  7922                                  		;pop	ax
  7923                                  
  7924                                  		retn
  7925                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7926                                  ;Bios_Data_Init	ends
  7927                                  
  7928                                  %endif
  7929                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7930                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7931                                  
  7932                                  		; 09/12/2022
  7933                                  		;db 0
  7934                                  
  7935                                  numbertodiv	equ ($-BData_start)
  7936                                  numbertomod	equ (numbertodiv % 16)
  7937                                  
  7938                                  %if (numbertomod>0) & (numbertomod<16) ; 17/09/2023
  7939 0000216D 00<rep 3h>              		times (16-numbertomod) db 0
  7940                                  %endif

  7943

  7945                                  IOSYSCODESEGOFF equ $ - BData_start
  7946                                  ; 29/09/2023
  7947                                  ;IOSYSCODESEGOFF equ $-$$
  7948                                  IOSYSCODESEG	equ (IOSYSCODESEGOFF>>4)+(700h>>4)
  7949                                  
  7950                                  ; 28/09/2023
  7951                                  S1SIZE equ $-$$

  7964                                  
  7965                                  section .BIOSCODE vstart=0  
  7966                                  
  7967                                  BCode_start:	 ; 09/12/2022
  7968                                   
  7969                                  ; 02/10/2022
  7970                                  
  7971                                  ;--- DOSBIOS code segment ---------------------------------------------------
  7972                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7973                                  ; MSBIO1.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7974                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7975                                  
  7976                                  DOSBIOSEG_2C7h:	;db 30h dup(0)		; SEGMENT 2C7h (2C70h-700h=2570h)
  7977 00000000 00<rep 30h>             		times 48 db 0		; 19/10/2022	
  7978 00000030 7000                    BiosDataWord:	dw 70h
  7979                                  
  7980                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7981                                  ;BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  7982                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7983                                  BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord
  7984

  7987                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) 
  7988                                  
  7989                                  ;************************************************************************
  7990                                  ;*									*
  7991                                  ;*	seg_reinit is called with ax = our new code segment value,	*
  7992                                  ;*	  trashes di, cx, es						*
  7993                                  ;*									*
  7994                                  ;*	cas -- should be made disposable!				*
  7995                                  ;*									*
  7996                                  ;************************************************************************
  7997                                  
  7998                                  	; 20/09/2023	
  7999                                  	; 10/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  8000                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0032h 
  8001                                  
  8002                                  _seg_reinit:
  8003 00000032 2E8E06[3000]            		mov	es, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
  8004                                  					; at 2C7h:30h or 70h:25A0h
  8005                                  		;mov	di, (offset cdev+2)
  8006 00000037 BF[BF06]                		mov	di, cdev+2	; 19/10/2022
  8007                                  		; 20/09/2023
  8008                                  		;mov	cx, 4		; (end_BC_entries - cdev)/4
  8009                                  		; 10/08/2023
  8010 0000003A B90300                  		mov	cx, 3 ; (PCDOS 7.1)
  8011                                  _seg_reinit_1:
  8012 0000003D AB                      		stosw			; modify Bios_Code entry points
  8013 0000003E 47                      		inc	di
  8014 0000003F 47                      		inc	di
  8015 00000040 E2FB                    		loop	_seg_reinit_1
  8016                                  
  8017                                  		; 10/08/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
  8018                                  		; (direct jump to i2f_handler from BIOSDATA:bios_i2f)
  8019                                  		; (instead of 'bcode_i2f: dw i2f_handler, IOSYSCODESEG')
  8020                                  		
  8021                                  		; 20/09/2023
  8022 00000042 26A3[0800]              		mov	[es:bios_i2f_seg], ax ; actual BIOSCODE segment
  8023                                  		
  8024 00000046 CB                      		retf
  8025                                  
  8026                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8027                                  
  8028                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8029                                  
  8030                                  ;************************************************************************
  8031                                  ;*									*
  8032                                  ;*	chardev_entry - main device driver dispatch routine		*
  8033                                  ;*	   called with a dummy parameter block on the stack		*
  8034                                  ;*	   dw dispatch_table, dw prn/aux numbers (optional)		*
  8035                                  ;*									*
  8036                                  ;*	will eventually take care of doing the transitions in		*
  8037                                  ;*	   out of Bios_Code						*
  8038                                  ;*									*
  8039                                  ;************************************************************************
  8040                                  
  8041                                  chardev_entry:				; 0070h:25B3h =	02C7h:0043h
  8042 00000047 56                      		push	si
  8043 00000048 50                      		push	ax
  8044 00000049 51                      		push	cx
  8045 0000004A 52                      		push	dx
  8046 0000004B 57                      		push	di
  8047 0000004C 55                      		push	bp
  8048 0000004D 1E                      		push	ds
  8049 0000004E 06                      		push	es
  8050 0000004F 53                      		push	bx
  8051 00000050 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
  8052 00000052 8B7612                  		mov	si, [bp+18]	; get return address (dispatch table)
  8053                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
  8054                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  8055 00000055 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  8056                                  		; 20/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:005Ah)
  8057 0000005A C434                    		les	si, [si]
  8058                                  		;mov	ax, [si+2]	; get the device number	if present
  8059 0000005C 8CC0                    		mov	ax, es
  8060 0000005E A2[2100]                		mov	[auxnum], al
  8061 00000061 8826[E704]              		mov	[printdev], ah
  8062                                  		;mov	si, [si]	; point	to the device dispatch table
  8063 00000065 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; get pointer to i/o packet
  8064 00000069 268A4701                		mov	al, [es:bx+1]	; [es:bx+unit]	; al = unit code
  8065 0000006D 268A670D                		mov	ah, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+media]	; ah = media descrip
  8066 00000071 268B4F12                		mov	cx, [es:bx+18]	; [es:bx+count]	; cx = count
  8067 00000075 268B5714                		mov	dx, [es:bx+20]	; [es:bx+start]	; dx = start sector
  8068                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8069 00000079 81FE[3805]              		cmp	si, DSKTBL
  8070                                  		;;cmp	si, 579h	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  8071                                  		;cmp	si, 4A2h	; dsktbl
  8072                                  					; at 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  8073 0000007D 7517                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  8074                                  
  8075                                  ; Special case for 32-bit start sector number:
  8076                                  ;   if (si==dsktbl) /* if this is a disk device call */
  8077                                  ;      set high 16 bits of secnum to 0
  8078                                  ;      if (secnum == 0xffff) fetch 32 bit sector number
  8079                                  ;
  8080                                  ; pass high word of sector number in start_sec_h, low word in dx
  8081                                  ;
  8082                                  ; note: start_l and start_h are the offsets within the io_request packet
  8083                                  ;	  which contain the low and hi words of the 32 bit start sector if
  8084                                  ;	  it has been used.
  8085                                  ;
  8086                                  ; note: remember not to destroy the registers which have been set up before
  8087                                  
  8088                                  		; 20/09/2023
  8089                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	0 ; initialize to 0
  8090 0000007F C706[2305]0000          		mov	word [start_sec_h], 0
  8091 00000085 83FAFF                  		cmp	dx, 0FFFFh
  8092 00000088 750C                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  8093 0000008A 268B571C                		mov	dx, [es:bx+28]	; [es:bx+start_h]
  8094                                  					; 32 bits dsk req
  8095                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	dx ; start_sec_h = packet.start_h
  8096 0000008E 8916[2305]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx
  8097 00000092 268B571A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+26]	; [es:bx+start_l]
  8098                                  					; dx = packet.start_l
  8099                                  no_sector32_mapping:			
  8100 00000096 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  8101 00000097 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+cmd]
  8102 0000009B 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, [cs:si]
  8103 0000009E 732B                    		jnb	short command_error

  8109 000000AA FC                      		cld

  8111 000000AB 2EFF5401                		call	near [cs:si+1]
  8112                                  		;call	word ptr cs:si+1
  8113 000000AF 7202                    		jb	short already_got_ah_status
  8114 000000B1 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  8115                                  already_got_ah_status:

  8119 000000B3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022

  8122 000000BC 894703                  		mov	[bx+3],	ax	; [bx+status]
  8123                                  					; mark operation complete
  8124 000000BF 5B                      		pop	bx
  8125 000000C0 07                      		pop	es

  8135 000000C8 44                      		inc	sp
  8136 000000C9 44                      		inc	sp	
  8137                                  
  8138                                  		; fall through into bc_retf
  8139                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------	
  8140                                  bc_retf:
  8141 000000CA CB                      		retf
  8142                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8143                                  
  8144                                  command_error:				
  8145 000000CB E80700                  		call	bc_cmderr
  8146 000000CE EBE3                    		jmp	short already_got_ah_status
  8147                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8148                                  ; 01/05/2019
  8149                                  
  8150                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8151                                  ; The following piece of hack is for supporting CP/M compatibility
  8152                                  ; Basically at offset 5 we have a far call into 0:c0. But this does not call
  8153                                  ; 0:c0 directly instead it call f01d:fef0, because it needs to support 'lhld 6'
  8154                                  ; The following hack has to reside at ffff:d0 (= f01d:fef0) if BIOS is loaded
  8155                                  ; high.
  8156                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8157                                  
  8158                                  
  8159                                  		;db 7 dup(0)
  8160                                  
  8161                                  		; 20/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
  8162                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0D0h)
  8163                                  		; 15/10/2022
  8164                                  		;dw 0		; pad to bring offset to 0D0h
  8165                                  
  8166 000000D0 00<rep 5h>              off_d0: 	times 5 db 0	; 5 bytes from 0:c0 will be copied onto here
  8167                                  				;  which is the CP/M call 5 entry point
  8168                                  		
  8169                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8170                                  
  8171                                  ;	exit - all routines return through this path
  8172                                  
  8173                                  bc_cmderr:				
  8174 000000D5 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  8175                                  					; unknown command error
  8176                                  
  8177                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8178                                  
  8179                                  ;	now zero the count field by subtracting its current value,
  8180                                  ;	  which is still in cx, from itself.
  8181                                  
  8182                                  ;	subtract the number of i/o's NOT YET COMPLETED from total
  8183                                  ;	  in order to return the number actually complete
  8184                                  
  8185                                  bc_err_cnt:	
  8186                                  		;les	bx, ds:ptrsav
  8187                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8188 000000D7 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  8189 000000DB 26294F12                		sub	[es:bx+18], cx	; [es:bx+count]
  8190                                  					; # of successful i/o's
  8191 000000DF B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; mark error return
  8192 000000E1 F9                      		stc			; indicate abnormal end
  8193 000000E2 C3                      		retn
  8194                                  
  8195                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8196                                  
  8197                                  ;Bios_Code ends
