  9367                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
  9368 000004B3 86D0                    		xchg	dl, al
  9369 000004B5 E81100                  		call	bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
  9370 000004B8 86F0                    		xchg	dh, al
  9371 000004BA E80C00                  		call	bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
  9372 000004BD 86C8                    		xchg	cl, al
  9373 000004BF E80700                  		call	bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
  9374 000004C2 88C5                    		mov	ch, al
  9375 000004C4 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt] ; restore original value
  9376 000004C8 C3                      		retn
  9377                                  
  9378                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9379                                  
  9380                                  bintobcd:	; proc near		; real time clock support
  9381                                  
  9382                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
  9383                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
  9384                                  		
  9385 000004C9 D40A                    		aam			; AH = AL/10, AL = AL MOD 10
  9386 000004CB D510                    		aad     10h             ; db 0D5h,10h
  9387                                  					; AL = (AH*10H)+AL, AH = 0
  9388 000004CD C3                      		retn
  9389                                  %endif
  9390                                  
  9391                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9392                                  
  9393                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9394                                  
  9395                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9396                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9397                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9398                                  ;
  9399                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9400                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9401                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9402                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9403                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9404                                  ;
  9405                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9406                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9407                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9408                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9409                                  
  9410                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9411 000004CE E84B00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9412 000004D1 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9413                                  
  9414                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9415                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9416                                  ;
  9417                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9418                                  ;	       ----------------
  9419                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9420                                  ;
  9421                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9422                                  ;
  9423                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9424                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9425                                  ;		1,193,180
  9426                                  ;
  9427                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9428                                  ;
  9429                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9430                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9431                                  ;		59,659
  9432                                  ;
  9433                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9434                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9435                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9436                                  ;
  9437                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9438                                  ; multiply by 5
  9439                                  
  9440 000004D5 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9441 000004D7 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9442                                  					; multiply by 5
  9443 000004D9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9444 000004DB D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9445 000004DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9446 000004DF D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9447 000004E1 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9448 000004E3 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9449 000004E5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9450                                  
  9451                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9452                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9453                                  
  9454 000004E6 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9455 000004E9 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9456                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9457                                  
  9458                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9459                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9460 000004EB 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9461 000004EC 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9462 000004EE F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9463                                  
  9464                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9465                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9466                                  
  9467 000004F0 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9468 000004F2 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9469                                  
  9470                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9471                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9472                                  
  9473 000004F5 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9474 000004F7 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9475 000004FA 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9476 000004FC 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9477                                  noadj:					
  9478 000004FF F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9479 00000500 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9480                                  
  9481                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9482                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9483                                  
  9484 00000502 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9485 00000504 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9486 00000506 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9487 00000508 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9488 0000050B F7F1                    		div	cx
  9489 0000050D 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9490 0000050F F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9491 00000511 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9492                                  
  9493                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9494                                  
  9495                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9496                                  		;push	ax
  9497                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9498 00000513 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9499 00000514 AB                      		stosw
  9500                                  		;pop	ax
  9501 00000515 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9502 00000516 AB                      		stosw
  9503 00000517 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9504 00000519 AB                      		stosw
  9505 0000051A F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9506                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9507                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9508                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9509                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9510 0000051B C3                      		retn
  9511                                  
  9512                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9513                                  
  9514                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9515                                  
  9516                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9517                                  ;
  9518                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9519                                  ;
  9520                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9521                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9522                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9523                                  ;
  9524                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9525                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9526                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9527                                  ;			else
  9528                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9529                                  ;		}
  9530                                  ;
  9531                                  ; USES : AX
  9532                                  ;
  9533                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9534                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9535                                  ;
  9536                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9537                                  
  9538                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9539                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9540 0000051C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9541 0000051E CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9542                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9543                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9544                                  					; midnight
  9545                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9546 00000520 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9547 00000525 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9548 00000527 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9549                                  					; and not flag
  9550 00000529 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9551 0000052D C3                      		retn
  9552                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9553                                  
  9554                                  inc_case:				
  9555 0000052E 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9556 00000530 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9557 00000532 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9558                                  no_rollover:				
  9559 00000536 C3                      		retn
  9560                                  
  9561                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9562                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
  9563                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9564                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9565                                  ; 09/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9566                                  
  9567                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 3.3 - 02/02/1988
  9568                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9569                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
  9570                                  
  9571                                  ;error_unknown_media equ	7	; for use in BUILD BPB call
  9572                                  
  9573                                  ;struc BPB_TYPE
  9574                                  ;.SECSIZE:	resw 1
  9575                                  ;.SECALL:	resb 1

  9579                                  ;.SECNUM:	resw 1
  9580                                  ;.FATID:	resb 1

  9582                                  ;.SLIM:		resw 1

  9585                                  ;.size:

  9588                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9589                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9590                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9591                                  
  9592                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9593                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9594                                  
  9595                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9596                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9597                                  
  9598                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9599                                  
  9600                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9601                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9602                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9603                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9604                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9605                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9606                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9607                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9608                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9609                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9610                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9611                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9612                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9613                                  
  9614                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9615                                  
  9616                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9617                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9618                                  ;
  9619                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9620                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9621                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9622                                  ;   else
  9623                                  ;	set slow = value
  9624                                  ;   ...
  9625                                  ;*********************************************
  9626                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9627                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9628                                  ;*	 use slow
  9629                                  ;*   else
  9630                                  ;*	 use fast
  9631                                  ;*********************************************
  9632                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9633                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9634                                  ;	use slow
  9635                                  ;   else
  9636                                  ;	use fast
  9637                                  ;   ...
  9638                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9639                                  ;
  9640                                  ;
  9641                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9642                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9643                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9644                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9645                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9646                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9647                                  
  9648                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9649                                  
  9650                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9651                                  
  9652                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9653                                  
  9654                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9655                                  ;	command jump table
  9656                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9657                                  
  9658 00000537 00                      		db 0
  9659                                  ; 11/12/2022
  9660                                  %if 0
  9661                                  
  9662                                  dsktbl:		db 26			; 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  9663                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26
  9664                                  		dw 1742h		; dsk_init
  9665                                  		dw 4EBh			; media_chk
  9666                                  		dw 592h			; get_bpb
  9667                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9668                                  		dw 857h			; dsk_read
  9669                                  		dw 83Dh			; x_bus_exit
  9670                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9671                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9672                                  		dw 849h			; dsk_writ
  9673                                  		dw 841h			; dsk_writv
  9674                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9675                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9676                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9677                                  		dw 80Ah			; dsk_open
  9678                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close
  9679                                  		dw 831h			; dsk_rem
  9680                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9681                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9682                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9683                                  		dw 0C6Bh		; do_generic_ioctl
  9684                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9685                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9686                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9687                                  		dw 1124h		; ioctl_getown
  9688                                  		dw 1142h		; ioctl_setown
  9689                                  		dw 129Ah		; ioctl_support_query
  9690                                  
  9691                                  ;dtbl_siz equ $-dsktbl
  9692                                  
  9693                                  %endif
  9694                                  		; 11/12/2022
  9695 00000538 1A                      dsktbl:		db (dtbl_siz-1)/2	; 26 ; this is the size of the table
  9696 00000539 [5E17]                  		dw dsk_init
  9697 0000053B [8105]                  		dw media_chk
  9698 0000053D [2006]                  		dw get_bpb
  9699 0000053F [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr
  9700 00000541 [D008]                  		dw dsk_read
  9701 00000543 [B608]                  		dw x_bus_exit
  9702 00000545 [EB05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9703 00000547 [EB05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9704 00000549 [C208]                  		dw dsk_writ
  9705 0000054B [BA08]                  		dw dsk_writv
  9706 0000054D [EB05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9707 0000054F [EB05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9708 00000551 [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr
  9709 00000553 [8608]                  		dw dsk_open
  9710 00000555 [9508]                  		dw dsk_close
  9711 00000557 [AB08]                  		dw dsk_rem
  9712 00000559 [EB05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9713 0000055B [EB05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9714 0000055D [EB05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9715 0000055F [DD0C]                  		dw do_generic_ioctl
  9716 00000561 [EB05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9717 00000563 [EB05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9718 00000565 [EB05]                  		dw ret_carry_clear
  9719 00000567 [7411]                  		dw ioctl_getown
  9720 00000569 [9111]                  		dw ioctl_setown
  9721 0000056B [DF12]                  		dw ioctl_support_query
  9722                                  
  9723                                  dtbl_siz equ $-dsktbl
  9724                                  
  9725                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9726                                  
  9727                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9728                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9729                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9730                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9731                                  ;
  9732                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9733                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9734                                  
  9735                                  SetDrive:	
  9736                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9737 0000056D C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9738                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9739 00000571 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9740 00000575 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9741 00000577 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9742 0000057A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9743 0000057D 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9744 0000057F F9                      		stc
  9745                                  X_SetDrv:				
  9746 00000580 C3                      		retn
  9747                                  
  9748                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9749                                  
  9750                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9751                                  
  9752                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9753                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9754                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9755                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9756                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9757                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9758                                  
  9759                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
  9760 00000581 E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
  9761 00000584 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9762 00000587 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9763                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9764 0000058C 7415                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9765                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9766 0000058E 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9767                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9768                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9769 00000593 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9770                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9771 00000598 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9772                                  					; fnon_removable
  9773 0000059D 740B                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
  9774                                  		;mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9775                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9776 0000059F F7DE                    		neg	si		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05E0h
  9777 000005A1 EB2B                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9778                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9779                                  
  9780                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9781                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9782 000005A3 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9783 000005A8 7524                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9784                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9785                                  		;xor	si, si ; 0	; Presume "I don't know"
  9786                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9787 000005AA 4E                      		dec	si ; 0 		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05EBh
  9788                                  
  9789                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9790                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9791                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9792                                  
  9793 000005AB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9794 000005B0 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9795 000005B2 E88112                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9796 000005B5 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9797 000005B7 E8D113                  		call	haschange
  9798 000005BA 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9799                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
  9800                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
  9801                                  			
  9802 000005BC BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
  9803 000005BF A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
  9804 000005C2 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9805                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9806 000005C6 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9807 000005C8 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
  9808 000005CB EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done
  9809                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9810                                  
  9811                                  Media_Unk:				
  9812 000005CD 4E                      		dec	si		; ; Return "I don't know"
  9813                                  
  9814                                  		; SI now contains the correct value for media change.
  9815                                  		; Clean up the left overs
  9816                                  Media_Done:	
  9817                                  		; 19/10/2022			
  9818 000005CE 06                      		push	es
  9819 000005CF C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]

  9841                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9842                                  
  9843                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9844                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9845                                  ; drive.
  9846                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9847                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9848                                  ; returns in si:
  9849                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9850                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9851                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9852                                  ;
  9853                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9854                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9855                                  
  9856                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9857                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9858 000005F3 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9859 000005F6 E823FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9860 000005F9 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9861                                  					; get stored time
  9862 000005FD 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9863 000005FF 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9864 00000603 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9865                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9866                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
  9867                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
  9868 00000605 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9869 00000607 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9870 00000609 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9871                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9872                                  		;inc	al
  9873                                  		;cmp	al, 5
  9874                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
  9875                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9876                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9877                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
  9878                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9879                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9880                                  		;dec	al
  9881                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9882                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9883 0000060B 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
  9884 00000610 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
  9885 00000612 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9886 00000616 C3                      		retn
  9887                                  
  9888                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9889                                  
  9890                                  timepassed:
  9891 00000617 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9892                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9893 0000061A 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9894                                  
  9895                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9896                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9897 0000061C 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9898                                  timecheck_ret:
  9899                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9900                                  		;mov	[accesscount], al
  9901 0000061D C3                      		retn

 10039                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'

 10068                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10069                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10070                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10071                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10072                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10073                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10074                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10075                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10076                                  ;
 10077                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10078                                  ;
 10079                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10080                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10081                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10082                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10083                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10084                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10085                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10086                                  ;
 10087                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10088                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10089                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10090                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10091

 10257                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10258                                  
 10259                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10260                                  
 10261                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10262                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10263                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10264                                  ;
 10265                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10266                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10267                                  
 10268                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10269                                  
 10270                                  readbootsec:	
 10271 0000074C B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10272 0000074E B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10273 00000751 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10274 00000754 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10275 00000756 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10276                                  
 10277                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10278                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10279                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10280                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10281                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10282                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10283                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10284                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10285                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10286                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10287                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10288                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10289                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10290                                  		; informations
 10291                                  
 10292                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10293                                  
 10294                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10295                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10296                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10297                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10298                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10299                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10300                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10301                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10302                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10303                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10304                                  
 10305                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10306 00000758 A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10307 0000075B 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10308 0000075D 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10309                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10310 0000075F 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10311 00000761 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10312                                  					; no need for nop
 10313 00000763 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10314 00000765 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10315 00000767 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10316 0000076C 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10317                                  
 10318                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10319                                  ;
 10320                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10321                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10322                                  ;;
 10323                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10324                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10325                                  ;;
 10326                                  ;;check_signature:
 10327                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10328                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10329                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10330                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10331                                  
 10332                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10333                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10334                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10335                                  
 10336                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10337                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 10338 0000076E A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10339                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10340 00000771 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10341 00000772 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10342 00000774 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10343 00000776 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10344 00000777 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10345                                  
 10346                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10347                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10348                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10349                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10350                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10351                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10352                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10353                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10354                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10355                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10356                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10357                                  
 10358                                  checksinglesided:
 10359                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10360                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10361                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10362 00000779 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10363 0000077B 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10364 0000077D A801                    		test	al, 1
 10365 0000077F 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10366 00000781 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10367 00000787 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10368 00000789 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10369 0000078E 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10370                                  
 10371                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10372                                  
 10373                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10374 00000790 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10375                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10376 00000795 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10377                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10378                                  
 10379                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10380 00000797 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10381                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10382                                  movbpb_ret:
 10383                                  gooddsk:				
 10384 00000798 F8                      		clc
 10385                                  err_ret:
 10386 00000799 C3                      		retn
 10387                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10388                                  
 10389                                  		; 10/12/2022

 10391                                  		;retn

 10393                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10394                                  
 10395                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10396                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10397                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10398                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10399                                  ;
 10400                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10401                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10402                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10403                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10404                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10405                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10406                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10407                                  
 10408                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10409                                  
 10410                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10411                                  movbpb:	
 10412 0000079A 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10413                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10414                                  					; sectors per unit
 10415 0000079E 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10416                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10417                                  					; number of directory entries
 10418 000007A2 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10419                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10420                                  					; size of drive
 10421 000007A6 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10422                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10423                                  					; media	descriptor
 10424 000007AA A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10425                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10426                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10427 000007AD 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10428                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10429                                  					; sectors per track
 10430 000007B1 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10431                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10432                                  					; number of heads
 10433 000007B5 803E[0205]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10434 000007BA 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10435 000007BC E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10436 000007BF 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10437 000007C1 C606[0205]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10438                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10439 000007C6 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1

 10441 000007CD E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10442                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10443                                  		; cf = 0
 10444                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10445                                  		;clc
 10446 000007D0 C3                      		retn

 10448                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10449                                  
 10450                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10451                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10452                                  ;by es:di.
 10453                                  
 10454                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10455                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10456                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10457                                  ;      the boot record information.

 10459                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10460

 10470 000007DD 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]

 10472                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10473 000007E5 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10474 000007E9 57                      		push	di
 10475 000007EA 56                      		push	si
 10476 000007EB B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10477 000007EE BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh

 10505                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10506                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10507                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10508                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10509                                  ; output:
 10510                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10511                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit

 10526                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10527                                  
 10528                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10529                                  
 10530                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10531                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10532                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10533                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10534                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10535                                  ;		dh has head
 10536                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10537                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10538                                  ;
 10539                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10540                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10541                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10542                                  ;
 10543                                  ;		carry set
 10544                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10545                                  ;
 10546                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10547                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10548                                  
 10549                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10550                                  
 10551                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10552                                  read_sector:	
 10553 00000813 55                      		push	bp
 10554 00000814 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10555 00000817 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10556 0000081B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10557                                  rd_ret:					
 10558 0000081E 06                      		push	es
 10559 0000081F 1E                      		push	ds
 10560 00000820 07                      		pop	es
 10561 00000821 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10562 00000824 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10563                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10564                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10565                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10566 00000826 07                      		pop	es
 10567 00000827 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10568                                  rd_rty:					
 10569 00000829 E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10570 0000082C 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10571 0000082E 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10572                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10573                                  					; fnon_removable
 10574 00000833 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10575 00000835 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10576 0000083A 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10577 0000083C 50                      		push	ax
 10578 0000083D 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10579 0000083E C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10580                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10581                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10582                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10583                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10584 00000842 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10585 00000844 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10586                                  		; 
 10587 00000847 1F                      		pop	ds
 10588 00000848 A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10589 0000084B 58                      		pop	ax
 10590                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10591 0000084C 06                      		push	es
 10592 0000084D 1E                      		push	ds
 10593 0000084E 07                      		pop	es
 10594 0000084F B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10595 00000852 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10596                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10597                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10598                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10599 00000854 07                      		pop	es
 10600 00000855 9C                      		pushf
 10601 00000856 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10602 0000085B 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10603 0000085D 50                      		push	ax
 10604 0000085E A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10605 00000861 1E                      		push	ds
 10606 00000862 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10607 00000866 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10608 00000869 1F                      		pop	ds
 10609 0000086A 58                      		pop	ax
 10610                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10611 0000086B 9D                      		popf
 10612 0000086C 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10613 0000086E EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10614                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10615                                  
 10616                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10617 00000870 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10618                                  					; return error
 10619 00000872 F9                      		stc
 10620                                  
 10621                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10622                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10623                                  
 10624                                  okret2:					
 10625 00000873 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10626 00000877 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10627 0000087B 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10628                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10629                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred
 10630 0000087F 9C                      		pushf
 10631 00000880 E8FD03                  		call	set_tim
 10632 00000883 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10633 00000884 5D                      		pop	bp
 10634 00000885 C3                      		retn

 10640                                  dsk_open:				; 2C7h:80Ah = 70h:2D7Ah

 10727                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 10729                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10730                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10731                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10732                                  
 10733                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10734                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10735                                  ;
 10736                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data

 10738                                  
 10739                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10740                                  checksingle:		
 10741 000008D5 50                      		push	ax
 10742 000008D6 53                      		push	bx
 10743 000008D7 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10744                                  
 10745                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10746                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10747                                  
 10748 000008DB F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10749 000008DE 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10750 000008E0 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10751                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10752 000008E3 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10753                                  
 10754                                  
 10755                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10756                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10757                                  
 10758 000008E5 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10759                                  					; get physical drive number

 10761 000008EA 57                      		push	di
 10762 000008EB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10763                                  scan_list:				
 10764 000008EF 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10765 000008F3 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10766 000008F5 B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10767 000008F7 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10768 000008FB 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10769 000008FD 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10770 00000901 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10771 00000902 07                      		pop	es
 10772 00000903 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10773                                  
 10774                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10775                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10776                                  ; in this case.

 10778 0000090C 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner

 10784                                  					; get the DOS drive letter

 10791 00000923 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10792                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10793                                  
 10794                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10795                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10796                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10797                                  
 10798                                  not_fsetowner:

 10801 0000092C 50                      		push	ax
 10802 0000092D 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10803 00000931 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10804 00000933 06                      		push	es
 10805 00000934 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10806 00000938 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]

 10813                                  ignore_sdsb:

 10817                                  
 10818                                  scan_skip:

 10851                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10852                                  
 10853                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10854                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10855                                  ;
 10856                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10857                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10858                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10859                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10860                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10861                                  ;	ds = cs
 10862                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10863                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10864                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10865                                  ;
 10866                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10867                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10868                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10869                                  
 10870                                  diskrd:	
 10871                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10872                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10873 0000095E C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10874                                  
 10875                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10876                                  
 10877                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10878                                  diskio:
 10879 00000963 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10880 00000965 8C06[2F05]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10881 00000969 E801FC                  		call	SetDrive
 10882 0000096C 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10883 00000970 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10884                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10885 00000973 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10886                                  
 10887                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10888                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10889                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10890                                  
 10891 00000975 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10892                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10893                                  					; unformatted_media
 10894 0000097A 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive

 10896 00000980 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10897                                  
 10898                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10899                                  
 10900 00000984 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10901 00000986 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10902 00000988 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10903                                  		;adc	si, 0
 10904                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10905 0000098A D1D6                    		rcl	si, 1
 10906 0000098C 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10907                                  					; > 32 bit sector ?
 10908 00000991 740C                    		jz	short sanity32
 10909                                  		;cmp	si, 0
 10910                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10911 00000993 09F6                    		or	si, si
 10912 00000995 75BF                    		jnz	short baddrive
 10913 00000997 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10914 0000099B 77B9                    		ja	short baddrive
 10915 0000099D EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 10916                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10917                                  
 10918                                  sanity32:				
 10919 0000099F 0336[2305]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 10920 000009A3 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 10921 000009A7 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 10922 000009A9 77AB                    		ja	short baddrive
 10923 000009AB 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 10924 000009AF 77A5                    		ja	short baddrive
 10925                                  
 10926                                  sanityok:				
 10927 000009B1 8B16[2305]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 10928 000009B5 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 10929 000009B9 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 10930                                  
 10931                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 10932                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 10933                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 10934                                  
 10935 000009BD A3[2505]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 10936                                  
 10937                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 10938                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 10939                                  
 10940 000009C0 06                      		push	es
 10941                                  		;mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10942                                  		; 02/09/2023

 10944 000009C3 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
 10945 000009C5 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]

 10947                                  					; current disk parm table

 10949 000009CE 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 10950 000009D2 07                      		pop	es
 10951 000009D3 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10952                                  					; fnon_removable
 10953 000009D8 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 10954 000009DA E8F8FE                  		call	checksingle
 10955                                  
 10956                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 10957                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 10958                                  ; the proper error code.
 10959                                  
 10960 000009DD 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 10961 000009E2 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 10962 000009E4 E8960E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 10963                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 10964                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 10965 000009E7 E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 10966                                  
 10967                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 10968                                  
 10969                                  skip_setup:
 10970                                  
 10971                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 10972                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 10973                                  				
 10974 000009EA 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10975 000009EC 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10976                                  		;div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10977                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 10978                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10979 000009EE 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]
 10980 000009F2 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10981 000009F4 A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10982 000009F7 A1[2505]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 10983 000009FA F7F1                    		div	cx ; 02/09/2023
 10984                                  		;div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10985                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 10986                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 10987                                  		; 18/12/2022

 10989 000009FD 8816[3101]              		mov	[cursec], dl	; save current sector
 10990 00000A01 268B4D15                		mov	cx, [es:di+15h]	; es:di+BDS.heads]
 10991                                  					; get number of	heads
 10992 00000A05 50                      		push	ax
 10993 00000A06 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10994 00000A08 A1[2105]                		mov	ax, [temp_h]	; divide tracks	by heads per cylinder

 10996 00000A0D A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax

 11001 00000A1A 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024	; 2^10 currently maxium	for track #.
 11002 00000A1D 770F                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg

 11004 00000A23 A3[3301]                		mov	[curtrk], ax	; save current track
 11005                                  
 11006                                  ; we are now set up for the i/o. normally, we consider the dma boundary
 11007                                  ; violations here. not true. we perform the operation as if everything is
 11008                                  ; symmetric; let the int 13 handler worry about the dma violations.
 11009

 11011 00000A29 E88400                  		call	block		; (cas - call/ret)

 11013                                  		;retn
 11014                                  		; 18/12/2022
 11015 00000A2C EB4B                    		jmp	done
 11016

 11018                                  
 11019                                  baddrive_brdg:

 11021                                  
 11022                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11023                                  
 11024                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 11025                                  ; set the drive-last-accessed flag for diskette only. 
 11026                                  ; we know that the hard disk will not be removed.
 11027                                  ; es:di -> current bds.
 11028                                  ; ds -> Bios_Data
 11029                                  ; ax,cx,si are destroyed.
 11030                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 11031                                  
 11032                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11033                                  iosetup:	
 11034 00000A31 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 11035 00000A35 A2[1E01]                		mov	[tim_drv], al	; save drive letter
 11036                                  
 11037                                  ; determine proper head settle values
 11038                                  
 11039 00000A38 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 11040 00000A3D 7539                    		jnz	short skip_dpt_setting
 11041 00000A3F A0[2C01]                		mov	al, [eot]	; fetch	up eot before changing ds
 11042 00000A42 1E                      		push	ds
 11043 00000A43 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 11044 00000A47 884404                  		mov	[si+4],	al
 11045 00000A4A 8A440A                  		mov	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 11046 00000A4D 8A6404                  		mov	ah, [si+4]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_EOT]
 11047 00000A50 1F                      		pop	ds
