 13670 00001427 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13671                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13672                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13673 0000142A 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13674                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13675 0000142D 011E[9508]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13676 00001431 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13677 00001433 C706[9508]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13678                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13679                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13680                                  InsuffHMA:
 13681 00001439 1F                      		pop	ds
 13682                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13683                                  try_3:		
 13684                                  		;jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13685                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13686 0000143A CF                      		iret
 13687                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13688                                  
 13689                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13690                                  ;try_3:
 13691                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13692                                  
 13693                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13694                                  
 13695                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13696                                  
 13697                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13698                                  ;
 13699                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13700                                  ;
 13701                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13702                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13703                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13704                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13705                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13706                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13707                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13708                                  ;
 13709                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13710                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13711                                  ;
 13712                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13713                                  
 13714                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13715                                  HMAPtr:
 13716 0000143B 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13717                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13718 00001440 8B3E[9508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13719                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13720 00001444 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13721 00001447 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13722 00001449 803E[9B08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13723                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13724 0000144E 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13725 00001450 FF1E[9708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13726                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13727 00001454 8B3E[9508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13728                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13729                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13730 00001458 C3                      		retn
 13731                                  
 13732                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13733                                  
 13734                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13735                                  
 13736                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13737                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13738                                  
 13739                                  move_sector:
 13740                                  
 13741                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13742                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13743                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13744                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13745                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13746                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13747                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13748                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13749                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13750                                  ;
 13751                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13752                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13753                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13754                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13755                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13756                                  
 13757 00001459 FC                      		cld
 13758 0000145A 51                      		push	cx
 13759 0000145B B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13760 0000145E 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13761 00001462 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13762 00001464 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13763 00001468 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13764 0000146A F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13765 0000146C 59                      		pop	cx
 13766 0000146D C3                      		retn
 13767                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13768                                  
 13769                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13770 0000146E D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13771 00001470 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13772 00001472 59                      		pop	cx
 13773 00001473 C3                      		retn
 13774                                  
 13775                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13776                                  
 13777                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13778                                  
 13779                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13780                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13781                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13782                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13783                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13784                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13785                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13786                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13787                                  ;
 13788                                  ; input conditions:
 13789                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13790                                  ;
 13791                                  ; output:
 13792                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13793                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13794                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13795                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13796                                  
 13797                                  check_wrap:	
 13798 00001474 50                      		push	ax
 13799 00001475 53                      		push	bx
 13800 00001476 06                      		push	es
 13801 00001477 57                      		push	di
 13802 00001478 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13803 0000147B 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13804                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13805 0000147D 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13806                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13807 00001482 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13808 00001484 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13809 00001488 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13810 0000148A 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13811 0000148D 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13812 0000148F 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13813 00001491 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13814                                  
 13815                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13816                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13817                                  
 13818 00001493 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13819 00001495 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13820                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13821 00001497 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13822 00001498 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13823                                  					; if on	boundary
 13824                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13825                                  not_on_bound:
 13826 0000149A 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13827 0000149D 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13828 0000149F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13829 000014A1 40                      		inc	ax
 13830 000014A2 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13831 000014A4 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13832                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13833 000014A7 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13834 000014AB 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13835                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13836                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13837 000014AD 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13838 000014AF 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13839 000014B0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13840                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13841 000014B2 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13842                                  
 13843                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13844                                  
 13845 000014B4 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13846 000014B6 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13847 000014B8 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13848                                  
 13849                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13850                                  
 13851 000014BA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13852 000014BC 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13853 000014BE 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13854                                  no_head_bound:				
 13855 000014BF 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13856 000014C1 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13857 000014C2 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13858 000014C4 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13859 000014C6 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13860 000014C8 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13861 000014CB B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13862 000014CD 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13863 000014CF D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13864 000014D1 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13865 000014D3 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13866 000014D5 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13867 000014D7 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13868 000014D9 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13869                                  no_wrap:				
 13870 000014DB F8                      		clc
 13871 000014DC 5F                      		pop	di
 13872 000014DD 07                      		pop	es
 13873 000014DE 5B                      		pop	bx
 13874 000014DF 58                      		pop	ax
 13875 000014E0 C3                      		retn
 13876                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13877                                  
 13878                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13879 000014E1 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13880 000014E3 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13881 000014E5 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13882                                  
 13883                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13884                                  
 13885                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13886                                  
 13887                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13888                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13889                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13890                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13891                                  ;
 13892                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13893                                  
 13894                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13895                                  find_bds:	
 13896 000014E7 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13897                                  fbds_1:					
 13898 000014EB 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13899 000014EF 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13900 000014F1 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13901                                  					; go to next bds
 13902 000014F4 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13903 000014F7 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13904 000014F9 F9                      		stc
 13905                                  fdbs_2:					
 13906 000014FA C3                      		retn
 13907                                  
 13908                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13909                                  
 13910                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13911                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13912                                  doint:
 13913                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13914 000014FB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13915                                  					; get physical drive number
 13916                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13917                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13918                                  		
 13919 000014FE 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13920 00001500 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13921 00001502 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13922                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13923 00001504 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13924                                  					; get request code
 13925                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13926 00001507 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13927                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13928 0000150A 9D                      		popf
 13929                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13930                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13931 0000150B 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13932                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13933                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13934 00001510 9C                      		pushf
 13935                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13936 00001511 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13937                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13938                                  dointdone:				
 13939 00001514 C3                      		retn
 13940                                  
 13941                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13942                                  
 13943                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13944                                  
 13945                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13946                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13947                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13948                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13949                                  ;
 13950                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13951                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13952                                  ;
 13953                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13954                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13955                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13956                                  
 13957                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13958                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13959                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13960                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13961                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13962                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13963                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13964                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13965                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13966                                  ;end struc
 13967                                  
 13968                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13969                                  
 13970                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13971                                  ;	ah = function
 13972                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13973                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13974                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13975                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13976                                  ;   output conditions:
 13977                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13978                                  
 13979                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13980                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13981                                  ;
 13982                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13983                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13984                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13985                                  
 13986                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13987                                  
 13988                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13989                                  
 13990 00001515 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13991                                  
 13992                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13993                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13994                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13995                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13996                                  
 13997                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13998                                  
 13999                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14000                                  
 14001                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14002                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14003                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14004                                  
 14005                                  format_special_stuff:			
 14006 00001519 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14007 0000151E 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14008 00001520 53                      		push	bx
 14009 00001521 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14010 00001524 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14011 00001527 5B                      		pop	bx
 14012 00001528 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14013                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14014                                  
 14015                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14016                                  
 14017                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14018                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14019                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14020                                  
 14021                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14022                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 14023 0000152A 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14024 0000152C 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14025 0000152E 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14026 0000152F 51                      		push	cx
 14027 00001530 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14028 00001532 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14029 00001534 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14030 00001536 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14031 0000153A 59                      		pop	cx
 14032 0000153B 58                      		pop	ax
 14033 0000153C 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14034                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14035 0000153E 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14036 0000153F 06                      		push	es
 14037                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14038 00001540 2EC41E[1515]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14039                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14040                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14041 00001545 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14042 00001547 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14043 0000154A 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14044                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14045                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14046 0000154E 07                      		pop	es
 14047 0000154F 5B                      		pop	bx
 14048 00001550 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14049                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14050                                  
 14051                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14052                                  
 14053                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14054                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14055                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14056                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14057                                  
 14058                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 14059 00001552 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14060                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14061 00001557 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14062 00001559 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14063                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14064 0000155E 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14065                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 14066 00001560 50                      		push	ax
 14067 00001561 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14068                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14069                                  		; 17/10/2022

 14071                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14072                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14073 00001568 58                      		pop	ax
 14074 00001569 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14075                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14076                                  
 14077                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14078                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14079                                  
 14080                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14081                                  
 14082                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14083                                  
 14084                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14085                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14086                                  
 14087                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14088 0000156B 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14089                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14090                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14091 0000156C 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14092                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14093                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14094                                  
 14095                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14096                                  
 14097 00001571 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14098 00001574 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14099 00001577 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14100                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14101                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 14102 00001579 803E[2905]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14103 0000157E 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14104                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14105                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14106                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 14107 00001580 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14108                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14109                                  		
 14110 00001585 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14111                                  		
 14112 00001586 803E[3606]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14113                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14114 0000158B 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14115                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14116                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 14117 0000158D 9D                      		popf
 14118 0000158E 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14119                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14120 00001590 1F                      		pop	ds
 14121 00001591 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14122                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14123                                  
 14124                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14125                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14126                                  ; a changeline error.
 14127                                  
 14128                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14129 00001594 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14130                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14131 00001596 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14132 00001599 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14133 0000159B 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14134 0000159D 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14135 0000159F 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14136 000015A4 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14137                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14138                                  					; never	would
 14139 000015A6 53                      		push	bx
 14140 000015A7 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14141 000015AA E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14142 000015AD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14143                                  int13b:					
 14144 000015AE F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14145 000015AF EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14146                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14147                                  
 14148                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14149                                  
 14150                                  goterr13:				
 14151 000015B1 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14152 000015B4 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14153                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14154 000015B6 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14155 000015B9 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14156 000015BB 803E[3006]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14157 000015C0 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14158                                  
 14159 000015C2 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14160                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14161                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14162                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14163 000015C7 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14164                                  
 14165 000015C9 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14166                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14167                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14168 000015CB 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14169                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14170                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14171 000015D0 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14172 000015D3 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14173 000015D5 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14174 000015D7 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14175 000015D9 53                      		push	bx
 14176 000015DA 51                      		push	cx
 14177 000015DB 52                      		push	dx
 14178 000015DC A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14179                                  loop_ecc:				
 14180 000015DF B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14181                                  
 14182                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14183                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14184                                  ;
 14185                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14186                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14187                                  ; track.
 14188                                  ;
 14189                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14190                                  ; this request.
 14191                                  ;
 14192                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14193                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14194                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14195                                  ;
 14196 000015E2 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14197                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14198                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14199 000015E5 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14200                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14201 000015EA 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14202 000015EC 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14203 000015EF 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14204 000015F1 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14205 000015F4 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14206                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14207                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14208                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14209 000015F6 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14210                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14211                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14212                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14213                                  ok11_op:				
 14214 000015F8 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14215 000015FC 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14216 000015FE FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14217                                  					; add 200h to address
 14218 00001600 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14219 00001602 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14220 00001604 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14221                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14222                                  
 14223                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14224                                  
 14225                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14226 00001606 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14227                                  ok11_exit:				
 14228 00001607 5A                      		pop	dx
 14229 00001608 59                      		pop	cx
 14230 00001609 5B                      		pop	bx
 14231 0000160A EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14232                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14233                                  
 14234                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14235                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14236                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14237                                  
 14238                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14239 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14240 0000160D 53                      		push	bx
 14241 0000160E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14242 00001611 1E                      		push	ds
 14243 00001612 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14244 00001613 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14245                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14246                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14247 00001616 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14248                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14249 0000161B 5B                      		pop	bx
 14250 0000161C 07                      		pop	es
 14251 0000161D 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14252 0000161F 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14253 00001622 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14254                                  
 14255                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14256                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14257                                  
 14258                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14259 00001624 56                      		push	si
 14260 00001625 57                      		push	di
 14261 00001626 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14262 00001628 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14263 0000162B E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14264 0000162E 5F                      		pop	di
 14265 0000162F 5E                      		pop	si
 14266 00001630 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14267                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14268                                  
 14269                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14270                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14271                                  
 14272                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14273 00001632 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14274 00001635 FB                      		sti
 14275 00001636 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14276 00001639 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14277                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14278                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14279 0000163B 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14280 0000163E 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14281 00001640 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14282 00001643 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14283 00001645 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14284                                  
 14285                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14286                                  
 14287                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14288                                  
 14289 00001647 52                      		push	dx
 14290 00001648 51                      		push	cx
 14291 00001649 53                      		push	bx
 14292 0000164A 50                      		push	ax
 14293 0000164B 55                      		push	bp
 14294 0000164C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14295 0000164E 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14296 00001650 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14297 00001652 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14298 00001654 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14299 00001656 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14300 00001658 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14301 0000165A 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14302                                  
 14303                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14304                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14305                                  
 14306 0000165E 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14307 00001660 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14308                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14309                                  
 14310                                  no_skip_first:				
 14311 00001663 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14312 00001665 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14313 00001667 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14314                                  
 14315                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14316                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14317                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14318                                  ;
 14319                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14320                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14321                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14322                                  ; in error.
 14323                                  
 14324 00001669 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14325 0000166B 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14326                                  
 14327                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14328                                  
 14329 0000166D 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14330                                  					; set up head number
 14331 00001670 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14332 00001673 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14333                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14334                                  
 14335                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14336 00001676 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14337 00001678 F9                      		stc
 14338 00001679 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14339                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14340                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14341                                  
 14342                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14343                                  
 14344                                  intverify:				
 14345 0000167C 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14346 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 14347 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14348 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 14349                                  dosimple:				
 14350 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14351                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14352                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14353                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14354 00001683 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14355                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14356 00001688 5B                      		pop	bx
 14357 00001689 07                      		pop	es
 14358 0000168A E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14359                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14360                                  
 14361                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14362                                  
 14363                                  intformat:				
 14364 0000168D 06                      		push	es
 14365 0000168E 53                      		push	bx
 14366 0000168F 56                      		push	si
 14367 00001690 57                      		push	di
 14368 00001691 1E                      		push	ds
 14369                                  
 14370                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14371                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14372                                  
 14373 00001692 06                      		push	es
 14374 00001693 1E                      		push	ds
 14375 00001694 07                      		pop	es
 14376 00001695 1F                      		pop	ds
 14377 00001696 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14378 00001698 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14379 0000169B E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14380 0000169E 1F                      		pop	ds
 14381 0000169F 5F                      		pop	di
 14382 000016A0 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14383 000016A1 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14384                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14385                                  
 14386                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14387                                  ; the first block.
 14388                                  ;
 14389                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14390                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14391                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14392                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14393                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14394                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14395                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14396                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14397                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14398                                  
 14399                                  doblock:
 14400                                  
 14401                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14402                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14403                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14404                                  				
 14405 000016A3 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14406                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14407 000016A6 51                      		push	cx
 14408 000016A7 06                      		push	es
 14409 000016A8 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14410                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14411 000016A9 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14412 000016AC 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14413                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14414 000016B0 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14415                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14416 000016B5 5F                      		pop	di
 14417 000016B6 07                      		pop	es
 14418 000016B7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14419 000016B9 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14420 000016BB B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14421 000016BD 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14422                                  doblockflop:				
 14423 000016BF 59                      		pop	cx
 14424                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14425 000016C0 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14426 000016C2 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14427 000016C4 50                      		push	ax
 14428 000016C5 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14429 000016C7 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14430                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14431                                  
 14432                                  doblocklast:				
 14433 000016C9 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14434 000016CB 50                      		push	ax
 14435                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14436 000016CC E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14437 000016CF 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14438 000016D1 58                      		pop	ax
 14439 000016D2 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14440                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14441 000016D5 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14442 000016D7 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14443 000016D9 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14444 000016DB 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14445 000016DD 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14446                                  					; then we are done already.
 14447 000016DF 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14448                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14449 000016E1 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14450 000016E4 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14451                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14452                                  
 14453                                  bufferx:				
 14454 000016E6 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14455                                  					; set up head number
 14456                                  buffer:					
 14457 000016E9 53                      		push	bx
 14458 000016EA 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14459 000016ED 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14460 000016F0 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14461                                  					
 14462                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14463                                  
 14464 000016F2 06                      		push	es
 14465 000016F3 1E                      		push	ds
 14466 000016F4 56                      		push	si
 14467 000016F5 57                      		push	di
 14468 000016F6 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14469 000016F7 06                      		push	es
 14470 000016F8 1F                      		pop	ds
 14471 000016F9 07                      		pop	es
 14472 000016FA BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14473 000016FD 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14474 000016FE 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14475 00001700 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14476 00001703 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14477                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14478 00001704 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14479 00001705 5E                      		pop	si
 14480 00001706 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14481                                  
 14482                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14483                                  
 14484 00001707 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14485                                  					; get drive number
 14486 00001709 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14487 0000170C E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14488                                  					;
 14489                                  					; ah is	function
 14490                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14491                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14492                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14493                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14494                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14495 0000170F E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14496 00001712 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14497 00001713 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14498 00001715 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14499                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14500                                  
 14501                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14502                                  
 14503                                  doread:					
 14504 00001717 06                      		push	es
 14505 00001718 53                      		push	bx
 14506 00001719 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14507 0000171A 07                      		pop	es
 14508 0000171B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14509 0000171E B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14510 00001720 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14511                                  					; get drive number
 14512 00001723 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14513                                  					; ah = function
 14514                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14515                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14516                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14517 00001726 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14518 00001729 5B                      		pop	bx
 14519 0000172A 07                      		pop	es
 14520 0000172B 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14521 0000172D 56                      		push	si
 14522 0000172E 57                      		push	di
 14523 0000172F 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14524 00001731 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14525 00001734 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14526 00001737 5F                      		pop	di
 14527 00001738 5E                      		pop	si
 14528                                  
 14529                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14530                                  
 14531                                  dotail:					
 14532 00001739 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14533 0000173A 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14534 0000173D 41                      		inc	cx
 14535 0000173E 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14536 00001741 F8                      		clc
 14537 00001742 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14538 00001744 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14539                                  
 14540                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14541                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14542                                  
 14543 00001746 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14544 00001749 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14545 0000174C E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14546                                  
 14547                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14548                                  
 14549                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14550                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14551                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14552                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14553                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14554                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14555                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14556                                  
 14557                                  bad13:					
 14558 0000174F 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14559 00001751 5D                      		pop	bp
 14560 00001752 5B                      		pop	bx
 14561 00001753 5B                      		pop	bx
 14562 00001754 59                      		pop	cx
 14563 00001755 5A                      		pop	dx
 14564 00001756 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14565 00001758 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14566                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14567                                  
 14568                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14569 0000175B E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14570                                  
 14571                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14572                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14573                                  		;db 	0
 14574                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14575                                  
 14576                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14577                                  
 14578                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14579                                  
 14580                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14581                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 14582                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14583                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14584                                  
 14585                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14586                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14587 0000175E 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14588 00001762 BF[7F06]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14589 00001765 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14590 00001766 07                      		pop	es
 14591 00001767 E9E9EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14592                                  
 14593                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14594                                  
 14595                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14596                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14597                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14598                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14599                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14600                                  
 14601                                  install_bds:
 14602 0000176A 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14603 0000176B BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14604                                  
 14605                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14606                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14607                                  loop_next_bds:
 14608 0000176E C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14609                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14610 00001770 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14611 00001774 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14612                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14613 00001777 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14614 00001779 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14615 0000177B 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14616                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14617 0000177F 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14618 00001782 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14619                                  					; we don't own it
 14620 00001787 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14621                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14622 0000178A 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14623 0000178D 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14624                                  next_bds:
 14625                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14626 00001791 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14627 00001794 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14628                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14629                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14630 00001796 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14631 00001798 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14632                                  					; install bds
 14633 0000179B 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14634 0000179D 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14635                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14636                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14637 000017A0 1F                      		pop	ds
 14638                                  
 14639                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 14640                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14641                                  
 14642                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14643                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14644                                  
 14645                                  		; 01/06/2019
 14646                                  		;mov	al, [es:di+52]
 14647 000017A1 268A4534                		mov	al, [es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14648 000017A5 3A06[2C01]              		cmp	al, [eot]
 14649 000017A9 7603                    		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14650 000017AB A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot], al
 14651                                  _eot_ok:
 14652 000017AE C3                      		retn
 14653

 14672                                  swpdsk:		
 14673 000017AF F606[6F08]01            		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14674                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14675 000017B4 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14676

 14682                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus

 14684 000017BB 51                      		push	cx
 14685 000017BC 52                      		push	dx
 14686 000017BD 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14687                                  					; get the drive	letter
 14688

 14690                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa

 14692 000017C1 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 14693 000017C3 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14694 000017C6 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14695 000017C8 B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 14696                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk

 14699 000017CD 41                      		inc	cx		; cx == -1 ?
 14700 000017CE 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 14701

 14703

 14717                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 14718                                  wrmsg_loop:

 14720                                  					; AL = character to display
