 15635                                  
 15636                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15637                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 15638                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15639                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 30/12/2022))
 15640                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15641                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 15642                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15643                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 15644                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15645                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit6.s -l sysinit6.lst -o SYSINIT6.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 15646                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15647                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 15648                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15649                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 15650                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 15651                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15652                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 15653                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 15654                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15655                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 15656                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 15657                                  
 15658                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 15659                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 - 2019
 15660                                  ; SYSINIT (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) draft: 'sysinit3.s' (01/07/2019)
 15661                                   
 15662                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15663                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15664                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 15665                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 15666                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 15667                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15668                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15669                                  
 15670                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15671                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15672                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15673                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15674                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15675                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15676                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15677                                  ;
 15678                                  ;
 15679                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15680                                  ;
 15681                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15682                                  ;
 15683                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15684                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15685                                  ;
 15686                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15687                                  ;
 15688                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15689                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15690                                  ;
 15691                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15692                                  ;
 15693                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15694                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15695                                  ;value.
 15696                                  ;
 15697                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15698                                  ;
 15699                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15700                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15701                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15702                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15703                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15704                                  ;
 15705                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15706                                  ;
 15707                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15708                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15709                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15710                                  ;
 15711                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15712                                  ;
 15713                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15714                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15715                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15716                                  ;
 15717                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15718                                  ;
 15719                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15720                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15721                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15722                                  ;
 15723                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15724                                  ;
 15725                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15726                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15727                                  ;
 15728                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15729                                  ;
 15730                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15731                                  ;
 15732                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15733                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15734                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15735                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15736                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15737                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15738                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15739                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15740                                  ;memory.
 15741                                  ;NOTES:
 15742                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15743                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15744                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15745                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15746                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15747                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15748                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15749                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15750                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15751                                  
 15752                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15753                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15754                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15755                                  
 15756                                  ;include version.inc
 15757                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15758                                  
 15759                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15760                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15761                                  
 15762                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15763                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15764                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15765                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15766                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15767                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15768                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15769                                  
 15770                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15771                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15772                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15773                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15774                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15775                                  
 15776                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15777                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15778                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15779                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15780                                  
 15781                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 15782                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 15783                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 15784                                  
 15785                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15786                                  
 15787                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15788                                  				; currently 0.
 15789                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15790                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15791                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15792                                  
 15793                                  ;      if1
 15794                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15795                                  ;      endif
 15796                                  
 15797                                         ;******************************
 15798                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15799                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15800                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15801                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15802                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15803                                         ;******************************
 15804                                  
 15805                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15806                                  ; device definitions
 15807                                  
 15808                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15809                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15810                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15811                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15812                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15813                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 15814                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 15815                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 15816                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 15817                                  
 15818                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 15819                                  struc	SYSDEV
 15820 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 15821 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 15822 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 15823 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 15824 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 15825                                  .size:
 15826                                  endstruc
 15827                                  
 15828                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 15829                                  struc	SRHEAD
 15830 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 15831 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 15832 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 15833 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 15834 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 15835                                  .size:
 15836                                  endstruc
 15837                                  
 15838                                  ;Status word masks
 15839                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 15840                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 15841                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 15842                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 15843                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 15844                                  
 15845                                  ;Function codes
 15846                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 15847                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 15848                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 15849                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 15850                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 15851                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 15852                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 15853                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 15854                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 15855                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 15856                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 15857                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 15858                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 15859                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 15860                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 15861                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 15862                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 15863                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 15864                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 15865                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 15866                                  
 15867                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15868                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15869 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15870 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15871 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15872 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15873 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15874 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15875                                                          ; word
 15876 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15877 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15878 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15879 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15880                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15881                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15882                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15883                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15884                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15885                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15886                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15887                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15888 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15889 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15890 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15891 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15892 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15893 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15894                                  .size:
 15895                                  endstruc
 15896                                  
 15897                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15898                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15899                                  
 15900                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15901                                  
 15902                                  struc buffinfo
 15903 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15904 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15905 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15906                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15907                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15908 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15909                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15910                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15911                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15912                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15913                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15914                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15915                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15916                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15917 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15918                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15919 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15920 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15921 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15922 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15923 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15924                                  .size:
 15925                                  endstruc
 15926                                  
 15927                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15928                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15929                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15930                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15931                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15932                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15933                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15934                                  
 15935                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15936                                  
 15937                                  
 15938                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15939                                  
 15940                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15941                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15942                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15943                                  ;***
 15944                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15945                                  ;***
 15946                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15947                                  
 15948                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15949                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15950                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15951                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15952                                  
 15953                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz
 15954                                  
 15955                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15956                                  
 15957                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15958                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15959                                  
 15960                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15961                                  
 15962                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15963                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15964                                  ;
 15965                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15966                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15967                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15968                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15969                                  ;
 15970                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15971                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15972                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15973                                  
 15974                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15975                                  
 15976                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15977                                  
 15978                                  struc	DPB
 15979 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15980 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15981 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15982 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15983 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15984 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15985 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15986 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15987 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15988 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15989                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15990 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15991 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15992 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15993 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15994 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15995                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15996 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15997 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15998 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15999                                  .size:
 16000                                  endstruc
 16001                                  
 16002                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 16003                                  
 16004                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 16005

 16061                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 16062                                  
 16063                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 16064                                  ;
 16065                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 16066                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 16067                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 16068                                  ;
 16069                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 16070                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 16071                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 16072                                  ;
 16073                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 16074                                  
 16075                                  struc A_BPB
 16076 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 16077 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 16078 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 16079 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 16080 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 16081 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16082 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 16083 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 16084 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 16085 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 16086 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 16087 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 16088 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16089 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 16090 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 16091                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 16092                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 16093                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 16094                                  .size:
 16095                                  endstruc
 16096

 16354                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16355                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 16356                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16357                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16358                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16359                                  									  
 16360                                  ;*******************************					  
 16361                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16362                                  ;*******************************					  
 16363                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16364                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16365                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16366                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16367                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16368                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16369                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16370                                  ;For all others:							  
 16371                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16372                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16373                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16374                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16375                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16376                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16377                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16378                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16379                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16380                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16381                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16382                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16383                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16384                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16385                                  ;									  
 16386                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16387                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16388                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16389                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16390                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16391                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16392                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16393                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16394                                  ;									  
 16395                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16396                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16397                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16398                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16399                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16400                                  ;									  
 16401                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16402                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16403                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16404                                  ;									  
 16405                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16406                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16407                                  ;									  
 16408                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16409                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16410                                  ;									  
 16411                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16412                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16413                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16414                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16415                                  ;						called. 		  
 16416                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16417                                  ;									  
 16418                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16419                                  ;									  
 16420                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16421                                  ;									  
 16422                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16423                                  ;									  
 16424                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16425                                  ;									  
 16426                                  
 16427                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16428                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16429 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16430 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16431                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16432 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16433 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16434 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16435 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 16436                                  endstruc					  
 16437                                  									  
 16438                                  ;FeatureByte1	bit map equates 					  
 16439                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 16440                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 16441                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 16442                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 16443                                  					;;End of Modification

 16545                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16546                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16547                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16548                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16549                                  
 16550                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16551                                  ;
 16552                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16553                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16554                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16555                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16556                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16557                                  ;
 16558                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16559                                  ;
 16560                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16561                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16562                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16563                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16564                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16565                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16566                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16567                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16568                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16569                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16570                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16571                                  
 16572                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16573                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16574                                  
 16575                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16576                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16577 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16578 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16579 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16580 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16581 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16582 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16583                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16584 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16585 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16586 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16587                                  .size:
 16588                                  endstruc
 16589                                  
 16590                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16591                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16592                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16593                                  						; argument
 16594                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 16595                                  
 16596                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 16597                                  
 16598                                  ;Flag word masks
 16599                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16600                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16601                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 16602                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 16603                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B
 16604                                  
 16605                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16606                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16607                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16608                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16609                                  
 16610                                  ; system file table
 16611                                  
 16612                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16613                                  ;
 16614                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16615                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16616                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16617                                  
 16618                                  struc	SF
 16619 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16620 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16621 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16622                                  .size:
 16623                                  endstruc
 16624                                  
 16625                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16626                                  ;
 16627                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16628                                  
 16629                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16630 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16631                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16632 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16633 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16634 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16635                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16636                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16637                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16638                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16639                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16640                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16641                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16642                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16643                                  					;
 16644                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16645                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16646                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16647                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16648                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16649                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16650                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16651                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16652                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16653                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16654                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16655                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16656 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16657                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16658                                  					; points to net device header if
 16659                                  					; remote
 16660 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16661                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16662 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16663 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16664 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16665 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16666                                  ;
 16667                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16668                                  ; ID
 16669                                  ;
 16670 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16671 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16672 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 16673                                  ;
 16674                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 16675                                  ;
 16676 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 16677                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 16678                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 16679                                  					; disk changed errors.
 16680                                  ; SHARING INFO
 16681 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 16682 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 16683 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 16684 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 16685 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 16686 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 16687                                  .size:
 16688                                  endstruc
 16689

 16975                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16976                                  ;
 16977                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16978                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16979                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16980                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16981                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16982                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16983                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16984                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16985                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16986                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16987                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16988                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16989                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16990                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16991                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16992                                  ;
 16993                                  
 16994                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16995                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16996                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16997                                  ;
 16998                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16999                                  ;
 17000                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 17001                                  ;
 17002                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 17003                                  ;
 17004                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 17005                                  ;
 17006                                  
 17007                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 17008                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 17009                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 17010                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 17011                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 17012                                  ;      deeply nested one
 17013                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 17014                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 17015                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 17016                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 17017                                  
 17018                                  		;EVEN
 17019                                  ;align 2
 17020                                  		; 21/10/2022
 17021                                  
 17022 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 17023 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 17024 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 17025 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 17026 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 17027 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 17028                                  
 17029 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 17030 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17031 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17032                                  
 17033                                  ;***********************************************************************
 17034                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 17035                                  
 17036                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17037                                  
 17038 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 17039                                  
 17040                                  int02:
 17041                                  
 17042                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17043                                  ;
 17044                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 17045                                  ;
 17046                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 17047                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 17048                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 17049                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 17050                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 17051                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 17052                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 17053                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 17054                                  ;
 17055                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 17056                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 17057                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 17058                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 17059                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 17060                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 17061                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 17062                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 17063                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 17064                                  ;
 17065                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17066                                  
 17067 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 17068 00000017 06                      	push	es
 17069 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 17070 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17071                                  	; 02/11/2022
 17072 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 17073 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 17074 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 17075                                  
 17076 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 17077                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 17078                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 17079                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 17080                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 17081 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 17082 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 17083                                  special02:
 17084 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 17085 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 17086                                  normal02:
 17087 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 17088 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 17089 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 17317                                  ;********************************************************************
 17318                                  ;common routines
 17319                                  ;********************************************************************
 17320                                  
 17321                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 17322                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 17323                                  ; service routine
 17324                                  
 17325                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 17326                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17327                                  
 17328                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 17329                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 17330                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 17331                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 17332                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 17333                                  
 17334                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 17335                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 17336                                  
 17337                                  do_int_stacks:
 17338 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17339 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17340 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17341 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17342 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 17343 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 17344                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17345                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 17346                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17347 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 17348 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 17349 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 17350                                  
 17351 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 17352                                  found02:
 17353 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 17354 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 17355                                  
 17356 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 17357                                  
 17358 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 17359                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17360                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 17361                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17362                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 17363 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 17364 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 17365                                  
 17366                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 17367 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 17368 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 17369 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 17370 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 17371 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 17372 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 17373 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17374 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 17375                                  
 17376                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 17377                                  	;push    bp
 17378                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 17379                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 17380                                  	;pop     bp
 17381                                  	;push    es
 17382                                  	;pop     ss
 17383                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 17384                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 17385                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17386                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 17387                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 17388                                  
 17389 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 17390                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17391 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		; which will iret back to here
 17392                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17393                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17394                                  
 17395 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17396                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17397 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		; but leave it on the stack
 17398                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17399                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17400 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17401 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17402                                  
 17403                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17404                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 17405                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17406 0000019E 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 17407 000001A3 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 17408                                  
 17409 000001A8 07                      	pop	es			; saved on entry
 17410 000001A9 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 17411 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 17412 000001AB 83C402                  	add	sp,2			; (skip near call return addr) 
 17413 000001AE CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 17414                                  
 17415                                  notfree02:
 17416 000001AF 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 17417 000001B1 7404                    	je	short findnext02	; no, continue
 17418                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17419                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; yes, restore error value
 17420                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17421 000001B3 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17422                                  
 17423                                  findnext02:
 17424 000001B7 E81200                  	call	longpath
 17425 000001BA EBA8                    	jmp	short found02
 17426                                  
 17427                                  foundbad02:
 17428 000001BC 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17429 000001C1 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 17430 000001C3 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 17431                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17432                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 17433                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17434 000001C5 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 17435 000001CA EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 17436                                  
 17437                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17438                                  
 17439                                  ; Common routines
 17440                                  
 17441                                  longpath:
 17442                                  	; 21/03/2019
 17443 000001CC 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 17444                                  lploopp:
 17445                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17446                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 17447                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17448 000001D1 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 17449 000001D6 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 17450                                  
 17451 000001D8 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 17452                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17453                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 17454                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17455 000001DA 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17456 000001DE 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 17457 000001E0 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 17458                                  
 17459 000001E2 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 17460 000001E4 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 17461                                  
 17462                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17463                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 17464                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17465 000001E6 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 17466                                  inuse:
 17467 000001EA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17468 000001EF 7406                    	je	short fatal
 17469 000001F1 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 17470 000001F4 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 17471                                  found:
 17472 000001F6 C3                      	retn
 17473                                  fatal:
 17474 000001F7 1E                      	push	ds
 17475 000001F8 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 17476 000001FB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17477 000001FD 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 17478 00000202 1F                      	pop	ds
 17479 00000203 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 17480                                  
 17481 00000205 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 17482 00000207 E672                    	out	72h,al
 17483                                  
 17484                                  skip_nmis:
 17485 00000209 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 17486 0000020A B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 17487 0000020C E621                    	out	021h,al
 17488 0000020E E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 17489                                  
 17490 00000210 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 17491 00000212 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 17492 00000214 BE[3B02]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 17493                                  ;SR;
 17494                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 17495                                  ;
 17496 00000217 50                      	push	ax
 17497 00000218 1E                      	push	ds

 18776 000006AD E8E118                  	call	doconf			; do pre-scan for dos=high/low
 18777                                  
 18778                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18779                                  	; 27/03/2019
 18780                                  	; ds = cs (at return from doconf)
 18781                                  
 18782                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18783                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18784                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18785                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18786                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18787                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18788                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18789                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18790                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18791                                  ;
 18792                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18793                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18794                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18795                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18796                                  ; been patched.
 18797                                  
 18798                                  	; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18799                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0749h)
 18800                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:runhigh],0	; Did user choose to run low ?
 18801                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18802 000006B0 803E[6C02]00            	cmp	byte [runhigh],0
 18803 000006B5 740C                    	je	short dont_install_stub	; yes, don't install dos low mem stub
 18804                                  
 18805                                  ;------ user chose to load high
 18806                                  
 18807                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18808                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; MSDOS 6.21 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 18809                                  	; 11/12/2022

 18813                                  	;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION]   ; Retro DOS v4.0
 18814                                  	; 27/03/2019

 19112                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 19113                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 19114                                  ;   which follow....)
 19115                                  
 19116                                  retry:
 19117 00000779 BA[AB45]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 19118                                  
 19119                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 19120                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 19121                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 19122                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 19123                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 19124                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 19125                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 19126                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 19127                                  
 19128                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 19129                                  
 19130 0000077C 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 19131 0000077D BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 19132 00000780 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 19133 00000782 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 19134 00000784 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 19135 00000786 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 19136 00000788 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 19137                                  
 19138 0000078A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19139 0000078C B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 19140 0000078E CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 19141 00000790 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 19142                                  
 19143                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 19144                                  
 19145                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 19146                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 19147                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 19148                                  
 19149                                  	; 22/10/2022
 19150                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 19151 00000792 8B1E[9402]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 19152 00000796 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 19153                                  
 19154                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 19155                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 19156                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 19157                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 19158                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 19159                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 19160                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 19161                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 19162                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 19163                                  ;
 19164                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 19165                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 19166                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 19167                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 19168                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 19169                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 19170                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 19171                                  
 19172                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 19173                                  	; (SYSINIT:0858h)
