 20013                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20014                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20015                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20016                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20017                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20018                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20019                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20020                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20021                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20022                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20023                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20024                                  ;
 20025                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20026                                  
 20027                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20028                                  update_arena:
 20029 00000A10 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20030 00000A11 57                      	push	di
 20031 00000A12 51                      	push	cx
 20032 00000A13 52                      	push	dx
 20033                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20034                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20035                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20036                                  	; ds = cs 
 20037 00000A14 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20038 00000A18 4F                      	dec	di
 20039 00000A19 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20040                                  						;  before sysvar
 20041 00000A1A 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20042                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20043 00000A1C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20044 00000A21 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20045 00000A23 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20046                                  
 20047                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20048 00000A25 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20049 00000A2A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 20050 00000A2C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 20051 00000A2E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 20052 00000A30 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20053                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 20054 00000A32 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 20055                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 20056 00000A36 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 20057 00000A3C 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 20058                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 20059 00000A3E 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 20060 00000A42 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 20061                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20062                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 20063 00000A44 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 20064 00000A47 5A                      	pop	dx
 20065 00000A48 59                      	pop	cx
 20066 00000A49 5F                      	pop	di
 20067 00000A4A 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 20068 00000A4B C3                      	retn
 20069                                  ;
 20070                                  ; M012 : END
 20071                                  ;
 20072                                  FatalErr:
 20073 00000A4C 0E                      	push	cs

 20080 00000A55 E92C07                  	jmp	stall

 20082                                  	;cli
 20083                                  	;hlt

 20089                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20090                                  ;
 20091                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20092                                  ;
 20093                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20094                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20095                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20096                                  ;
 20097                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20098                                  ;
 20099                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20100                                  
 20101                                  AllocHMA:
 20102                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20103                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20104                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20105                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20106                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20107                                  
 20108                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20109                                  ;
 20110                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20111                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20112                                  ;	push	ax
 20113                                  ;	popf
 20114                                  ;	pushf
 20115                                  ;	pop	ax
 20116                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20117                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20118                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20119                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20120                                  
 20121                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20122                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 20123                                  
 20124 00000A58 1E                      	push	ds
 20125                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 20126                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 20127                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20128 00000A59 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 20129 00000A5C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20130                                  
 20131 00000A5E E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 20132 00000A61 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 20133                                  
 20134 00000A63 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 20135 00000A66 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 20136                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 20137                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 20138                                  
 20139 00000A68 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 20140                                  	;mov	[0Eh],bx
 20141 00000A6C 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 20142                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 20143                                  
 20144 00000A70 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 20145 00000A72 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 20146                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 20147 00000A75 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 20148 00000A79 48                      	dec	ax
 20149 00000A7A 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 20150                                  
 20151                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 20152                                  
 20153 00000A7C B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 20154 00000A7E CD15                    	int	15h
 20155                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 20156                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 20157                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 20158 00000A80 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 20159                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 20160                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20161 00000A83 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 20162                                  allocHMA_1:
 20163 00000A85 B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 20164                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 20165 00000A87 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 20166 00000A8B 48                      	dec	ax
 20167 00000A8C 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 20168                                  
 20169 00000A8E E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 20170 00000A91 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 20171                                  
 20172 00000A93 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20173 00000A96 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20174 00000A98 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 20175 00000A9F 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 20176                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 20177                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20178 00000AA6 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 20179                                  
 20180                                  ; 11/12/2022
 20181                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 20182                                  ;	; cf=0
 20183                                  ;	;clc
 20184                                  ;	pop	ds
 20185                                  ;	retn
 20186                                  
 20187                                  grabhma_error:
 20188 00000AA8 F9                      	stc
 20189                                  	; 11/12/022
 20190                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 20191                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 20192 00000AA9 1F                      	pop	ds
 20193 00000AAA C3                      	retn

 20195                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20196                                  ;

 20198                                  ;
 20199                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 20200                                  ;

 20202                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
 20203                                  ;
 20204                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20205                                  
 20206                                  IsXMSLoaded:

 20259                                  
 20260                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20261                                  ;
 20262                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20263                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20264                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20265                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20266                                  ;
 20267                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20268                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20269                                  ;
 20270                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20271                                  
 20272                                  StartVDHead:
 20273                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20274                                  
 20275 00000AD0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20276 00000AD4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20277 00000AD6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20278 00000AD8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20279 00000ADA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20280                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20281 00000ADB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20282                                  VDiskSig1:
 20283 00000AE2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20284                                  
 20285                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20286                                  
 20287 00000AE7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20288                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20289 00000AED 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20290 00000AFC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20291 00000AFE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20292                                  VDInt19:
 20293 00000AFF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20294                                  OldVDInt19:
 20295 00000B00 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20296                                  
 20297                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20298                                  
 20299                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20300 00000B04 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20301                                  VDiskSig2:
 20302 00000B07 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20303                                  
 20304                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20305                                  
 20306 00000B0C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20307 00000B0F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20308 00000B11 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20309 00000B12 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20310 00000B14 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20311 00000B15 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20312 00000B17 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20313 00000B19 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20314 00000B1A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20315 00000B1C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20316 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20317 00000B20 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors

 20324                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20325                                  ;
 20326                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20327                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20328                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0

 20331                                  ;

 20467                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20468                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20469                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	     ;I070
 20470                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	     ;I070
 20471                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	     ;I070
 20472                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	     ;I070
 20473                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	     ;I070
 20474                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	     ;I070
 20475                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			     ;I070
 20476                                  ;								     ;I070

 20478                                  ;	test    al,10h			; Is keyboard inhibited?     ;I070

 20480                                  ;					; Check for Tortugas...	     ;I070

 20482                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h  ; ds = cs       
 20483                                  ;	mov	ax,[sys_model_byte]
 20484                                  ;	cmp	ax,19F8h
 20485                                  ;	je      short ClrVDISKno                            	     ;I070
 20486                                  ;					; Check for mod 30-286	     ;I070

 20488                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],09FCh

 20491                                  ;ClrVDISKno:							     ;I070

 20493                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							     ;I070
 20494                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20495                                  
 20496                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20497                                  	; ds = cs

 20747                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 20748                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 20749                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to
 20750                                  ;	0 out curdir_flags,curdir_devptr of cds so ibmdos can issue
 20751                                  ;	"invalid drive specification" message when the user try to
 20752                                  ;	access them.
 20753                                  ;

 20764                                  ;	pointed to by ds:si. if not for a: or b: then go to normcds. if
 20765                                  ;	for a: or b: then execute the code given below starting at fooset_zero.
 20766                                  ;	for dpb offsets look at inc\dpb.inc.

 21545                                  
 21546                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21547                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21548                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21549                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21550                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21551                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21552                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21553                                  ;
 21554                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21555                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21556                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21557                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21558                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21559                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21560                                  ;
 21561                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21562                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21563                                  ;
 21564                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21565                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21566                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21567                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21568                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21569                                  ;
 21570                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21571                                  ;
 21572                                  ;			  none.
 21573                                  
 21574                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21575                                  ;
 21576                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21577                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21578                                  
 21579                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21580                                  
 21581 00000FE5 50                      	push	ax

 21590 00000FF0 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f3h,0ffh
 21591 00000FF1 42                      	inc	dx

 21626 0000101D 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address

 21786                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21787                                  ;
 21788                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21789                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21790                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21791                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21792                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed

 21804                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next

 21807                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21808                                  ; carridge return.

 21811                                  ;character after =.

 21956                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21957                                  ;
 21958                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21959                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21960                                  ;
 21961                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21962                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21963                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21964                                  
 21965                                  ParaRound:
 21966 0000114B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21967 0000114E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21968 00001150 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21969 00001152 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21970 00001154 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21971 00001156 C3                      	retn
 21972                                  
 21973                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21974                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21975                                  ;
 21976                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21977                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21978                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21979                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21980                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21981                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21982                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21983                                  ;
 21984                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21985                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21986                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21987                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21988                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21989                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21990                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset value of end of sysinit module label
 21991                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21992                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21993                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21994                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21995                                  ;
 21996                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21997                                  
 21998                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21999                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22000                                  sysinit_base:				
 22001 00001157 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22002 0000115C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22003 00001161 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22004 00001163 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22005 00001168 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22006 0000116D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22007 0000116E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22008 0000116F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22009                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22010                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22011 00001171 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22012 00001174 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22013 00001179 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22014                                  
 22015                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22016                                  
 22017 0000117B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22018 0000117D 0E                      	push	cs
 22019 0000117E 1F                      	pop	ds
 22020                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22021                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22022                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22023 0000117F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22024                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22025 00001182 CD21                    	int	21h
 22026                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22027                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22028                                  
 22029                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22030                                  stall:
 22031                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22032                                  _stall: 
 22033                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22034 00001184 F4                      	hlt 
 22035                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22036                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22037 00001185 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22038                                  
 22039                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22040 00001187 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22041                                  
 22042                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22043                                  
 22044                                  sum_up:
 22045                                  
 22046                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22047                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22048                                  ;
 22049                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22050                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22051                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22052                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22053                                  ;
 22054                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22055                                  
 22056 0000118C 1E                      	push	ds
 22057                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22058                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22059 0000118D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22060                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22061                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22062 00001191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22063 00001193 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22064 00001195 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22065 00001197 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22066                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22067 0000119C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22068 0000119E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22069                                  sum1:
 22070 000011A0 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22071 000011A2 46                      	inc	si
 22072 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 22073 000011A4 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22074                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22075                                  sum_sys_code:
 22076                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22077 000011A6 BEA611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22078                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22079                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22080                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22081                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22082                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22083                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22084                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22085 000011A9 B9[704D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22086 000011AC 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22087 000011AE D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22088                                  sum2:
 22089 000011B0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22090 000011B3 46                      	inc	si
 22091 000011B4 46                      	inc	si
 22092 000011B5 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22093 000011B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 22094 000011B8 C3                      	retn
 22095                                  
 22096                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22097                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22098                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22099                                  
 22100                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22101                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22102 000011B9 0000                    	dw	0
 22103                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22104                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 22105 000011BB 0000                    	dw	0

 22119                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22120                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22121                                  ;
 22122                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22123                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22124                                  ;
 22125                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22126                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22127                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22128                                  ;
 22129                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22130                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22131                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22132                                  
 22133                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22134                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 22135                                  
 22136                                  set_buffer:
 22137 000011D8 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 22138 000011DA E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 22139 000011DD 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 22140                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 22141                                  	; 17/09/2023
 22142 000011DF FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 22143                                  set_buff_1:
 22144                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22145                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 22146 000011E1 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 22147                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 22148 000011E3 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 22149                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 22150 000011E6 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 22151                                  
 22152 000011EB 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 22153 000011ED 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 22154 000011F2 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 22155                                  
 22156                                  ;	for each buffer
 22157                                  
 22158                                  nxt_buff:
 22159 000011F3 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 22160 000011F6 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 22161 000011F8 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 22162                                  
 22163 000011FA 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22164                                  
 22165 000011FF 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 22166                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22167 00001200 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22168 00001203 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22169                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 22170                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22171 00001205 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 22172                                  
 22173 00001209 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 22174 0000120B 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 22175                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 22176 0000120D C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 22177 00001211 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 22178                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of scratch buff is 0
 22179 00001215 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 22180                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 22181 0000121A 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 22182 0000121D 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 22183                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 22184                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 22185                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 22186 00001221 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22187                                  set_buff_2:
 22188 00001224 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 22189                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 22190 00001229 2E800E[BD14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 22191                                  	;call	round
 22192                                  	;retn
 22193                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22194 0000122F E93D30                  	jmp	round
 22195                                  
 22196                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22197                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22198                                  ;
 22199                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22200                                  ;
 22201                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22202                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22203                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22204                                  
 22205                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22206                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22207 00001232 53                      	push	bx
 22208 00001233 52                      	push	dx
 22209 00001234 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22210 00001238 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22211                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22212 0000123D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22213                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22214                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22215                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22216 00001240 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22217 00001242 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22218 00001244 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22219                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22220 00001247 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22221 00001249 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22222 0000124C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22223                                  
 22224                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22225                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22226                                  	; zf=1
 22227 0000124E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22228                                  	; zf=1
 22229                                  	
 22230                                  	;zf=1
 22231                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22232                                  	;zf=1
 22233 0000124F 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22234                                  got_hma:
 22235 00001254 5A                      	pop	dx
 22236 00001255 5B                      	pop	bx
 22237 00001256 C3                      	retn
 22238                                  
 22239                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22240                                  
 22241                                  set_buffer_info:
 22242                                  
 22243                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 22244                                  ;
 22245                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 22246                                  ;    ax = di
 22247                                  ;
 22248                                  ;out:
 22249                                  ;    above entries set.
 22250                                  
 22251                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22252 00001257 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 22253                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 22254 0000125C 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 22255 00001260 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 22256 00001264 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; adjust ax
 22257                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 22258 00001269 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 22259                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 22260 0000126C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22261                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22262 00001272 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22263                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22264 00001278 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22265 0000127E C3                      	retn

 22267                                  ; ======================================================================
 22268                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22269                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22270                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22271                                  
 22272                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22273                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22274                                  ;
 22275                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22276                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22277                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22278                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22279                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22280                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22281                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22282                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22283                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22284                                  ;
 22285                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22286                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22287                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22288                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22289                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22290                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22291                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22292                                  ;	conditions:
 22293                                  ;
 22294                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22295                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22296                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22297                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22298                                  ;
 22299                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22300                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22301                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22302                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22303                                  ;
 22304                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22305                                  ;
 22306                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22307                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22308                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22309                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22310                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22311                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22312                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22313                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22314                                  ;
 22315                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22316                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22317                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22318                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22319                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement stack logic in this case.
 22320                                  ;
 22321                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22322                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22323                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22324                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22325                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22326                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22327                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22328                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22329                                  ;
 22330                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22331                                  
 22332                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22333                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22334                                  
 22335                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22336                                  stackinit:
 22337 0000127F 50                      	push	ax
 22338 00001280 1E                      	push	ds
 22339 00001281 06                      	push	es
 22340 00001282 53                      	push	bx
 22341 00001283 51                      	push	cx
 22342 00001284 52                      	push	dx
 22343 00001285 57                      	push	di
 22344 00001286 56                      	push	si
 22345 00001287 55                      	push	bp
 22346                                  
 22347                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22348                                  
 22349                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22350                                  	; ds = cs
 22351 00001288 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22352 0000128B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22353                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22354                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22355                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22356 0000128D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22357                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22358 00001291 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22359 00001294 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22360                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22361 00001298 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22362                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22363                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22364                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22365 0000129B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22366                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22367 0000129F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22368 000012A1 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22369                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22370                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22371                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22372 000012A4 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22373                                  
 22374                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22375                                  
 22376                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22377                                  
 22378                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22379                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22380                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22381 000012A8 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22382                                  
 22383                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22384                                  
 22385 000012AD B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22386                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22387                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22388                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22389 000012B0 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22390 000012B2 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22391 000012B4 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22392 000012B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22393 000012BA 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22394                                  
 22395                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22396                                  
 22397 000012BD 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22398 000012C2 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22399 000012C6 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22400 000012C8 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22401 000012CA 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22402 000012CC 06                      	push	es
 22403 000012CD 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22404                                  
 22405                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22406                                  
 22407 000012CE 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22408 000012D2 FC                      	cld
 22409 000012D3 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22410                                  
 22411 000012D5 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22412                                  
 22413                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22414                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22415                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22416                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22417                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22418                                  
 22419                                  buildloop:
 22420                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22421                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22422                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22423                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free

 22427                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 22428 000012E1 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax

 22430 000012E5 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax

 22432 000012E9 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]
 22433 000012ED 26895E06                	mov	[es:bp+newsp],bx		; mov [es:bp+6],bx

 22439                                  
 22440 000012F9 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22441 000012FC 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 22442 00001300 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 22443                                  
 22444 00001304 1E                      	push	ds
 22445                                  	;mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte

 22461

 23151 00001456 817F064B42              	cmp	word [bx+6],424Bh
 23152 0000145B 7411                    	je	short int_xx_not_first
 23153                                  	
 23154 0000145D 81FA00F0                	cmp	dx,0F000h
 23155 00001461 750B                    	jne	short int_xx_not_first
 23156                                  
 23157 00001463 06                      	push	es
 23158                                  	;push	dx
 23159                                  	;mov	dx,0F000h
 23160 00001464 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 23161 00001466 263B1E01FF              	cmp	bx,[es:0FF01h]
 23162                                        	;pop	dx
 23163 0000146B 07                      	pop	es
 23164 0000146C 7401                    	je	short int_xx_first
 23165                                  
 23166                                  int_xx_not_first:
 23167 0000146E F9                      	stc
 23168                                  int_xx_first:
 23169 0000146F 1F                      	pop	ds
 23170 00001470 C3                      	retn
 23171                                  
 23172                                  ;%endif
 23173                                  
 23174                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23175                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23176                                  
 23177                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23178                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23179                                  
 23180                                  new_init_loop:
 23181                                  
 23182                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23183                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23184                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23185                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23186                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23187                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23188                                  
 23189 00001471 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23190 00001474 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23191 00001476 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23192 0000147A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23193                                  
 23194 0000147D 1E                      	push	ds
 23195                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23196                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23197                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23198 0000147E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23199 00001481 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23200 00001483 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23201 00001486 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23202 00001488 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23203 0000148C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23204 0000148F 1F                      	pop	ds
 23205                                  
 23206 00001490 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23207 00001493 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23208 00001497 C3                      	retn
 23209                                  
 23210                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine

 23216                                  ;    [memlo] = 0

 23218                                  ;out: devmark established.

 23244 000014A9 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23245

 23247                                  	;pop	cx
 23248                                  	;pop	es
 23249                                  	
 23250 000014AE 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]

 23453                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23454                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23455                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23456                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23457                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE

 23459                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="

 23466                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk

 23491                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23492 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23493 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23494 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23495                                  endstruc
 23496                                  
 23497                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23498                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23499                                  ;
 23500                                  ;
 23501                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23502                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23503                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23504                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23505                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23506                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23507                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23508                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23509                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23510                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23511                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23512                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23513                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23514                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23515                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23516                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23517                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23518                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23519                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23520                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23521                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23522                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23523                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23524                                  ;	   :
 23525                                  ;
 23526                                  ;Note:
 23527                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23528                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23529                                  ;
 23530                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23531                                  ;
 23532                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23533                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23534                                  ;
 23535                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23536                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23537                                  ;
 23538                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23539                                  ;
 23540                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23541                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23542                                  ;
 23543                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23544                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23545                                  ;
 23546                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23547                                  ;
 23548                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23549                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23550                                  ;
 23551                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23552                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23553                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23554                                  ;
 23555                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23556                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23557                                  ;
 23558                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23559                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23560                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23561                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23562                                  
 23563                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23564                                  
 23565                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23566                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23567                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23568                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23569                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23570                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23571                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23572                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23573                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23574                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23575                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23576                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23577                                  
 23578                                  ;**** Function flags
 23579                                  
 23580                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23581                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23582                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23583                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23584                                  
 23585                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23586                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23587 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23588 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23589 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23590 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23591 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23592 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23593                                  endstruc
 23594                                  
 23595                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23596                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23597                                  ;
 23598                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23599                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23600                                  ;	     +-
 23601                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23602                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23603                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23604                                  ;	     |	:
 23605                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23606                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23607                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23608                                  ;	     |	:
 23609                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23610                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23611                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23612                                  ;	     +-	:
 23613                                  ;
 23614                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23615                                  ;
 23616                                  ;Note:
 23617                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23618                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23619                                  ;
 23620                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23621                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23622                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23623                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23624                                  
 23625                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23626                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23627                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23628                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23629                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23630                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23631                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23632                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23633                                  
 23634                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23635 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23636 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23637 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23638 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23639 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23640                                  endstruc
 23641                                  
 23642                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23643                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23644                                  ;
 23645                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23646                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23647                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23648                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23649                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23650                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23651                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23652                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23653                                  ;
 23654                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23655                                  ;
 23656                                  ;            +-
 23657                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23658                                  ;	    | or
 23659                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23660                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23661                                  ;	    | or
 23662                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23663                                  ;	    | or
 23664                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23665                                  ;	    | or
 23666                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23667                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23668                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23669                                  ;	    | or
 23670                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23671                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23672                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23673                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23674                                  ;	    +-
 23675                                  ;
 23676                                  ;
 23677                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23678                                  ;      list.
 23679                                  ;
 23680                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23681                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23682                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23683                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23684                                  
 23685                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23686                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk

 23688 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23689 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23690 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23691                                  endstruc
