 23808                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23809                                  ; SysParse;
 23810                                  ;
 23811                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23812                                  ;
 23813                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23814                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23815                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23816                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23817                                  ;
 23818                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23819                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23820                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23821                                  ;
 23822                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23823                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23824                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23825                                  ;
 23826                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23827                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23828                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23829                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23830                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23831                                  ;
 23832                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23833                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23834                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23835                                  ;
 23836                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23837                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23838                                  ;
 23839                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23840                                  ;
 23841                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23842                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23843                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23844                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23845                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23846                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23847                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23848                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23849                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23850                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23851                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23852                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23853                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23854                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23855                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23856                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23857                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23858                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23859                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23860                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23861                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23862                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23863                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23864                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23865                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23866                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23867                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23868                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23869                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23870                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23871                                  
 23872                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23873                                  
 23874                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23875                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23876                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23877                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23878                                  
 23879                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23880                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23881                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23882                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23883                                  ;
 23884                                  
 23885                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23886                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23887                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23888                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23889                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23890                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23891                                  
 23892                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23893                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23894                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23895                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23896                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23897                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23898                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23899                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23900                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23901                                  
 23902                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23903                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23904                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23905                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23906                                  ;	     segment.
 23907                                  
 23908                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 23909                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 23910                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 23911                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 23912                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 23913                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 23914

 23916                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro

 23930

 23932                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as

 23934                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.

 23937                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.

 24506                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24507                                  ;
 24508                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24509                                  ;
 24510                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24511                                  ;	    AL = type
 24512                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24513                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24514                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24515                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24516                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24517                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24518                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24519                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24520                                  ;
 24521                                  ; Output:   None
 24522                                  ;
 24523                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24524                                  ;
 24525                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24526                                  ;***********************************************************************

 24920                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24921                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24922                                  ;
 24923                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24924                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24925                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24926                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24927                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24928                                  ;
 24929                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24930                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24931                                  ;
 24932                                  ; Output:    None
 24933                                  ;
 24934                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24935                                  ;
 24936                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24937                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24938                                  
 24939                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24940                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24941                                  
 24942                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 24943                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 24944                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24945 0000192A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24946 0000192B 2E800E[D114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24947 00001931 2E8026[D114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24948                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 24949 00001937 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24950 0000193A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24951 0000193C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24952                                  
 24953 0000193E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24954 00001940 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24955                                  
 24956 00001942 2E800E[D114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24957                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24958 00001948 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24959                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24960 00001949 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24961 0000194C 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24962 0000194D C3                      	retn

 24989                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)

 25875                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25876                                  ;
 25877                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25878                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25879                                  ;	    blanks.
 25880                                  ;
 25881                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25882                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25883                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25884                                  ;
 25885                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25886                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25887                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25888                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25889                                   
 25890                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25891                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 25892                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 25893                                  
 25894                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 25895 00001C70 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25896 00001C71 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25897 00001C72 2EC606[CB14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 25898                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 25899                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 25900 00001C78 2E8026[D114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 25901 00001C7E 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 25902 00001C80 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25903                                  
 25904 00001C82 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 25905 00001C84 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25906                                  
 25907 00001C86 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 25908 00001C88 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25909                                  
 25910                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 25911                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 25912                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25913                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 25914                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 25915                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 25916                                  %if 0
 25917                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25918                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 25919                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 25920                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;

 25923                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 25924

 25976                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25977                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25978                                  ;
 25979                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25980                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25981                                  ;
 25982                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25983                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25984                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25985                                  ;
 25986                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set) if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25987                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25988                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25989                                  
 25990                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25991                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25992                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25993                                  ;
 25994                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25995                                  
 25996                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25997                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25998                                  
 25999                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26000                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26001                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26002                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26003 00001CBE BD[DA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26004                                  
 26005                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26006 00001CC1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26007 00001CC3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26008                                  
 26009                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26010 00001CC5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26011 00001CC7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26012                                  
 26013 00001CC9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26014                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26015                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26016 00001CCA C3                      	retn
 26017                                  
 26018                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26019                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26020                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26021                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26022                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26023                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26024                                  
 26025                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26026                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26027 00001CCB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26028 00001CCD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26029                                  
 26030 00001CCF 2E800E[D114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26031                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26032                                  
 26033                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26034                                  	; cf=0
 26035                                  	;retn
 26036                                  
 26037                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26038                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26039                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26040 00001CD5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26041                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26042                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26043 00001CD6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26044                                  
 26045                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26046                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26047                                  ;
 26048                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26049                                  ;
 26050                                  ;  Input:
 26051                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26052                                  ;
 26053                                  ;  Output:
 26054                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26055                                  ;
 26056                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26057                                  ;
 26058                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26059                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26060                                  
 26061                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26062 00001CD7 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26063 00001CD8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26064 00001CD9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26065                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 26066                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 26067                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26068 00001CDA 2E8B36[CE14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26069 00001CDF 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26070 00001CE1 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26071 00001CE3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26072 00001CE4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26073 00001CE5 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26074 00001CE6 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26075 00001CE7 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26076 00001CE8 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26077 00001CE9 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26078                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26079                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26080 00001CEA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26081 00001CEC B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26082 00001CEF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26083                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26084 00001CF1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26085 00001CF3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26086 00001CF5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26087 00001CF6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26088 00001CF7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26089 00001CF8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26090 00001CF9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26091 00001CFA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26092 00001CFB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26093 00001CFC 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26094                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26095 00001CFE 2E8936[CC14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26096 00001D03 2E891E[CE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26097                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26098                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26099                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26100                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26101 00001D08 2EC536[CC14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26102                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26103 00001D0D 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26104 00001D10 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26105 00001D12 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26106 00001D14 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26107 00001D16 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26108 00001D19 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26109 00001D1B F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26110 00001D1C EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26111                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 26112 00001D1E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 26113 00001D1F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26114                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26115 00001D20 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26116                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;

 26118                                  	; cf=0
 26119                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26120                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;

 26122 00001D23 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 26123 00001D24 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;

 26686                                  
 26687                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26688                                  
 26689                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26690                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26691                                  
 26692                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26693                                  ;
 26694                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26695                                  ;
 26696                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26697                                  ;
 26698                                  ;   Modification log:
 26699                                  ;
 26700                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26701                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26702                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26703                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26704                                  ;
 26705                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26706                                  ;
 26707                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26708                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26709                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26710                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26711                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26712                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26713                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26714                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26715                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26716                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26717                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26718                                  ;
 26719                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26720                                  
 26721                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26722                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26723                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26724                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26725                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26726                                  
 26727                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26728                                  
 26729                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26730                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26731                                  
 26732                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26733                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26734                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26735                                  
 26736                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26737                                  ;
 26738                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26739                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26740                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 if the user has specified /S on the command-
 26741                                  ;	           line.
 26742                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26743                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26744                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26745                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26746                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26747                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26748                                  ;	          will be set to 1. All others will be set to 0.
 26749                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26750                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26751                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26752                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26753                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26754                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26755                                  ;	           for details).
 26756                                  
 26757 00001F25 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 26758 00001F26 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 26759 00001F27 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 26760 00001F29 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 26761 00001F2A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26762 00001F3A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26763 00001F5A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 26764 00001F5B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 26765 00001F5C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 26766                                  
 26767                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26768                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26769                                  
 26770                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26771                                  
 26772                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26773                                  
 26774                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 26775                                  
 26776                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 26777                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 26778                                  
 26779                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26780                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 26781                                  
 26782                                  		;public	DevEntry
 26783                                  
 26784 00001F5D 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded (paras)
 26785 00001F5F 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26786 00001F61 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26787 00001F63 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26788 00001F67 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26789                                  ; 30/12/2022
 26790                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26791 00001F6B 00                      ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 style) InitDevLoad?
 26792                                  ;
 26793 00001F6C 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 26794 00001F6D 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; current UMB used for loading devices (paras)
 26795 00001F6F 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26796 00001F71 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free mem blk in the current UMB (paras)
 26797                                  ;
 26798 00001F73 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 26799                                  ;
 26800 00001F77 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 26801 00001F79 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 26802                                  ;
 26803 00001F7B 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whether the current device
 26804                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 26805 00001F7C 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 26806                                  ;
 26807 00001F7E 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12h ?
 26808 00001F7F 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12h ram)
 26809 00001F81 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$' ; 3Com Device name
 26810                                  ;
 26811 00001F89 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 26812 00001F8A 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data

 26903                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26904                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26905                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26906                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26907                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph

 27047 00002058 72D2                    	jc	short endconv

 27050                                  	
 27051                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27052 0000205E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 27053                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 27054                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 27055 00002060 8826[BA14]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0
 27056 00002064 8826[BD14]              	mov	[setdevmarkflag],ah ; 0
 27057                                  
 27058 00002068 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 27059 0000206A 7448                    	je	short blank_line	; then ignore this line.
 27060                                  
 27061                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27062                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 27063                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27064                                  ;%if 0
 27065                                  
 27066                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27067                                  
 27068                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 27069                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 27070                                  
 27071 0000206C A2[B814]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 27072                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 27073 0000206F 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 27074                                  	
 27075                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27076 00002071 3826[B914]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 27077                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 27078 00002075 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 27079                                  
 27080 00002077 50                              push    ax                      ;
 27081 00002078 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27082 0000207B 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27083 0000207D E8AC21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27084 00002080 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 27085 00002082 A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 27086 00002085 58                              pop     ax
 27087                                  ;
 27088                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27089                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27090                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27091                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27092                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27093                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27094                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27095                                  ;   spot.
 27096                                  ;
 27097                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27098                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27099                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27100                                  ;   retrieved.
 27101                                  ;
 27102 00002086 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 27103 0000208B 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27104                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27105 0000208D F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27106 00002092 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 27107 00002094 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 27108 00002099 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27109                                  final:                                  ;
 27110 0000209B 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 27111                                  not_final:                              ;
 27112                                  ;endif
 27113                                  
 27114                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27115                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27116                                  
 27117 0000209E 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 27118 000020A0 E88921                  	call	getchr
 27119 000020A3 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 27120                                  
 27121 000020A5 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 27122                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 27123                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27124 000020AA 7380                    	jnb	short endconv	
 27125 000020AC E95408                  	jmp	badop
 27126                                  	
 27127                                  coff:	
 27128                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27129                                  	; ds = cs
 27130                                  	;push	cs
 27131                                  	;pop	ds
 27132 000020AF E87121                  	call	newline
 27133 000020B2 EBA4                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 27134                                  
 27135                                  blank_line:
 27136 000020B4 E87521                  	call	getchr
 27137 000020B7 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 27138                                  
 27139                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27140                                  ; 11/12/2022
 27141                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 27142                                  ;coff_p:
 27143                                  	;push	cs
 27144                                  	;pop	ds
 27145                                  
 27146                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 27147                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 27148                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 27149                                  ;install= command.
 27150                                  
 27151                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27152                                  ;install command
 27153                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27154                                  
 27155                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27156                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 27157                                  tryi:
 27158 000020B9 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 27159 000020BE 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 27160 000020C0 E97F01                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 27161                                  not_init_pass:
 27162 000020C3 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 27163                                          ; 11/12/2022
 27164                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 27165 000020C8 74E5                    	je	short coff
 27166                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27167                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27168                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 27169                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 27170                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 27171                                  					; and before install= commands
 27172                                  					; are processed
 27173                                  
 27174 000020CA 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 27175 000020CF 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 27176 000020D1 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 27177                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27178                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 27179 000020D4 74D9                    	je	short coff
 27180                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27181                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27182                                  
 27183                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 27184                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 27185                                          
 27186 000020D6 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 27187                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27188 000020D9 7507                    	jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.

 27196                                  
 27197                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 27200                                  ;%if 0
 27201                                  precheck_installhigh:

 27204                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27205 000020E7 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1

 27211                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 27212 000020F1 750A                    	jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh

 27214                                  	;jne	short multi_pass_filter
 27215                                  
 27216                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27217                                  ;%if 1 
 27218                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27219                                  ;%if 0

 27221 000020F3 E8A31F                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27222 000020F6 7241                    	jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27223                                  ;endif

 27227 000020FB EBB2                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.

 27230                                  ; (SYSINIT:2463h)

 27233                                  ;%if 0
 27234                                  
 27235                                  multi_try_n:
 27236 000020FD 80FC57                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 27237 00002100 7537                            jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 27238                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27239 00002102 E8941F                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27240 00002105 7232                            jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27241                                  ;endif
 27242                                  
 27243                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 27244                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 27245                                  
 27246 00002107 B80058                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 27247 0000210A CD21                    	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 27248 0000210C 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 27249 0000210E 53                              push    bx                      ; save for the return
 27250                                  
 27251 0000210F 81CB8000                        or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 27252 00002113 B80158                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 27253 00002116 CD21                    	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 27254                                  
 27255 00002118 B80258                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 27256 0000211B CD21                            int     21h                     ; get link state
 27257 0000211D 30E4                            xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 27258 0000211F 50                              push    ax                      ; save for return
 27259                                  
 27260 00002120 B80358                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 27261 00002123 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1

 27263

 27265                                  
 27266 0000212B B80358                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 27267 0000212E 5B                              pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 27268 0000212F CD21                            int     21h
 27269 00002131 5B                              pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy

 27271 00002135 CD21                            int     21h

 27273                                  	;jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 27274                                  	; 01/01/2023
 27275 00002137 EBA7                    	jmp	short multi_pass_coff2
 27276                                  
 27277                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022

 27301                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27302                                  ;									      *
 27303                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27304                                  ;									      *
 27305                                  ; input :								      *
 27306                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27307                                  ; output:								      *
 27308                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27309                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *

 29036                                  
 29037                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29038                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29039                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29040                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29041                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29042                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29043                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29044                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29045                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29046                                  
 29047                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29048                                  ;									  *
 29049                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29050                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29051                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29052                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29053                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29054                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29055                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29056                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29057                                  ; input :								  *
 29058                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29059                                  ; output:								  *
 29060                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29061                                  ;									  *
 29062                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29063                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29064                                  ; logic:								  *
 29065                                  ; {									  *
 29066                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29067                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29068                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29069                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29070                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29071                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29072                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29073                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29074                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29075                                  ;	     }								  *
 29076                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29077                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29078                                  ;	};								  *
 29079                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29080                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29081                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29082                                  ; };									  *
 29083                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29084                                  
 29085                                  tryk:
 29086                                          ;if      stacksw
 29087

 30197                                  ;
 30198                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30199                                  ;
 30200                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30201                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30202                                  ;
 30203                                  ;	Output : none
 30204                                  ;
 30205                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30206                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30207                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30208                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30209                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30210                                  ;
 30211                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30212                                  
 30213                                  LieInt12Mem:
 30214                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30215                                  	; ds = cs
 30216 00002989 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 30217                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12h as alloclim
 30218                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30219 0000298C E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30220 0000298F 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30221                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30222                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30223                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30224                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12h as end of UMB
 30225                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30226                                  	; ds = cs
 30227 00002991 803E[7B1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 30228 00002996 74F0                    	je	short limx
 30229 00002998 A1[611F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 30230                                  lim_set:
 30231                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30232                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30233                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 30234                                  ;limx:
 30235                                  	;retn
 30236                                  	
 30237                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 30238                                  
 30239                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30240                                  ;
 30241                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30242                                  ;
 30243                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30244                                  ;	Output : none
 30245                                  ;
 30246                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30247                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30248                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30249                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30250                                  ;
 30251                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30252                                  
 30253                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30254                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30255 0000299B 1E                      	push	ds
 30256 0000299C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30257 0000299F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30258 000029A1 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30259 000029A5 2E891E[7F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30260 000029AA B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30261 000029AC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30262 000029AE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30263 000029B1 2EC606[7E1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30264 000029B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 30265                                  ;limx:
 30266 000029B8 C3                      	retn
 30267                                  
 30268                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30269                                  ;
 30270                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30271                                  ;
 30272                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30273                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30274                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30275                                  ;
 30276                                  ;	Output : none
 30277                                  ;
 30278                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 30279                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30280                                  ;
 30281                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30282                                  
 30283                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 30284                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30285                                  	; ds = cs
 30286 000029B9 803E[7E1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30287                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 30288                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30289                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30290 000029BE 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30291                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30292 000029C0 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30293 000029C3 8826[7E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30294                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30295                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30296 000029C7 1E                      	push	ds
 30297                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30298 000029C8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30299 000029CA 2EA1[7F1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 30300 000029CE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12h memory
 30301 000029D1 1F                      	pop	ds
 30302                                  timx:
 30303 000029D2 C3                      	retn
 30304                                  
 30305                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30308                                  ;

 30323                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header
 30324 000029DA 83C60A                  	add	si,SYSDEV.NAME ; 10 	; ptr device name
 30325 000029DD 0E                      	push	cs
 30326 000029DE 07                      	pop	es

 30328 000029E2 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 30329 000029E5 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 30330 000029E7 5E                      	pop	si
 30331 000029E8 07                      	pop	es
 30332 000029E9 1F                      	pop	ds
 30333 000029EA C3                      	retn

 30356                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30357                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30358                                  
 30359                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30360                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30361                                  
 30362                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30363                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30364                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30365                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30366                                  
 30367                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30368                                  ;
 30369                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30370                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30371                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30372                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30373                                  ;
 30374                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30375                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30376                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30377                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30378                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30379                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30380                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30381                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30382                                  ; available during the load.
 30383                                  ;
 30384                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30385                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30386                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30387                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30388                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30389                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30390                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30391                                  ;
 30392                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30393                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30394                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30395                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30396                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30397                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30398                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30399                                  ;
 30400                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30401                                  
 30402                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30403                                  
 30404                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30405                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30406                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30407                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30408                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30409                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30410                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30411                                  
 30412                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30413                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30414                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30415                                  
 30416                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30417                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30418                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30419                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30420                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30421                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30422                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30423                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30424                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30425                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30426                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30427                                  
 30428                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30429                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30430                                  
 30431                                  InitVar:
 30432                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30433                                  	; ds = cs
 30434                                  
 30435                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30436                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30437                                  	;push	ax
 30438                                  	;push	cx
 30439                                  	;push	di
 30440 000029FD 06                      	push	es
 30441                                  
 30442                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30443 000029FE 0E                      	push	cs
 30444 000029FF 07                      	pop	es
 30445                                  
 30446 00002A00 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30447                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30448                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30449                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30450                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30451                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30452                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30453                                  
 30454                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30455                                  	; ds = cs
 30456 00002A02 A2[261F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30457 00002A05 A2[251F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30458 00002A08 A3[271F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30459 00002A0B C606[291F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30460                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30461 00002A10 A2[5C1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30462                                  
 30463 00002A13 FC                      	cld
 30464                                  
 30465 00002A14 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30466 00002A17 BF[2A1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30467 00002A1A F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30468
