 30470                                  	; 01/01/2033
 30471 00002A1C B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 30472 00002A1E BF[3A1F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30473 00002A21 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30474                                  
 30475                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30476                                  
 30477                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30478 00002A23 07                      	pop	es
 30479                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30480                                  	;pop	di
 30481                                  	;pop	cx
 30482                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30483                                  
 30484 00002A24 C3                      	retn
 30485                                  
 30486                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30487                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30488                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30489                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30490                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30491                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30492                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30493                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30494                                  
 30495                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30496                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30497                                  FixMem:
 30498                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30499                                  	;push	ax
 30500                                  	;push	bx
 30501                                  	;push	cx
 30502                                  	;push	dx
 30503 00002A25 06                      	push	es
 30504                                  
 30505 00002A26 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30506                                  
 30507 00002A29 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30508 00002A2C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30509                                  
 30510 00002A2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30511                                  
 30512                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30513                                  
 30514 00002A30 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30515 00002A32 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30516 00002A34 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30517                                  
 30518                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30519                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30520                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30521                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30522                                  
 30523 00002A35 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30524 00002A39 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30525 00002A3E 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30526 00002A40 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30527                                  
 30528                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30529                                  
 30530 00002A42 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30531 00002A47 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30532 00002A49 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30533                                  
 30534 00002A4D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30535                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30536                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30537 00002A52 43                      	inc	bx
 30538 00002A53 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30539                                  
 30540                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30541                                  
 30542 00002A58 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Save MCB address
 30543 00002A5A 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30544                                  
 30545 00002A5F 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30546                                  	;add	bx,[es:3]
 30547 00002A61 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30548 00002A66 43                      	inc	bx
 30549 00002A67 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30550                                  
 30551                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30552 00002A69 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30553 00002A6B 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30554                                  fmX:	
 30555 00002A6D E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30556                                  
 30557 00002A70 07                      	pop	es
 30558                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30559                                  	;pop	dx
 30560                                  	;pop	cx
 30561                                  	;pop	bx
 30562                                  	;pop	ax
 30563                                  
 30564 00002A71 C3                      	retn
 30565                                  
 30566                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30567                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30568                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30569                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30570                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30571                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30572                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30573                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30574                                  
 30575                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30576                                  fm_link:
 30577 00002A72 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30578 00002A75 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30579                                  
 30580                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30581                                  	;
 30582                                  	;push	es
 30583                                  	;push	cs
 30584                                  	;pop	es
 30585                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30586                                  	;pop	es
 30587                                  	
 30588                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30589                                  	; ds = cs
 30590                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30591 00002A77 A2[5A1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 30592                                  
 30593 00002A7A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30594 00002A7D BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 30595 00002A80 CD21                    	int	21h
 30596 00002A82 C3                      	retn
 30597                                  
 30598                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30599                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30600                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30601                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30602                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30603                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30604                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30605                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30606                                  
 30607                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30608                                  fm_unlink:
 30609 00002A83 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30610                                  	
 30611                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30612                                  	;
 30613                                  	;push	ds
 30614                                  	;push	cs
 30615                                  	;pop	ds
 30616                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30617                                  	;pop	ds
 30618                                  	
 30619                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30620                                  	; ds = cs
 30621                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30622 00002A85 8A1E[5A1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 30623                                  
 30624 00002A89 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30625 00002A8C CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30626 00002A8E C3                      	retn
 30627                                  
 30628                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30629                                  
 30630                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30631                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30632                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30633                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30634                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30635                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30636                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30637                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30638                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30639                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30640                                  ;
 30641                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30642                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30643                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30644                                  ;
 30645                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30646                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30647                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30648                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30649                                  ;
 30650                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30651                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30652                                  ;
 30653                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30654                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30655                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30656                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30657                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30658                                  ;     lh
 30659                                  ;     /l
 30660                                  ;     1
 30661                                  ;     1000
 30662                                  ;     2
 30663                                  ;     print
 30664                                  ;     /d
 30665                                  ;     :lpt2
 30666                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30667                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30668                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30669                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30670                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30671                                  ; for:
 30672                                  ;    Each /L
 30673                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30674                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30675                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30676                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30677                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30678                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30679                                  
 30680                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30681                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30682                                  
 30683                                  ParseVar:
 30684                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30685                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30686                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30687 00002A8F 1E                      	push	ds
 30688 00002A90 06                      	push	es
 30689

 30756                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30757                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30758                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30759                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30760                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30761                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30762                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30763                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30764                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30765                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30766                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax. The 3-character rewind
 30767                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30768                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30769                                  
 30770                                  parseL:
 30771 00002AD0 AC                      	lodsb
 30772 00002AD1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30773 00002AD3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30774                                  
 30775                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30776                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30777                                  ; ------------------------------------------

 30780 00002AD8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.

 30782

 30784 00002ADF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;

 30786                                  
 30787                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip

 30789                                  
 30790 00002AE9 AC                      	lodsb
 30791 00002AEA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30792 00002AEC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30793

 30796

 30799                                  
 30800                                  	;cmp	al,'/'

 30802 00002AFA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30803                                  
 30804 00002AFC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30805 00002AFE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30806

 30808                                  
 30809 00002B00 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30810 00002B03 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30811

 30813

 30815

 30818

 30832                                  plE1:

 30878                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30879                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30880                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30882                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30883                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30884                                  ; USES:     ZF

 30887                                  isEOL:

 30889 00002B31 7406                    	je	short ieX

 30891 00002B35 7402                    	je	short ieX

 30893                                  ieX:

 30965                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30966                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 30967                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 30968                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 30969                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 30970                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30971                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 30972                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30973                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 30974                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30975                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30976                                  
 30977                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30978                                  stowUMB:

 30980 00002B5A 7202                    	jb	short su10

 30990                                  	;push	cs

 30993                                  	;pop	ds

 30995                                  	; 01/01/2023

 31000 00002B64 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31001 00002B66 2EA2[291F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31002                                  
 31003                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31004                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before

 31007                                  su20:

 31009 00002B6C 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.

 31078                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31079                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 31080                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 31081                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 31082                                  ; A-F are considered valid if gnradix is 16.
 31083                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31084                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 31085                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 31086                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 31087                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 31088                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31089                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31090                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31091                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31092                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31093                                  
 31094                                  gnradix:
 31095 00002B7D 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 31096                                  
 31097                                  toDigit:
 31098 00002B7F 2E833E[7D2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31099 00002B85 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 31100                                  
 31101                                  toDigit_hex:
 31102 00002B87 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 31103 00002B8A 7209                    	jb	short td10
 31104 00002B8C 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 31105 00002B8F 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'f' at all...
 31106 00002B91 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 31107                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31108 00002B94 C3                      	retn
 31109                                  td10:	
 31110 00002B95 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 31111 00002B98 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'? Not a letter...
 31112 00002B9A 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 31113 00002B9D 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'? Not a digit.
 31114 00002B9F 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 31115                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31116 00002BA2 C3                      	retn
 31117                                  toDigit_dec:
 31118                                  td20:	
 31119 00002BA3 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 31120                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 31121 00002BA6 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 31122 00002BA8 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 31123 00002BAB 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 31124 00002BAD 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 31125                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31126 00002BB0 C3                      	retn
 31127                                  tdE:	
 31128 00002BB1 F9                      	stc
 31129                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 31130 00002BB2 C3                      	retn
 31131                                  
 31132                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31133                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 31134                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31135                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 31136                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 31137                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 31138                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 31139                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31140                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31141                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31142                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31143                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31144                                  
 31145                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31146                                  
 31147                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31148                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 31149                                  
 31150                                  GetXNum:
 31151                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 31152                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31153                                  	;push	bx
 31154 00002BB3 51                      	push	cx ; *
 31155                                  	;push	ds
 31156                                  
 31157 00002BB4 FC                      	cld
 31158 00002BB5 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31159 00002BB7 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31160 00002BB9 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 31161 00002BBB 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 31162                                  
 31163 00002BBD 2EC706[7D2B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 31164                                  
 31165 00002BC4 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 31166                                  	;call	toDigit
 31167 00002BC7 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 31168                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 31169                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31170 00002BCA 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 31171                                  
 31172 00002BCC 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 31173 00002BCE 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 31174 00002BD0 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 31175 00002BD4 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 31176 00002BD7 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 31177 00002BD9 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 31178 00002BDC 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 31179                                  
 31180                                  gxn10:	
 31181 00002BDE 2EC706[7D2B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 31182 00002BE5 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 31183 00002BE6 46                      	inc	si
 31184                                  
 31185                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31186                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 31187                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 31188                                  ;        BX    = 0
 31189                                  ;        CH    = 0
 31190                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31191                                  
 31192                                  gxn20:	
 31193 00002BE7 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 31194 00002BEA 46                      	inc	si
 31195                                  
 31196 00002BEB E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 31197 00002BEE 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 31198                                  
 31199 00002BF0 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 31200 00002BF3 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 31201                                  
 31202 00002BF5 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 31203 00002BF7 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 if last add wrapped
 31204                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 31205                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 31206 00002BF9 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 31207                                  gxnE:	
 31208                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 31209 00002BFB EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 31210                                  gxnQ:	
 31211 00002BFD 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 31212 00002BFE F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 31213                                  gxnX:	
 31214                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31215                                  	;pop	ds
 31216 00002BFF 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 31217                                  	;pop	bx
 31218 00002C00 C3                      	retn
 31219                                  
 31220                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31221                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 31222                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31223                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 31224                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 31225                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 31226                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31227                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31228                                  
 31229                                  mul32:
 31230 00002C01 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31231 00002C02 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31232 00002C04 2EF726[7D2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31233 00002C09 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 31234                                  
 31235 00002C0B 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31236 00002C0D 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31237                                  
 31238 00002C0E 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31239 00002C10 2EF726[7D2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31240 00002C15 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31241 00002C17 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31242 00002C19 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31243 00002C1B C3                      	retn
 31244                                  m32E:	
 31245 00002C1C 58                      	pop	ax
 31246 00002C1D C3                      	retn
 31247                                  
 31248                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31249                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 31250                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31251                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 31252                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 31253                                  ; ERROR:   None
 31254                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31255                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31256                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 31257                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.

 31263

 31265 00002C21 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 31266 00002C23 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 31267 00002C24 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 31268 00002C26 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 31269 00002C28 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll

 31271 00002C2A 59                      	pop	cx
 31272 00002C2B C3                      	retn

 31274                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31275                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 31276                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31277                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 31278                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 31279                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 31280                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31281                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31282                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 31283                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 31284                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 31285                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 31286                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31287                                  
 31288                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 31360                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31361                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 31362                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31363                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 31364                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 31365                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 31366                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31367                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31368                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 31369                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 31370                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 31371                                  ;      ...
 31372                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 31373                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31374                                  
 31375                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31376                                  AddrToUmb:
 31377                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31378                                  	;push	cx
 31379                                  	;push	dx
 31380 00002C49 06                      	push	es
 31381                                  
 31382 00002C4A 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 31383                                  
 31384 00002C4C E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 31385 00002C4F 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 31386                                  
 31387                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31388                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 31389 00002C51 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 31390                                  
 31391                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31392                                  atu10:
 31393 00002C53 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 31394                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31395                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 31396                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 31397                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 31398                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31399                                  
 31400                                  ;atu10:	
 31401                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 31402 00002C55 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 31403 00002C57 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 31404                                  
 31405 00002C59 E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 31406 00002C5C 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 31407                                  
 31408 00002C5E 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 31409                                  atu20:	
 31410                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31411                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 31412                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31413                                  	; ax = es
 31414                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31415 00002C5F 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31416 00002C64 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 31417 00002C6A 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 31418                                  
 31419                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 31420                                  
 31421                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31422                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 31423                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31424 00002C6C 40                      	inc	ax
 31425                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31426                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 31427 00002C6D EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 31428                                  
 31429                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31430                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 31431                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 31432                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31433                                  
 31434                                  atu30:	
 31435                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31436                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 31437                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31438                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 31439 00002C6F 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 31440 00002C71 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 31441                                  atuE:	
 31442 00002C73 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 31443 00002C75 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 31444                                  atuX:	
 31445 00002C76 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 31446                                  	
 31447 00002C78 07                      	pop	es	
 31448                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31449                                  	;pop	dx
 31450                                  	;pop	cx
 31451 00002C79 C3                      	retn
 31452                                  
 31453                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31454                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 31455                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 31456                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 31457                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 31458                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31459                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 31460                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number

 31476 00002C88 48                      	dec	ax
 31477                                  cu10:	
 31478 00002C89 C3                      	retn

 32015                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32016                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 32017                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 32018                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32019                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 32020                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to first MCB in UMB (_not_ the 8+SC MCB that heads it)
 32021                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (too high)
 32022                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 32023                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32024                                  
 32025                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32026                                  	; (SYSINIT:3344h)
 32027                                  findUMB:
 32028                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32029                                  	;push	ax
 32030                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32031 00002D52 51                      	push	cx ; *
 32032                                  	;push	dx
 32033                                  
 32034 00002D53 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah		; Zap ah, so al==ax
 32035                                  
 32036 00002D55 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; Store the to-be-found UMB number in DX
 32037                                  
 32038 00002D57 E8D2FE                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns first UMB segment in AX
 32039                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32040                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 32041 00002D5A 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now...
 32042                                  
 32043                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32044                                  fu10:
 32045 00002D5C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; **
 32046                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 32047                                  ; FU10--CX - This UMB number; 0 == conventional
 32048                                  ;       DX - The UMB number they're looking for
 32049                                  ;       ES - The current MCB address
 32050                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 32051                                  
 32052                                  ;fu10:	
 32053 00002D5E 39D1                    	cmp	cx,dx		; If CX==DX, we've found the UMB we're
 32054 00002D60 7417                    	je	short fuX	; searching for--so exit.
 32055                                  
 32056 00002D62 E8D4FE                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 32057 00002D65 7501                    	jnz	short fu20
 32058                                  
 32059 00002D67 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ SYSTEM, we're in a new UMB.
 32060                                  fu20:	
 32061                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 32062                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32063                                  	; 19/07/2023
 32064 00002D68 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end 
 32065 00002D6E 7408                    	je	short fuE	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 32066                                  
 32067                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 32068                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32069                                  	; ax = es
 32070                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 22/07/2023
 32071                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 32072 00002D70 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32073 00002D75 40                      	inc	ax
 32074                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32075                                  	;mov	es,ax ; **
 32076 00002D76 EBE4                    	jmp	short fu10
 32077                                  fuE:	
 32078 00002D78 F9                      	stc
 32079                                  fuX:
 32080                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32081                                  	;pop	dx
 32082                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32083 00002D79 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 32084                                  	;pop	ax		; The address is already in ES.
 32085 00002D7A C3                      	retn
 32086                                  
 32087                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32088                                  ;*** BigFree - makes ES:0 point to the largest free MCB in UMB given as AL
 32089                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32090                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 32091                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to largest free MCB in UMB, AX returns its size
 32092                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (0 or too high)
 32093                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 32094                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32095                                  
 32096                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 32097                                  BigFree:
 32098                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32099                                  	;push	bx
 32100 00002D7B 51                      	push	cx
 32101                                  
 32102 00002D7C E8D3FF                  	call	findUMB			; Returns with CF if err, else ES==MCB
 32103 00002D7F 723A                    	jc	short bfX
 32104                                  
 32105 00002D81 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; Segment address of largest free MCB
 32106 00002D83 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; Size of largest free MCB
 32107                                  
 32108                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 32109                                  ; BF10--ES - Current MCB address
 32110                                  ;       BX - Address of largest free MCB so far
 32111                                  ;       CX - Size of largest free MCB so far
 32112                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 32113                                  
 32114                                  bf10:	
 32115 00002D85 E8B1FE                  	call	isSysMCB		; If we've left the MCB, we're done.
 32116 00002D88 7428                    	jz	short bf30
 32117                                  
 32118                                  	;call	isFreeMCB		; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 32119 00002D8A 26830E010000            	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 32120 00002D90 750C                    	jnz	short bf20
 32121                                  
 32122 00002D92 26A10300                	mov	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32123                                  	;cmp	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Compare sizes...
 32124 00002D96 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 32125                                  	;jg	short bf20		; Unless we're bigger,
 32126                                  	; 19/07/2023
 32127 00002D98 7D04                    	jge	short bf20
 32128                                  
 32129 00002D9A 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Store this new element's address,
 32130                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; and its size.
 32131 00002D9C 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 32132                                  bf20:	
 32133                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 32134                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end	; 'Z'
 32135                                  	; 19/07/2023
 32136                                  	;cmp	byte [es:0],'Z'
 32137 00002D9E 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 32138 00002DA4 740C                    	jz	short bf30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB.
 32139                                  
 32140                                  	;NextMCB es,ax			; Go on forward.
 32141 00002DA6 8CC0                    	mov     ax,es
 32142                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 32143 00002DA8 2603060300              	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32144 00002DAD 40                      	inc     ax
 32145 00002DAE 8EC0                    	mov     es,ax
 32146                                  
 32147 00002DB0 EBD3                    	jmp	short bf10
 32148                                  
 32149 00002DB2 8EC3                    bf30:	mov	es,bx			; Return the address
 32150 00002DB4 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			; Return the size
 32151 00002DB6 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 32152 00002DB8 7501                    	jnz	short bfX
 32153                                  bfE:	
 32154 00002DBA F9                      	stc				; (if size==0, there's nothing free)
 32155                                  bfX:
 32156 00002DBB 59                      	pop	cx
 32157                                  	; 01/01/2023

 32200                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32201                                  ;*** shrinkMCB - breaks an MCB into two pieces, the lowest one's size==AX
 32202                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32203                                  ; ENTRY:    AX == new size, ES:0 == current MCB
 32204                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB broken if carry clear
 32205                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if MCB isn't as large as AX+0x20 (not a useful split)
 32206                                  ; USES:     Flags
 32207                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32208                                  ; If the size of the to-be-split MCB isn't at least 0x20 bytes greater than
 32209                                  ; the specified new size, the split is useless; if it's only 0x10 bytes, that
 32210                                  ; 0x10 will be used to make a header that mentions a 0-byte free space, and
 32211                                  ; that just sucks up 0x10 bytes for nothing. So we make 0x20 bytes the
 32212                                  ; minimum for performing a split.
 32213                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32214                                  
 32215                                  MIN_SPLIT_SIZE	equ 20h
 32216                                  
 32217                                  	; 02/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32218                                  
 32219                                  shrinkMCB:
 32220                                  	;pushreg <bx,cx,es>
 32221                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32222                                  	;push	bx
 32223 00002DC8 51                      	push	cx
 32224 00002DC9 06                      	push	es
 32225                                  
 32226 00002DCA 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; Move things around... and
 32227                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32228                                  	;mov	ax,es			; save this one for later.
 32229                                  
 32230 00002DCC 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32231                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32232 00002DD1 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx 
 32233                                  
 32234 00002DD3 83E820                  	sub	ax,MIN_SPLIT_SIZE ; 32
 32235                                  	;sub	cx,MIN_SPLIT_SIZE ; 32
 32236                                  	;;cmp	bx,cx			; {New size} vs {Current Size-20h}
 32237                                  	;ja	short smE		; if wanted_size > cur-20h, abort.
 32238                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32239                                  	;cmp	cx,bx
 32240                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32241 00002DD6 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx
 32242 00002DD8 7228                    	jb	short smE ; (*)
 32243                                  
 32244 00002DDA 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 32245                                  	
 32246                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32247                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32248 00002DDF 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 32249                                  
 32250 00002DE1 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx
 32251 00002DE6 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],'M'
 32252                                  
 32253 00002DEC 01D8                    	add	ax,bx
 32254 00002DEE 40                      	inc	ax
 32255 00002DEF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; Move to new arena area
 32256                                  
 32257 00002DF1 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 32258 00002DF3 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 32259                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32260                                  	; ax > 0
 32261 00002DF5 48                      	dec	ax			; And prepare the new size
 32262                                  
 32263                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32264 00002DF6 2688160000              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl
 32265                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0 ; (**)
 32266 00002DFB 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax
 32267                                  	;mov	ax,'  ' ; 2020h
 32268                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+0],ax ; (**)
 32269                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+2],ax ; (**)
 32270                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+4],ax ; (**)
 32271                                  	;mov	[es:ARENA.NAME+6],ax ; (**)
 32272                                  
 32273                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32274 00002DFF E8A801                  	call	freeMCB	; (**)
 32275                                  
 32276                                  	; 12/12/2022
 32277                                  	; cf=0
 32278                                  	;clc
 32279                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32280                                  	;jmp	short smX
 32281                                  smE:	
 32282                                  	; 18/12/2022
 32283                                  	; cf=1 (*)
 32284                                  	;stc
 32285                                  smX:	
 32286                                  	;popreg	<es,cx,bx>
 32287 00002E02 07                      	pop	es
 32288 00002E03 59                      	pop	cx
 32289                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32290                                  	;pop	bx
 32291 00002E04 C3                      	retn
 32292                                  
 32293                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32294                                  ;*** hideUMB? - hides as appropriate the UMB in CL
 32295                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32296                                  ; ENTRY:    CL should be to a valid UMB number, and AX to its address (findUMB)
 32297                                  ; EXIT:     None; UMB is hidden as necessary
 32298                                  ; ERROR:    None
 32299                                  ; USES:     Flags, AX, CX
 32300                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32301                                  ; PRIMARY LOGIC:
 32302                                  ;
 32303                                  ; If the UMB is specified in the DH/LH statement, then:
 32304                                  ;    If the largest free segment is too small (check specified size), then:
 32305                                  ;       Pretend it wasn't ever specified, and fall out of this IF.
 32306                                  ;    Else, if largest free segment is LARGER than specified size, then:
 32307                                  ;       If /S was given on the command-line, then:
 32308                                  ;          Break that element into two pieces
 32309                                  ;          Set a flag that we're shrinking
 32310                                  ;       Endif
 32311                                  ;    Endif
 32312                                  ; Endif
 32313                                  ; If the UMB is NOT specified (or was removed by the above):
 32314                                  ;    Hide all free elements in the UMB
 32315                                  ;    If the flag that we're shrinking was set, then:
 32316                                  ;       UN-hide the lower portion of the shrunken UMB
 32317                                  ;    ENDIF
 32318                                  ; ENDIF
 32319                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32320                                  
 32321                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32322                                  	; (SYSINIT:3426h)
 32323                                  _hideUMB_:
 32324                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32325                                  	; ds = cs
 32326                                  
 32327                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32328                                  	;push	bx
 32329                                  	;push	dx
 32330 00002E05 06                      	push	es
 32331                                  
 32332 00002E06 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 32333 00002E08 E8B2FF                  	call	isSpecified	; Returns ZF set if al's umb was NOT specified
 32334 00002E0B 742D                    	jz	short hu_20
 32335                                  
 32336 00002E0D 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the size of the largest
 32337 00002E0F E869FF                  	call	BigFree		; free element in AX; put its address in ES
 32338 00002E12 7226                    	jc	short hu_20	; Oops. Errors mean skip this part.
 32339                                  
 32340 00002E14 50                      	push	ax		; TOS==size of BigFree in UMB (popped as BX)
 32341 00002E15 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		; Retrieve the user's specified
 32342 00002E17 E8AAFE                  	call	GetSize		; minimum size for this umb (into AX)
 32343 00002E1A 5B                      	pop	bx		; Now BX==BigFree, AX==Specified Size
 32344                                  
 32345 00002E1B 09C0                    	or	ax,ax		; If they didn't specify one,
 32346 00002E1D 741B                    	jz	short hu_20	; Skip over all this.
 32347                                  
 32348 00002E1F 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		; Ah... if (specified > max free)
 32349 00002E21 7607                    	jbe	short hu_10
 32350                                  
 32351 00002E23 88C8                    	mov	al,cl		;  Then mark that UMB as unused. Nya nya.
 32352 00002E25 E81DFD                  	call	unMarkUMB
 32353 00002E28 EB10                    	jmp	short hu_20
 32354                                  hu_10:	
 32355                                  	;call	isTiny		; Returns ZF clear if user specified /S
 32356                                  	;jz	short hu_20
 32357                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32358                                  ;isTiny:
 32359                                  	;mov	al,[fUmbTiny] ; ds = cs
 32360                                  	;or	al,al
 32361 00002E2A 800E[261F]00            	or	byte [fUmbTiny],0
 32362 00002E2F 7409                    	jz	short hu_20
 32363                                  
 32364 00002E31 E894FF                  	call	shrinkMCB	; They specified /S, so shrink the MCB to AX
 32365 00002E34 7204                    	jc	short hu_20	; Ah... if didn't shrink after all, skip this:
 32366                                  
 32367 00002E36 8CC2                    	mov	dx,es
 32368 00002E38 EB09                    	jmp	short hu_30	; Skip the spec check.. we wanna hide this one.
 32369                                  
 32370 00002E3A 89C8                    hu_20:	mov	ax,cx
 32371 00002E3C E87EFF                  	call	isSpecified	; If they specified this UMB, we're done...
 32372 00002E3F 7510                    	jnz	short hu_X	; so leave.
 32373                                  
 32374 00002E41 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 32375                                  hu_30:	
 32376 00002E43 88C8                    	mov	al,cl
 32377                                  
 32378 00002E45 E89DFE                  	call	hideUMB		; Hides everything in UMB #al
 32379                                  
 32380 00002E48 09D2                    	or	dx,dx		; Did we shrink a UMB? If not, DX==0,
 32381 00002E4A 7405                    	jz	short hu_X	; So we should leave.
 32382                                  
 32383 00002E4C 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx		; Ah, but if it isn't, DX==the MCB's address;
 32384 00002E4E E8E6FE                  	call	unHideMCB	; Un-hides the lower portion of that MCB.
 32385                                  hu_X:	
 32386 00002E51 07                      	pop	es
 32387                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32388                                  	;pop	dx
 32389                                  	;pop	bx
 32390 00002E52 C3                      	retn
 32391                                  
 32392                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32393                                  ;*** UnFreeze - Marks FROZEN elements as FREE
 32394                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32395                                  ; Entry:  None
 32396                                  ; Exit:   None; all 8+FROZEN elements are marked as FREE, from any UMB.
 32397                                  ; Error:  None
 32398                                  ; Uses:   Flags
 32399                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32400                                  
 32401                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32402                                  UnFreeze:
 32403                                  	; 03/01/2023
 32404                                  	;push	ax
 32405 00002E53 06                      	push	es
 32406                                  
 32407 00002E54 E8D5FD                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns with carry if err, else ES == MCB
 32408 00002E57 721C                    	jc	short ufX
 32409                                  
 32410                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32411                                  uf10:
 32412 00002E59 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; *
 32413                                  
 32414                                  ; ------------------------------
 32415                                  ; UF10--ES - Current MCB address
 32416                                  ; ------------------------------
 32417                                  
 32418                                  ;uf10:	
 32419 00002E5B E81900                  	call	isFrozMCB	; Returns with ZF set if MCB is FROZEN
 32420 00002E5E 7505                    	jnz	short uf20
 32421 00002E60 E8D4FE                  	call	unHideMCB
 32422                                  	; 09/09/2023
 32423                                  	; ax <> es
 32424 00002E63 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es ; *
 32425                                  uf20:	
 32426                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 32427                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32428                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32429 00002E65 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32430 00002E6B 7408                    	jz	short ufX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB.. that's it.
 32431                                  
 32432                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 32433                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32434                                  	; ax = es
 32435                                  	;mov	ax,es ; *
 32436                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 32437 00002E6D 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 32438 00002E72 40                      	inc	ax
 32439                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32440                                  	;mov	es,ax
 32441 00002E73 EBE4                    	jmp	short uf10
 32442                                  ufX:	
 32443 00002E75 07                      	pop	es
 32444                                  	; 03/01/2023
 32445                                  	;pop	ax
 32446 00002E76 C3                      	retn
 32447

 32451                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 32452                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if MCB is frozen, else !ZF
 32453                                  ; ERROR:    None

 32455                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 32463 00002E7D 7522                    	jne	short ifmX

 32476 00002E98 7507                    	jne	short ifmX

 32478                                  	;cmp	ax,'  ' ; 2020h
 32479 00002E9A 26813E0E002020          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME+6],'  '
 32480                                  ifmX:	
 32481                                  	;pop	ax
 32482 00002EA1 C3                      	retn

 32614                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32615                                  ;*** WalkMem - travels memory chain and returns carry clear if UMBs are linked
 32616                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32617                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 32618                                  ; EXIT:     Carry SET if MCB chain stops before 9FFF, CLEAR if stops >= 9FFF.
 32619                                  ; ERROR:    None
 32620                                  ; USES:     Flags
 32621                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32622                                  
 32623                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32624                                  	; (SYSINIT:3541h)
 32625                                  
 32626                                  WalkMem:
 32627                                  	;push	ax ; ?
 32628                                  	;push	bx ; ?
 32629                                  	;;push	ds ; ? ; 01/01/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:352Fh)
 32630                                  	;push	es ; ? no need to save contents of these registers ?
 32631                                  		   	
 32632 00002F0C B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...

 32637                                  um10:

 32639                                  
 32640                                  ; ------------------------------
 32641                                  ; UM10: ES = Current MCB pointer

 32643

 32650

 32990                                  ; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
